title: Very interesting
content: It was fun to see how the buildings looked long ago. Nice places to eat and shop in this area. Got there by the subway

title: Elegant homes and shaded streets
content: Really surprised to see the Plane trees lining the streets but should have guessed they would be in the French Concession. One of the most pleasant areas in which to walk in Shanghai. Plenty of restaurants and cafes as well.

title: Something Different & Lovely
content: The area Former French Concession was an impromptu visit I heard about one very good Indian Restaurant there. I must say I really liked the pace. The walk around in this area in evening is a sure thing and one must go!. I liked the restaurants, ice cream shops, shopping and the parks. There are lot many cafes too.

title: Lovely area with lots of opportunities to walk around
content: I happened to stay at a hotel in this area and really enjoyed all the shops, restaurants and nice parks that were within easy walking distance. The area felt relaxed and the many sycamore trees lining the streets gave a very nice atmosphere. This is a good area to stay or to visit when in Shanghai.

title: A different part of town
content: Had some trouble finding the area but had a western  meal and a change of scenery. Part of the history of the city.

title: Very European
content: Great little spot for bars and restaurants. Where the expats hang out on Friday and Saturday night. Good place to have a wine and watch the world go by.

title: Nice architecture
content: Really like the buildings there. Some of them used to be houses but now are mostly restaurants. It's great that the buildings are preserved to show the history. Very happening place and great to hang out. Would highly recommend to visit and have a meal here.

title: Lovely Walk
content: Not to be missed - a great walk taking you back in time lots of shops and restaurants - make sure that you have good walking shoes, water and a hat.

title: Very nice
content: Try to go there by bike, I was using moobike, and was very good option, was by the weekend tough, so lot less cars, I don’t know how would be during work days.

user_loc: 佛罗里达博尼塔斯普林斯
title: Great Walk
content: Takes you back in time with class--walkable area with cafes, shops and beautiful residences--not to be missed--the trees along are worth the visit

title: Bike ride in French Concession
content: When in China do as the Chinese do. We rented bicycles & a guide who took us around mostly in the French concession. You learn much about “organized chaos”, as bicycles, motorbikes, cars & pedestrians all move at their pace in many and all directions. You have to be attentive and very careful but it is very worth doing. One incredibly interesting thing is that nearly all motorcycles are now electric in Shanghai and no matter how old, they make NO noise, zero, nada. you don’t even hear them approach & pass you. It could be a little dangerous & tricky, but it shows the incredibly progressive way Chinese deal with challenges. To attack pollution & noise, they essentially moved their big cities to electric motorbikes.

title: Quaint neighborhoods
content: The FFC is a cozy neighborhood within a city. You can wander the streets & find street food, cafes, pubs, restaurants, shops, theaters- and so much more. It’s also a great place to hop on a Mo-bike & take a ride.

title: Interesting contrasts
content: This neighborhood offers really interesting historical contrasts with other areas of the city. Almost unique in China - neighborhoods with European style architecture, sycamore-lined streets, and shamelessly-gentrified (Wolfgang Puck) shops & restaurants. Make sure and head down an inner alley, to see life on the interior of the blocks of row houses. Very pleasant wandering & dining.

title: Very cosmopolitan
content: This is one part of Shanghai that no one should miss. There are dozens of very nice restaurants, representing food from all corners of the world. Not to mention the shops! A truly cosmopolitan part of the city where one can sit any time of the day of night and watch the world go by while enjoying a drink or a meal.

title: A pleasant respite
content: When you need a break from the exotic aspects of Shanghai the French Concession provides a very pleasant yet still fascinating place to visit.

title: Loved walking around the French Concession
content: I learned a lot about the history of Shanghai walking around the former French Concession. It was very impressive and not what I expected. There are a range of very creative clothes shops in some of the old buildings, which made it worthwhile.

title: A great place to walk around.
content: I downloaded a walking tour on my phone and walked around 8 Km around this fantastic part of Shanghai. Great architecture, very green. Nice and quiet. Most motorbikes are electric so you do not hear them coming. Wandered around this area for around 3 hrs.

title: A touch of Paris
content: Best seen on foot.Followed a Lonely planet walk and saw so much of historic interest.Well priced shoe shops and the glass gallery is amazing

title: Business trip
content: One of the best places in Shanghai.

title: Well worth a walk to soak up the atmosphere
content: Stroll around; take in the atmosphere; have a coffee and enjoy people watching, Would be happy to revist and eat at a restaurant Well done for retaining the area

title: A lovely relaxing visit
content: With beautiful architecture the Former French Concession is now a vibrant and varied restaurant area and is a really lovely area to visit

title: Historic
content: The architecture is great. The shopping in upscale market is different experience. The eateries in the area are very nice

title: Don't miss it !
content: The French Concession is now very trendy for local Chinese and French living altogether in Shanghai and are pleased to enjoy a relaxing moment of sharing a glass of Champagne or a good table like they used to do in the past.

user_loc: 斯洛文尼亚卢布尔雅那
title: Interesting from a historical view, otherwise a tourist trap
content: can't really see much from the times of the French concession, it is "renowated", ok you can feel a bit more European arrangement of the street life, it is relaxed, not too crowded, but... not so special after all.

title: beautiful area
content: my daughter lives in this area so we spent a good deal of time here. the whole area feels very european and calm. tree lined roads and lovely parks are plentiful and there are lots of places to eat and drink. subway access to the rest of the city was good.

title: Must visit area in Shanghai
content: French Concession area is one amazing district of Shanghai. The area is almost like an oasis within very busy Shanghai "megalopolis". There are several parks (e.g. Fuxing), museums etc, that are well worth visiting. One must dedicate more than 4-5 hours for that area of the city alone. And finally, Taikang Road, vibrant shopping area, that deserves visit or several visits on its own. Some very good noodle restaurants on the North end of Fuxing park

title: Peaceful, Safe & Beautiful
content: Walked over here looking for some high end shops for gifts and stumbled across a lovely area of Shanghai seemed like a world away from the city centre, was pretty quiet and very chilled. Would have loved to spent more time here.

title: An unexpectedly peaceful area in Shanghai
content: Take time to walk around. Small streets, trees, small shops, parks, only few cars or motor bikes. Dont forget your camera!

title: Inspiring
content: Shanghai is an extraordinary city. And this is because it has very nice and original sites that you can't find anywhere else. This is one example. Is there any other Asian city that had so important "western concessions"? So, Shanghai was divided into the Western powers and French Concession was just a small part of France in Asia. Therefore it has a special charm and it is a great place for walking around, shopping or having a meal

title: Great for shopping
content: Definitely preferred this area for shopping over the big brand area. Lots of nice souvenirs (tacky and non tacky).

title: Favorite part of Shanghai
content: I like non touristy areas, although parts of this area do cater to tourists, we stayed in the more local areas, going for dumplings in a neighborhood spot and coffee in a local cool place. I wish there had been more time to explore this area.

title: Nice neighborhood
content: Stayed at a hotel in the French Concession. They have several nice parks to walk around. There are a lot of mature trees.

title: Quaint, lovely part of Shanghai

title: One of the Most Inspiring Neighborhoods
content: Read up on how business was done here since the 1920s and learn how to do business in 2018. So much history, so many cross-cultural experiences. Love it.

title: Nice part of town with restaurants
content: If you want to eat, you will probably find a nice restaurant here. Otherwise the area is quite small, quaint and a good place to imagine how old Shanghai looked. Also, bars, shopping, a movie theatre.

title: Fun neighborhood - good food and shopping

title: Lovely spot for a lazy lunch
content: I loved Shanghai and a visit to the Former French Concession district just cemented the beginning of what will be a love affair! We just turned the corner and suddenly found ourselves in a square full of cafes (with outside tables and chairs), all very tempting.

title: Must Go Area in Shanghai
content: French Concession is by far the most beautiful part of the city. Lost of ancient alleys, buildings from former glorious times as well as surprising backyards with classy cuisine and spots for top notch shopping. 100% recommendation.

title: Assorted coffee and eateries with French atmosphere
content:
pleasant stroll through lanes lined with french facades.
ample coffee and eateries  providing a wide variety of tastes.

title: Lovely place a must see
content: Lovely place. Personally I like the old part better than the renovated part with the new restaurants and shops.

title: This is why Europeans love Shanghai
content: Hinting at glory days gone by, the FFC is tree-lined and full of architectural and historical interest.  Where else can you find decaying villas that revolutionaries and writers escaped to selling for tens of millions of dollars?

title: The French Concession
content: A little oasis away from the busy streets. French style buildings with some shops and places to sit and have a snack or coffee and soak up the atmosphere.

title: European feeling in the Orient
content: The same trees of France. Rooted here more than 150 years back. So green, quaint, beautiful architecture. Love it.

title: Great area to stay

title: Back in time
content: After a visit to the stunning but rather cold skyscrapers of Shanghai, this lets you travel to the very heart of the action, where locals blend with foreigners.

title: Nice walk
content: Very nice place for walking and small shopping. One of mustsee points in Shanghai. Wide variety of restaurants.

title: Worth a stroll
content: We loved the area, had a Starbucks becuase it was so hot. Must see as part of Shanghai culture. There were a lot of photo ops and some great restaurants.

title: A typical 1930's house of a wealthy Chinese family
content: Our guide took us to the French Quarter and we were able to see through a typical house.It was interesting to get an insight into what life must have been like. There is an art gallery there that had some cartoons drawn of street people going about their every day life.

title: beautiful colonial remnants nestled amonst ultra-modern buildings!
content: We walked around here, enjoying the European feel to the laneways. The produce, restaurants, coffee shops and people made us feel as though we had stepped through a window in downtown Shanghai - straight into Europe.

title: Maze with lots of shops selling similar products
content: Nothing wrong with touristy shops, what we did not enjoy was the smell. There was a sort of saliva/mild sewage smell that frankly, is prevalent in many parts of Shanghai. If you are looking for souvenirs like Chinese Cheongsam, key chains, Chinese fans, etc, this place has them all, not particularly cheap though. Many shops post up a "no bargain" sign.

title: Tourist place
content: If you are around, you could have a walk. But directly going there, I wouldn’t recommend. To many similar locations, not „authentic“ So better search for real local places.

title: Nice Place To Walk Around
content: The Former French Concession area is a prime residential neighbourhood catering to expats. There are a lot of really nice restaurants and the streets have nice trees that offer shade and its quite a nice place to walk around.

title: Living here, not visiting
content: Well, this is by far the most intimate and charming part of Shanghai. Low rise buildings from the 1920s and 30s, built by French architects. Most streets are tree-lined and the traffic is slow. Great to cycle around and pop into one of the many cafes, all competing to serve the most delicious coffee, restaurants or small boutiques when you are bored of galleries. Do drop into the small neighborhoods and side streets and see people sitting in front of their houses chatting, surrounded by cats and dogs. Very peaceful.

title: Gorgeous little town
content: It is amazing what this little town in the middle of the big Shanghai makes you feel.

title: The best place in Shanghai
content: The FFC is hugely diverse. It has modern and old buildings next to each other. The strong French influence is evident everywhere. Beautifully restored buildings and architecture give a sense and flavour of Art Deco France.

title: The whole world culture in this quarter!
content: Shanghai is the whole world! Not the N.Y.! Here you can see the influence of the western civilization inside the heart of China culture!

title: Stunning Area
content: First area of choice when visiting Shanghai to stay is in the old French Concession.

title: Lovely
content: A small piece of France. Excellent bakery. A good selection of restaurants. A lovely sojourn throughout day ao ideal for lun h or dinner.

title: beautiful
content: this part of the city is pretty beautiful. the buildings are old and many are restored. its pretty nice to just walk through, feels like europe really.

title: the European heart of Shanghai
content: Despite the several closures of restaurant and bars very recently ordered by the government, it remains one of the best part of the city for a dinner, a drink or even just a walk. European architecture (not only French, but also German, British, etc) and Chinese lively atmosphere.

title: Great Vintage and Luxury Resale
content:
Pawnstar is a great Vintage shop in the French Concession. It was my main reason for heading in that direction. 

I love the tree-lined streets and all of the shops!  A great place to just walk around.

title: Wonderful Area

title: Nice European architecture

title: Nice place to visit

title: Nice place to hanhout

title: okay to visit

title: French Concession

title: Go for a wander

title: Nice neighborhood
content: It was fashion week in Shanghai and it took place in the French concession area. It’s an older area that has been updated and upgraded from when families used to live many people to a small home. All the small homes are gone and turned into a high rent apartments with lots of trendy restaurants in the area. I wish we had skipped this part of our tour. It wasn’t really worth the wasted time. We saw a lot of models and there were activities due to fashion week so interesting people watching but not much else to do here. There is one historic place where the first meeting of the National Congress of the CPC took place in this area, but our guide didn’t let us see it so all in all a waste of an hour. If you go here in the evening for the restaurants your good.

title: Strolling

title: A must Walk place
content: One of the most typical features of FFC are its gorgeous tree-lined avenues, which are perfect for long walks. When in the FFC, you can't miss the huge variety of hip cafes and restaurants, concept bars and breweries, boutiques, art galleries and antiques stores. Culturally, the FFC is pretty high on our meter. To absorb the best of the FFC, focus on the following streets: Wukang Lu, Fuxing Lu, Tai'an Lu, Dongping Lu, Julu Lu, Taojiang Lu, Wulumuqi Lu, Yongfu Lu, Xinle Lu and Changle Lu.

title: Historic Place

title: French Concession is the heart of Shanghai

title: Best Area in town
content: This is hands down the best area to visit and stay at when you are visiting to get a feel for this interesting metropolis. Architecture, history, boutique shops, restaurants, bars. For a business visit or if you only want to see highlights maybe not the best area. Try one of the historic grand style Chinse hotels like JingJiang. Maybe not always top rated but certainly interesting and good value. Or the (Okura) Garden Hotel for Asian luxury.

title: A different Shanghai

title: A must
content: The small streets with the multitude of both more traditional and very modern small shops create a very pleasant atmosphere for a walk and a discovery of where local people enjoy the Saturday afternoon.

title: Gorgeous area
content: One of the best areas of Shanghai - feels like a Chinese Greenwich village - great shopping and eating - take time here

title: good atmosphere

title: Enjoyed the small tree-lined streets

title: Beautiful, but not exactly typical China
content: On my half-day city tour, this was one of the stops. We walked around for a bit, seeing some very nice high-end stores and outdoor restaurants. I'll have to go back one day...

title: Colonial Times
content: The French Concession area now consists of trendy cafes, shops, galleries, restaurants and museums. There are still good examples of the houses with stone-framed entrances and mansions. Very walkable area.

title: Shanghai’s soho
content: While most of the original buildings have been torn down, the area has preserved its atmosphere, helped by low rise housing, cafes and boutiques.

title: Lovely area
content: Nice place to meander through-cute shops-many great little restaurants and bars. Had a lot of fun. Many westerners walking through the area so you do feel like it is a bit touristy

title: Great place to shop and eat
content: This area has a lot of outdoor dining and shopping. It’s large with lots of different cuisines to chose from. Good for anyone and good for wheelchair. Taxis out front. Take a stroll or just sit outside and eat and people watch.

title: One of the best areas in Shanghai
content: My wife and I visited the French quarter during a trip to Tokyo, Shanghai and Beijing. We liked the style of this area. For us definitely one of the best areas in Shanghai. Also very nice for shopping. Very special: A lot of nice trees.

title: Must do in Shanghai
content: I’m not sure what the French did when they were in China, apart from building a replica neighbourhood to what one would experience in Paris. The Brits, Americans, Germans and Russians were too busy making money but at least they gave us the Bund. The French Concession area is lovely with it’s Plane Trees and delightful buildings. Don’t miss Fu Xing park which is a favourite of the mainly older residents of the area for their outdoor activities. We booked a tour with Shanghai By Bike and it was great having a local explain some of the history.

title: Beautiful Walks
content: I love the French concession for its beautiful boulevards and interesting small restaurants.

title: Frenchy China
content: Well if you come to China and unless you are on a long trip or really intrigued by History, don't find a reason to visit the French.

title: Interesting architecture
content: I like the architecture and history of the area. Good to take a rest from all the shopping and walking. Food wise - it's good quality Western food, but you can't find any authentic Chinese food there. Why visit Shanghai to eat steak and pizza?

title: Lovely area to walk around visitor friendly tree lined streets
content: We had such fun wandering around the seemingly endless number of little nooks and crannies in this neighbourhood in search of treasures at a good price.

title: Beautiful tour that is surprising
content: Walking through the French Concession is like walking through the streets of a European city but this is in China.  The buildings, trees and shops blend together to give the visitor a real treat.  I enjoyed this tour immensely and it is well worth doing.

title: Meh
content: The French lived here, but they are long gone. Now it's just shops like everywhere else. Some old buildings but you won't miss much if you don't go.

title: Awesome day with lots of good food
content: Loved or here. Went for a long lunch, a walk through all those cute side streets and had an amazing dinner. This is a must see when visiting Shanghai.

title: Surprising area in Shanghai
content: I imagined all high rise apartments throughout Shanghai, but the French Concession area has plenty of low set, three storey townhouses with beautiful courtyards that provide a place of serenity. The streets are wide and the footpaths are too. Fairy lights along one of the streets goes for miles and is full of nice shops to visit.

title: The best of Shanghai
content: I have often stayed in the area and never get tired of walking the tree lined streets. Especially beautiful in Autumn this is the place I direct people to visit if this is their first time in Shanghai.

title: Green, leafy streets
content: Want to get away from the crowds? Visit and stay at French Concession! Lots of restaurant options. About 10 mins walk from multiple train stations. Green streets that are not overrun. Feels like locals live and shop there.

title: Hidden Gems and Lovely Cafes
content: The French Concession is one of the highlights of Shanghai. You can spend hours walkijg to those narrow alleys and dining around many lovely coffee shops or taking beautiful photos of the old streets.

title: Great place to stroll around
content: Spent time walking this neighborhood, loved seeing how people lived in the past and present. Stop and check out one of the local places for dumplings - authentic and awesome.

title: Walking tour of the French Concession
content: Dvir Bar-Gal, of Tours of Jewish Shanghai, organised a great French Concession walking tour with very experienced tour guide Anfisa. From pick up outside the famous Fairmont Peace Hotel to the guided walking tour of the French Concession, Anfisa continually provided us with her understanding of the European and Anglo-American influence on Shanghai over the past almost 200 years. And, I have to mention her beautiful personality and command of the Mandarin language - impeccable. As a small group if 10, we were well handled and driven safely and comfortably 'around town'.

title: Expensive
content: We enjoyed great people watching and good, highly rated restaurants on a nice day. Clean & interesting architecture with shops & eateries in converted buildings.

title: Best place to discover the Old and New Shanghai come together
content: Don't visit Shanghai without touring the French concession. Try to get through some of the smaller streets in between the buildings and discover how thriving the place still is. There are many connecting small lanes that you can walk easily. For runners, you can easily find good ways to zig zag around HuaiHai Lu to make your way to the Bund. Donghu Lu is a good place to stop and have a drink. You can go south from there and discover as well the small streets with lots of yummy food

title: A breathing space in the city
content: The Former French Concession is a wonderful green area in the giant city. Low buildings, small shops, loads of coffee shops and just a lower pace. Remember to visit the smaller streets and go into the shops with local designers.

title: Love it here
content: Must visit!

title: Lovely section of town
content: Awesome place to stay. So many options for street food, the dumpling place on the corner near the metro is great. So many retail shops in the area, fruit, meat, baked goods, and convince stores. The hipster restaurants are worth trying too. We ate at the Mexican bar and enjoyed tasting a different take on Mexican. The French bakery Pan Chaud was exceptional, we has baguettes for breakfast 2 days in a row. We we're able to buy butter at a convenience store around the corner, the bakery would not sell us any. Overall, felt that this location was a great choice for our family, we never lacked for food options.

title: Relaxing in French concession
content: The French concession is a great place to relax and enjoy a meal or a drink

title: Just beautiful
content: For a brief moment you actually feel that you are in Paris.  Shade lined streets, bistros, dining outside, then you can merge into the area called Tianxifeng, where there are wonderful shops.

title: History oozes out of the architecture
content: You can feel a real sense of history and change walking around the French concession areas. Lovely on a Sunday afternoon to wander aimlessly through small back streets. Some great bars, restaurants and shops about in this area

title: Don’t miss it
content: This area shows how chic and elegant Shanghai is. Beautiful shops and allies and lots of places to eat and shop. Don’t miss the more local areas which are not so developed but give a sense of the real urban Shanghai

title: Beautiful but crowded
content: A beautiful piece of history from old Shanghi with lovely architecture. Not a place to be if you are uncomfortable with crowds.

title: SUCH A CONTRAST TO CHINA
content: The French Quarter is a small area in strake contrast to China. There are quirky streets to explore and lots of outdoor coffee shops and restaurants. The architecture is typically French and there is also a French bakery.

title: Interesting place.
content: Did not know the French had a connection to Shanghai.  Nice shops and restaurants and nice place to spend time.

user_loc: 明尼苏达明尼阿波利斯
title: Stay here
content: Great neighborhood. We stayed here for our 10 days stay. This neighborhood has everything you need to walk the streets and enjoy the culture. Food, entertainment - just fun walking around! Good subway access too.

title: Just beautiful
content: The French Concession is the more beautiful part of the Old Shanghai, more beautiful than the British District. It's also the more expensive district for living and for going out. Here you can find lots of good, high quality restaurants. And it's worth to take a walk through the streets and parks.

title: Beautiful at night
content: Ambiance was beautiful especially with the tree lined streets. Early March was still a little cold. Would love to revisit during early fall and enjoy some live jazz I saw advertised.

title: Great example of Chinese appreciation of Modern World
content: Some westerners may find this place like back to home. This area is like a European small village. The food choices and shopping is super expensive compared to other places in China. Hats off to Chinese authorities to keep this place There are some theatres and Cinema halls which shows international hit movies. Near by there is the Birthplace of Chinese Communist Party if you are interested in modern history of new China.

title: Bit of a letdown
content: Those expecting a rerun of Haussmannian Paris will be left disappointed - it's still a pleasant neighborhood, but lots of character has been eroded by tacky high rises and "modern" villas. Still worth a stroll though.

title: A dozen different cuisines in one block. Good place to eat non-Chinese food.
content: Very different foods offered. Both European and different Asian. The only disadvantage is that the best places in this restaurant district are so popular among both locals and foreigners that you usually have to get an electronic queue ticket and wait for around a half an hour. The bright side is that the waiters can usually tell you the approximate time when your table will be ready, so you can actually go walk around instead of just waiting at the entrance.

title: Unusual place in a bustling metropole
content: The concession is rather unique. Much of the older architecture is like being in some areas of Paris. It is, however, distinctly Chinese as well. In the quarter, there are many restaurants and caters to tourists but one can find some interesting distractions here. We visited the former residence of Sun Yat-sen and his wife, as well as the former HQ of the Communist Party in the 30s. It is also enjoyable to simply wander the streets of the quarter and see what you find.

title: The French made their presence known..
content: If you go here then you are going to see what is left of the French influence in Shanghai. You are going to look at French architecture, and not a lot of it. The area is small and occupied by small boutique type shops. Maybe a nice to stop for coffee and some expensive shopping but in my opinion not much else. If your looking for diet coke in the area your going to have to walk several blocks away from there to find it. It was a good think our tour guide knew where to find it.

title: Overhyped
content: Had hoped for more French concessions. A few remnants of French occupation do not merit the write-ups in travel brochures. Probably a guided tour explaining the significance of particular buildings would help. There are no plaques or commentary and as one blogger has said, there is no clearly designated zone.

title: Good one
content: Former French Concession - Wonder about those days as you take really interesting walk through this historical place.

title: Couldn't find it
content: Even after extensive research and subway journeys  still couldn't find the French Concession area. We'd been there b4 with a tour group and was lovely but tried hard to find by ourselves and couldn't even with help from locals.

title: Best Place to walk
content: It's just so beautiful to walk around French concession , Specially during CNY . my girlfriend and i will get up in the morning and just walk around , So lucky that i live around .

title: Very diverse sights
content: This is a great area to do, especially with our guide Harris Gu who we got through trip advisor. They have some great restaurants and lots of different shops.

title: What's not to love?
content: Think cute little shops a-là Paris or indeed London -it has a certain Sloane feeling to it, definitely- and the overall vibe of the French Concession make it just the area for any homesick westerners who're looking for a bit of home in China. Full of impossibly young, good looking people and the artsy types that you'd normally see hanging around in nice little cafès around the Latin Quarter.

title: You can spend hours getting lost in the beautiful architecture!
content: The old french concession is a little gem in Shanghai. You really do not feel like you're in China.

title: Stunning
content: Great old architecture; a quiet oasis in such a bustling metropolis. Recommend taking a walking tour around the area.

title: one of the most beautiful neighbourhood in Shanghai
content: Just down south from Nanjing Road, another main artillery of ancient Shanghai converging with the new Shanghai is Huaihai Road. This is French town, the former French Concession. One of the only preserved concession areas remaining (apart from the Bund). Is this why Shanghai is called Paris of the East? Maybe there’s more to it.

title: Must visit to see another side of Shanghai
content: Small, tree lined streets. Architecture very European. Loved all the small restaurants and shops. Beautiful options versus all the lights and glitz of the downtown areas.

title: Worth the walk
content: Old and interesting. The buildings are very different to traditional Chinese buildings. You will find the boxing cat pub around here too. Standard Western Europe pricing, beer and food

title: Drinks with friends
content: Nice place for a night drink away from the tourist area. We went into the Friends Bar (248 Taikang Rd (Within 田子坊 | Tian Zi Fang) having huge mojitos, beers and chinese snacks in a friendly atmosphere. The owner Andy spent some time with us chatting in a very friendly way. You can also try the water pipes with the flavour you prefer out of a list. Bar is Recommended for the ones going in this area.

title: Great walking street for shoppers and wanderers
content: If somehow you want to get lost, this is the place. I love spending time walking along streets, trying different kinds of food, visiting co-working space and meeting some young and cool artists.

title: wish i could live here
content:
Great cafes, quiet to walk around, shaded with trees and funky bookshops. 
Love the old houses in this area.

title: Not impressed
content: I wish they had more information for this place.  You walk around and no signs anywhere.  You need a guide for sure.  Disappointed I was expecting something more well kept.

title: The Place to Explore!
content: The French Concession is the walking district that's full of interesting shops and restaurants - you can literally walk for days, exploring everything this very large, tree-lined area has to offer. A fascinating place!

title: French Consession
content: We visited the French Concession on the basis of 'tourist to do' recommendations. Though we enjoyed the stroll and had lovely food, unfortunately we found little to excite and little to recommend to tourists through this review, sorry. Perhaps if we had a historical guided tour in the area, we may have felt differently.

title: World cuisine
content: A place to have an evening meal. Many restaurants run by native French/Spanish/Italian/Indian/North Africa

title: interesting part of the Shanghai history
content: Shanghai is fast growing and modern city, this place shows a bit of the quite recent history. For those, who do not look for shops and skyscrapers...

title: Wonderful neighborhoud
content: Absolutely a must. Take a stroll, wander around and get lost here. Couldn't believe I was still in China. The whole area is so magical and plenty to discover from little shops and alleys to bars and restaurants. Kept going back.

title: It's like home
content: Go here if you want some proper food. If you're fed up of dumplings, soggy veg and sticky rice this is where you need to go. It's got afternoon teas, steakhouses, Italian etc

title: Good place
content: Many shops in this area, restaurants and mall everywhere. You can find vegan restaurants in this area.

title: Unusual district
content: Borgogne 1930.It is an unusual district.Ocre colored briks with houndred of hangclothes like stairs...neverseen before.

title: where is it
content: We tried using google maps, pre loaded as it does not work in China, but we could not locate an exact location for this. We believe we saw some sections but couldnt find others. Great for a walk around though.

title: Old Colonial Place
content: While on a tour in Shanghai, there are lots of old but interesting places to visit as a reminder of the city's past. This Former French Concession area is well preserved and never remodeled as part of history. The place reminds that Shanghai is where commerce and tourism is long known for. So many foreigners come to visit and stay. A historical place to remember.

title: favorite area of shanghai
content: I love the french concession,  you feel like you're walking in another world. fun little touristy shops and cafes

title: A walk to remember
content: Lovely place to take a walk, lots of nice cafes and small shops to hop around with a lovely classy old-times vibe to it!

title: an amazing amount of history to learn and absorb
content: Simply outstanding, queued for almost an hour, its worth it, and its free. as we went on a Sunday, tourists . Then go through security with our bags.

title: Very interesting
content: The various concessions in Shanghai are areas given to various countries. This is one of the best. We visited the area for food & drink on an UnTour guided night visit, see review for UnTour Shanghai. All the concessions need a quick visit, but if time is short visit this one.

title: Paris of the Orient
content: Well,  if you like Paris because of its small shops,  cafes with nice decor,  little gardens,  greenery...  you cannot afford to miss the  French Concession. Full of stylish Art Deco era houses.  Every twist and turn presents surprises,  may it be

title: Take your time, walk around!
content: If you have kids, it is best to see this area during the day. Lovely shops and markets to see, tree-lined avenues, great places to eat and drink.

title: I'm torn due to the commercialization
content: So this place has a big pro and big con, hence my average rating.

title: Best place for brunch, good coffees and cafes and generally good eating
content: A great part of town that you can spend a couple of days wandering around. Well worth the time and it will be punctuated with stops to high-quality cafes and generally great food.

title: Beautiful scenery
content: We escaped here from downtown Shanghai and spent around an hour. Walking around the cobble streets and buildings was a wonderful experience.

title: French air at Shanghai
content: Mainly the trees along many of the streets at this concession gives you the feeling of not being at Shanghai at all,... and the little shops, little signature restaurants and coffee shops, and little boutiques here and there. Otherwise, also crowded with stylish Chinese restaurants and high end shopping malls and ultra famous brands all over the place

user_loc: 加利福尼亚曼哈顿海滩
title: A Great Area for Shopping and Eating/Drinking
content: The French Concession is a beautiful neighborhood in Shanghai. There are lots of tree lined streets, magnificent homes, great little shops and places to eat and drink. If you have some time to wonder the streets in Shanghai, I higher recommend you head to the French Concession!

title: A Special Piece of Shanghai History
content: Shanghai is starting to preserve some areas that allow you to see and feel the history of the city. Even though lots of the buildings may have been pulled down, cleaned up and then rebuilt, you still get an idea of what the area was like in the early 19th Century. The streets are full of trees, and there are lots of smaller shops, restaurants and hotels. Try to allow some time to walk through the area and see the Cathay Cinema, Garden Hotel and the amazing terraced homes situated behind the shops.

title: Worth seeing for the novelty
content: It's quite an experience to see old French architecture in a Chinese city and interspersed with Chinese daily life and cultural symbols.

title: Great Place to wander for several hours
content: Must spend time here on your trip to Shanghai!  Spend some time before your trip learning about the history of...

title: Wonders of china tour
content: A total must if in this location plenty of places to eat or take coffee, was a huge queue for...

title: nice area
content: very nice area for some shopping and walking. different than the rest of shanghai. compared to nanjing road its very...

title: Not sure what I expected
content: The French Concession is worth the visit. My rating might be unfair as it was different to maybe what I...

title: Great for lunch and dinner
content: A European sector in the heart of Shanghai offering outstanding places to eat food easily recognized by Westerners.  Nice shopping...

title: Busy
content: We stopped there for a just a little, the area is nice with lots of restaurants and shops. Not quite...

title: Great place to solitaries and meet friends
content: We went with a group but had a bit of free time so went into the bistro and had a...

title: variety of shops!
content: the place where you can by souvenirs... what i like most about this place is the food selection. so many...

title: A great place to stroll
content: We covered all of the highlights on a tour but wanted to come back to this neighborhood to try some...

title: Nice stores
content: The place is like a small town with a mixture of shops selling different interesting stuff. There are also nice...

title: Treelined Streets That Take Your Breath Away
content: The French Concession is very modern but has a sense of history. Uniform trees line up most if not all the streets here. There are tons of both well known brand stores and lesser known shops along with many of Shanghai's top restaurants. In addition you see beautiful parks and a lot of historic sites. Take your time and explore all the nukes and crannies of this cool section of Shanghai.

title: Great stop !!
content: We loved this area. You could see the locals going about their lives. They were dancing, playing cards, singing etc. It gave you perspective of how much more they spend time in the park interacting with others. The rose garden when in season would be a gorgeous sight !!

title: Great Aera
content: To visit the garden or to do shopping. This is the place to be for tourism. You can stay 1/2 day or 2/3 hours

title: Beautiful district
content: This is an easy metro ride to get here. It is a beautiful area has every street lined with maple trees. The food is amazing. Take a few turns and find a restaurant for the local noodles.

title: Great Area
content: This is a great walking area full of history, good places to eat and lots of shopping is available.  Definitely worth a visit.

title: Great night iut
content: If your in Shanghai and want a nice night out this is a great place - many bars and restaurants available here. At the time I visited it was raining heavily- found a great restaurant- bar. Got a seat at the bar and spent the evening drinking vodka and tonic - was it expensive? No not really - from 1800 - happy hour drinks at about £5 a shot so not too bad at all! Very pleasant - no trouble and a great atmosphere

title: Good cafes for Asia standards
content: This place reminds France and the coffee shops are an invitation to seat and have good coffee with a view of China. Nice to look around the architecture

title: An elegant district with top end stores
content: This is a good area to do some some walking and shopping. Upscale shops and pedestrian friendly sidewalks.

title: Lots of French influence in an area packed with cool shopping, cafes and history
content: We followed the DK guide's 90 minute walk around the French Concession area and found a great mix of architecture and history. We visited Zhou Enlai's former house, a busy park , cool mansions and artisan shops down narrow alleys akin to Camden in their vibe. Just enjoy strolling down French boulevards in China! Definitely worth a visit.

user_loc: 卡罗莱纳州戈尔兹伯勒
title: Europe in China
content: Looks like you stepped out of Asia into London or Paris or even Charleston, SC for a time. Charming restaurants (BREAD etc,, was awesome french pastry and western style food stop), shopping in Tianzifan, strolling around and taking in the sights including the Plane tree lined streets. Very nice area.

title: An interesting part of Shanghai to visit
content: This is an interesting part of Shanghai. There are many interesting streets and shops to look in including unusual craft ones. Once off the main arterial roads there are less crowds making it easy to walk around.

title: Loved it!
content: It is a place with many restaurants and shops it is very very clean and restaurant have great design! It is a very nice area in shanghai

title: Shopping
content: If you like shopping this has it all. From very expensive to less expensive. The mall area is expensive but great for quality even if you have to pay for it.

title: Lots of cute little shops and tiny alleyways
content: Great area to walk and poke around for souvenirs and gifts to take home. Very crowded so not great for claustrophobes- but worth it otherwise.

title: Great place to stay
content: We stayed in the French Concession for a week on our last trip and it was a great place to experience another side of Shanghai. The stores there are a little more expensive but with Tianzifang and the subway stop across the street, it was super convenient and fun. With a little exploration, you can still find good local eats (just watch the locals line up) and bargains. The kids loved the arts and craft and toy shops in Tianzifang. If you have a little girl, make sure to go home with a hand crafted music box! You can pick your own decorations and music and it'll be an experience and memento she'll never forget!

title: Explore your French Concession
content: Allocate 3-4 hours and explore. It has all the shops you can wish for, street food, designer stores, boutiques, restaurants, malls, department stores, hotels, skyscrapers, business district. Enjoy the experience

user_loc: 新罕布什尔州贝德福德
title: OK to people watch or shop if you have expensive taste
content: Nicely kept shopping/hip/bar scene area. Plenty of expensive stores for shopping and lots of bars and restaurants. Near where many expats live. Not sure I would make it a destination but fine if you will be there.

title: Great shopping
content: Some nice places to eat and great stores for all kinds of shopping.  You can even learn some history.

title: Lovely area
content: Beautiful area of a city. We stayed there for 2 days while being in Shanghai for a music event. Leaving in Macau for me this was a nice away trip from busy Chinese lifestyle while most of the landmarks were still not hard to get to with subway.

title: A part of history.
content: A wonderful area of Shanghai with an amazing history.  Great to see so much of it preserved.  I wish that we had had more time to explore.

title: Ok if you are looking for quality restaurants.
content: This place is frequented by food snobs and has all the high brow restaurants that you'd expect.

title: Fuxing Park is a delight
content: The community that gathers at this park just invites you to take part. People are singing in a choir, taking dance lessons, exercising, and playing games. It is so much fun. It was great to get to see this side of China. That's what makes China Odyssey the way to go. We requested and they responded.

title: Wow
content: Miki Tours took us here at night. What a great experience! Our driver dropped us off and with our guide saw this fascinating area. We also had yak dumplings, yak pie, and yakmilk tea in a Tibetan restaurant before moving on to a private restaurant in a house where we had a typical Shanghai dinner , cooked by a very handsome man who also sang for us ( he is an opera singer) . Our driver picked us up from different areas of this Concession while our wonderful guide Cindy plus Miki guided us through the fascinating maze of the French Concession.

title: Nice
content: There are some nice and aurhentic buildings here. Good to spend half day and feel the colinial spirit.

title: Pleasant area
content: This is a nice area with some great bars, cafes and bakeries to satisfy your craving for western food and coffe.

title: Quite interesting
content: Various areas. There are some great shops for clothes not designed but not poorly made and they will alter dressed within a few days if you have time. Lots of European restaurants and also of course Chinese. Huge queues in Starbucks Prices can be quite high in some cafes. Easy to access on metro and 30p fare is a bargain. Busy but not crowded when we went. Friendly atmosphere. The restored houses were beautiful and a real change from old and dilapidated plus the concrete high rises. Glimpse of past? Place full of contrasts as is china itself

user_loc: 坦桑尼亚达累斯萨拉姆
title: Nice place
content: Nice place to visit and wander around, mainly on weekend. Small shops and loads of restaurants. Highly frequented by foreigners but still not much touristic as other venues in Shanghai. Love It by day more than night as shops open and more animated.

title: Nice place for a stroll
content: The French Concession area is green and leafy, nice for walking, restaurants, bars, some shopping. It’s a nice respite from the crowds.

title: Interesting place to wander
content: Great area to wander and take in the architecture for a few hours.

title: Not worth the trip
content: Not really worth the trip just more cafes and a few shops, one lovely statue and that is about it.Why the tourist guides take you there I do not know apart from the fact that it is free

title: Nice area with an interesting history
content: We were schooled on the history of the Concession split in Shanghai as a former colony. The area definitely caters to the younger crown and there were some very happening places to eat at. The landmark seems to lack historical sights as part of its history, but it was a nice stop nonetheless.

title: WASTE OF TIME.
content: Don't know why our guide took us there, complete waste of time, seems today its just a couple of streets of mainly restaurants and a few expensive shops.

title: Not at all like "The French Quarter"
content: I expected to find this as a French section of Shanghai similar to how New Orleans, USA has a French Quarter. There is absolutely no similarity and nothing different or special compared to any other part of shanghai. Looks like this history has already been forgotten.

title: Lots of bars and restaurants
content: I have stayed in the French concession area. It is known for its bars and restaurants and offers both Chinese and western types of cuisines. It's an east meets west type of area, where you can clearly see foreign (mainly European) influence in the architecture. Foreign tourists usually populate the bars at night. The atmosphere is casual and fun.

title: Absolutely fantastic
content: Great area with a lot of history and where the French influence has been retained. Easy to lose yourself for a couple of hours so make sure you give yourself time to explore.

title: Beautiful and enchanting
content: Walking around the French Concession is one of my favorite activities in Shanghai. Be sure to check out the Propaganda Museum for a truly unique experience.

title: french it is
content: fancy but not crazy Pricey... ambiance was great..mostly for expats and if you get tired of eating chinese food then this is the perfect place to look for food that serves foreign dishes

title: Want to visit again.
content: My favorite place in the city. Full of fine bars, restaurants, cafes, souvenir shops, ice cream shops, and more. And, the local people who come to this place seems to be from better educated upper middle class families and they don't misbehave compared to other locals.

title: Where East meets Western hipster
content: I love this area, which is why I chose to live here! Wandering through the streets with a camera, ducking in and out of beautiful old colonial alleyways that have now been absorbed into daily Chinese family life, is a fascinating way to spend a few hours. There are brilliant options for independent cafés, restaurants from every cuisine, high brow cocktail bars and boutique shops. The French concession, although perhaps a little pretentious at times, seems to largely escape being elitist. There are lots of local (and bargain priced) Chinese shops and food places too and it is not just an area for the wealthy. Many of the formidable old French mansions have been broken up into little apartments where ordinary families live. It is a green oasis with tree lined streets reminiscent of Provence and a surprising island of relative calm and cleanliness amidst a sea of urban jungle.

title: A lovely neighborhood
content: A great little place to just wander through and enjoy the atmosphere or to enjoy a wine and /or a meal. Lovely old buildings with greenery all around, boutique shops, arts & crafts, restaurants, fountains and live music. A very busy and popular place, a great area to visit when in Shanghai.

title: What a delight!
content: What a nice neighborhood, you don’t even feel you are in China, a complete different world, very classic and offer a lot of options for dinning (breakfast, lunch and dinner) as well as places to walk around and enjoy the architecture...

title: Not that interesting
content: We expected something colonial and just got shopping centres with high class prices and designer clothes.

title: Worthy of a stroll
content: Relatively small area of the city with shops and restaurants. Very few truly "French" elements remain, so don't let the name fool you, but it is a nice contrast to the new areas of Shanghai.

title: Nice small streets, but a bit underwhelming
content: We visited in the evening, expecting a bustling area with restaurants and bars. In fact, we walked along empty streets with few places to sit down (we visited the recommended Maoming, Shaanxi, Fuxing, Nanchang etc streets as well as the big shopping street Huaihai). We probably need to go back and explore more, but the main issue is that the area is massive and even with advance research it's hard to know where to go.

title: Re: family w/older kids
content: We went as a sub touring BC we all was tired by end of day, it was OK but small. 1 couple that's French says the place is nothing French. Eateries appeared OK but pricey.

title: Favourite French Quarter
content:
We enjoyed our walk through the French Quarter.  It was a maze of tiny streets, leading to nowhere at times; but filled with interesting shops and cafes.

You would need two hours to traverse this area.  Even at nighttime, we felt safe.

title: Tranquillity in Shanghai
content: There are probably arguments about what area now constitutes the former French Concession. Some day I will break out a map and try to walk the whole area. I consider it to be the area north of Xujiahui, sort of Hengshan Road north and west towards Huaihai and Ferguson and extending beyond.

title: Adorable area
content: Great area, where the chances of meeting more english speakers are huge! Most of the expats are there. The streets are small and cute. A lot of great food places and shops.

title: Nice place
content: Its very nice, i like history, if you like go to visit. The build is old and new is very beautiful. Don`t lose time and visit it.

title: Another side of Shanghai
content: I really enjoyed my stroll through the former french concession and would highly recommend it. There are many small cafes, food stalls and young artists. You should at least have 2-3 hours time to enjoy the shops and the atmosphere.

title: Great neigbourhood during day and night
content: Its a beautiful area with many small shops, bars and restaurant. Great massage places abd some clubs around. Nice location to look for a hotel.

title: Nice to walk around
content: Nice streets with old trees for shade - very much appreciated in hot weather. Architecture nice to look at. Like the guidebooks say, this suggests the atmosphere of past times. I certainly felt it was a light a relief from the modern Shanghai. Expensive shops. Easily access by underground.

title: visit to shanghai
content: very disappointing nothing special- just nice streets. so full with stores and commercialized. the architecture is different from Chinese style but one can see in other places in the city as well . the read tea room is an ordinary nice place one can see every else as well

title: French Style neighborhood
content: It's a residential area which is very big with french style houses and restaurants and bars Good place for walking and looking for architectural beauty. Either you can wander or you should know exactly where you want to go.

title: My favourite part of the city
content: The French Concession is HUGE and every street tells a different story. I would recommend booking a guided tour to understand the history of the houses and its former residents. You can just walk along this area and lose yourself in it, discovering little Chinese boutique shops, bars, coffee shops, restaurants and interesting things to see. Pop into former residency buildings as lots of them have been made into a place to visit and learn more about Chinese writers. The most famous streets are Fuxing Road (long, long road!), Wulumuqi Road (so much to do and see!) and Changle Road (also long, long road!). Perfect area for a cosy brunch, drinks on the weekend (especially Donghu Road), coffee breaks and scenic strolls along shaded trees and French architecture.

user_loc: 哥伦比亚特区华盛顿特区
title: Best part of cury
content: The streets are charming to stroll. Tree lined with a feeling of history. Don't miss Zenlife for pottery or Breads etc for lunch.

title: So lovely...
content: It's an authentic trip to past in a city getting more and more modern. Charming buildings and old houses, take your time to stroll around the area. Beautiful!

title: Beautiful architecture
content: Been there with few friends for a dinner, I was amazed by the rebuilding of the properties, its remaining the architecture in Europe, a beautiful place to spend an evening.

title: Difficult to find but fun to visit
content: This place was not easy to find as it was hidden in a small alley. It was quite crowded when we visited on a Sunday afternoon. There were lots of shops selling souvenirs, street food, drinks etc. We had a ma la (spicy) beancurd which was really good. Tried a stick of sausages but the taste was normal, nothing awesome. Overall, a great visit but probably would give it a miss on a rainy day as there is no shelter except in the shops which are relatively small (unlike shopping malls).

title: Interesting part of town
content: Was so nice to walk around the tree lined streets on a hot day . I did some research and followed another's walking tour of French concession made it so

title: Fascinating colonial history
content: There are many interesting aspects to this former French part of the city - fascinating architecture and large residences, now all tidied up with shops and restaurants scattered around. You can spend a good half day exploring this part of the city.

title: My favourite place in the city!
content: The former French concession is a must-visit! This place is full of charming old buildings with a touch of modernity. Filled with good restaurants, cafes and shops. Great place to relax and unwind from the hustle and bustle of the city.

title: A bit of history
content: Worth going to if you have time. There is not too much to see as the area has been renovated and the homes for the old rulers were closed when we went there.

title: Wonderful respite from the intense Shanghai hustle and bustle
content: I loved wandering about the French Concessions with its intimate cafes and shops. We strolled along Ferguson Lane and loved the extensive examples of early 20th Century architecture and the meandering tree lined streets. With all the sprawling development and endless forest of high rises, the French Concession offers a welcome respite and a sense of relief that Shanghai had carefully retained it's Old World charm

title: Beautiful
content: It's a beautiful street to walk at night with your partner. Great for shopping as well & there are many restaurants & cafes along the road which are open late night.

title: Vibrant and a great, but expensive trip out at night.
content: Worth a visit, but tends to get very crowded.Restaurants are quite expensive and for many locals this is a special night out. Trendy and quite hip; people are having fun, which adds to the atmosphere. Some great buildings and light effects.

title: you must see this
content: this is a amazing sight even though you will see thousands of tourist here. try to find the local tea store it is in a building on the second floor. only Chinese people will buy there tea there. the architecture is really beautiful and it gives you a idea how all has looked a few centuries ago. it is worth a visit.

title: Area to be in Shanghai
content: This is a large general area but the best place to spend your time in Shanghai. Long, wide streets are covered by beautiful trees and there are plenty of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants.

title: Very interesting area
content: This is a very nice area to visit. It is very pretty, most buildings have been recently renovated, but keeping in the style they were originally. There are plenty of bars, restaurants and boutique shopping.

user_loc: 印度德里国家首都辖区
title: Mini Paris
content: This is a place for younger, couples, peaceful dining & drinks.

title: Romantic concession with lots of history
content: Shanghai French Concession neighbourhood is one of which I often want to come back to revisit, just to stroll around, taking a little relaxation, enjoy its vibe and casually select various F&B to unwind and de-stress. Several historic buildings in the area that reminds me how Shanghai was hundreds of years ago. Must visit site in Shanghai in my opinion

title: Full of Life
content: Excellent place to experience the real Shanghai and everyday life away from the tourists and maddening crowds. Highly recommend this area which is convenient and accessible.

title: Only place left to experience the "old Shanghai
content: With so much development In shanghai the French concession area is one of the only places left where you can enjoy some the old Shanghai charm. Tree lined streets, quaint shops and restaurants along the side of the streets. A good reprieve from the hustle and bustle of the mega city surroundings

title: Nice part of town and very different
content: This is a nice part of town and really quite different to the rest of the city, loved the tree canopies over the streets, little cars and cafes and shops

title: Walking the French concession
content: Nice streets and shopping. Cool place to wander and shop! A few swanky restaurants too. Could be anywhere in the world.

title: This is a very big District so know where your going.
content: I was disappointed here as I read some reviews that gave the impression there were quaint little pockets of French bakeries etc to sit and enjoy a French ambiance. Well I was wrong. Its huge and we walked for hours settled on lunch in a up market diner and saw lots of big modern shops along the main street. Perhaps I just dint know where to go but we did ask several ex pats and were told there were cool parts. I didn't find them.

title: A little gem in the middle of a hectic city
content: Exactly what we have been looking for after running up and down the busy Bund, and shopping centers at Pudong, a lovely little neighbourhood with cozy restaurants and bars, small boutique shops, and very green alleys with little traffic... a perfect environment when taking an easy stroll around an otherwise bustling city.

title: Quaint
content: The buildings and architecture  of this lityle area was beautiful and just wish our tour had seen more of this. Instead of commerical shopping strips

user_loc: 新西兰奥克兰中心地区
title: Lovely at night
content: We visited at night so got to see all the lights.  Plenty of variety of bars and restaurants for an evening out.

title: It just a normal street or quarters without a knowledgable guide
content: Me as a foreigner who stay 14 years in Shanghai dare to say if you visit this area without a tour-guide, don't dream you will enjoy by the book. There are plenty of history happen in this area which is very interesting to know how it evolved became modern Shanghai today. When I explained to my friends, they were impressed the history n enjoy walking under the tree like in Paris :-) I strongly suggest get a short day tour, is worth.

title: Nice place but not Shanghai
content: We visited many places in shanghai and stayed in another district. The french concession doesn"t seem chinese. Also the restaurants are expensive!!

title: Nice place for a walk
content: Providing the Shanghai summer isn't too oppressive then this area is great for a walk around. Some nice coffee shops, bars etc but nothing in particular of interest.

title: A piece of Europe in asia
content: This is my favorite district in shanghai!you can find cozy cafes and nice boutiques. There are plenty of restaurants where you can go for dinner and lunch, I personally find it better during evening time as it makes it even nicer. The small houses reminds me of Europe and is a great escape from the tall skyscrapers of the city! You also find some shopping malls and a lot of western restaurants! I always go there when in shanghai and I strongly recommend to visit it!

title: Cozy charming district
content: I can imagine this is perfect to walk around on a nice fall evening. Unfortunately it was rainy and hot when we went, however still it was very much worth the visit. Wandering around you discover something cute and exciting around every Corner, you can definitely find some good cafes and Restaurants there too.

title: Very Romantic
content: Very popular shopping and dining spots in Shanghai for tourists and locals. The tree-lined avenues and their many Tudor mansions in the area still retain an air of the "Paris of the East". We stopped for wonderful Heffeweisen beer at the Paulanier pub. Great Time.

title: Nice Area
content: We had to extra free hours with the driver that were good enough to see this district. It's not that big, there are some good cafes and restaurants.

title: A little slice of Parisian life among a Chinese city.
content: Very clean, a well done replica of a Parisian multi street and small squares. Lot's of french eateries. Local girl and guys dressed to impress and maybe be found by talent scouts to do commercials etc. I would have missed it, but found people watching a lot of fun.

title: A chilled out stroll on a weekend morning
content: The French Concession is a delight. The tree lined streets combined with an abundance of small cafes and restaurants makes this the perfect place for a stroll at the weekend and a lazy brunch.

user_loc: 澳大利亚大墨尔本地区
title: Very modern area
content: It's a lovely designed area with beautiful tree lined streets and a lot of restaurant bars and very expensive top end shops with prices to match in all the businesses down there even the food and drink venues.

title: Need to be here
content: This is one of the best places to visit in Shanghai, for walking, eating, fun, drinks its almost everything, very nicely built with moder stores, some streets are just great, you have to visit.

title: Changing rapidly
content: The old town is disappearing and replaced by fake tourist traps or tall buildings. A lot of chain restaurants.

title: Nice
content:
Nice place for pubs and souvenir shopping
Expensive and hard to bargain
Not good at rainy days
Crowded at weekends

title: Food and Entertainment
content: If you're looking for a great place for great food in Shanghai, and you would like local food with a foreign flair, look no further than the French Concession. It will be a taxi ride from where you stay, but taxis in Shanghai are fairly cheap. For about a 40 minute ride the cost was about C$10. While you are there you will be able to walk around and look at all the menus, architecture and restaurants in the area. It is a great nighttime activity, just to relax and get away from the daily routine.

title: Strange
content: It's strange to see a bit of Europe here. Everything is very well maintained, maybe a little to much so that it feels a bit like a theme park. The old dirty vibe is gone.

title: Charming Streets with a French Flair
content: We had such a fun time walking around the French Concession. Tree-lined streets with lots of little shops and cafes. Not as many bicycles on the sidewalks, as in other cities, so it was a little easier to window shop.

title: A mix of East and West
content:
Beautiful buildings with a mix of the ancient East and West. Nice to walk around in.

Closest hotel would be the Langham hotel.

title: Place to be, day or night,
content: At night time there are plenty of bars and restaurants to discover; during the day the cool little shop-lined alleyways of Tianzifang in particular call out to be explored. Even out of the alleys, the streets are tree-covered and the (relatively) well maintained buildings give it a very different feeling from much of the rest of the city.

title: Nice French architecture buildings
content: Very old French style buildings and architecture all around. Lot of nice small and big places to eat out and hang around. Definitely do AirBNB

title: Eateries Galore
content: Great place to eat with a whole street of nice restaurants. No need to book. We went to one place three times. Busy place and nice to people watch.

title: Great part of town
content: We loved walking around this area of town. Lots of great cafes, boutiques, restaurants, and bars. We ate at a few different spots and bar hopped to get both local and international beers. Even though it was almost 100 degrees, the shaded streets and lots of bars with cold beer made it pleasant! A must-see of Shanghai.

title: Not as good as expected
content: It was cooler and much darker here due to the heavy tree cover, the cicadas were very noisy. The pavements have people riding down them without lights so beware in the dark.

user_loc: 卡罗莱纳州温斯顿塞勒姆
title: A great place to spend a day....
content: The French Concession is a must see in Shanghai. Start your time here with a small coffee and croissant and spend your time walking around and seeing the sights. There are numerous small traditional streets to go shopping and to be ready to bargain. Most have mostly touristy souvenirs, but some shops have real items for sale.

title: Great place to walk
content: Take a long and slow walk. You will be in China and in Europe in the same time. It is a chance to feel how European part of Shanghai looked some time ago.

title: Fantastic for a stroll
content: Great place to take a stroll and watch life go by. The architecture and the locals should entertain in equal measure.

title: Great place to chill and people watch
content: This area while looking exclusive, has a very chill vibe. The buildings are beautiful and there are plenty of places to shop, eat and drink.

title: History buffs paradise
content: Intresting buildings and lay out not much of the original to see but the stories of the area are quite impressive if you have the right guide

title: My favourite area
content: I grow and live near Former French Concession area(Xu hui District). I have deep love about the area. There are a lot of restaurants with different foreign cuisine. The tree-shadow streets and quiet beat and cozy atmosphere and bunchs of foreigners. Also it is very convenient for me to get there from all directions in SH by public transportation.Former French Concession is one of fantastic and fasinating areas in Shanghai with legend history.

title: Old Europeen architecture  with great restaurants and boutiques
content: Charming area with beautiful trees and water fountains with an Old Europeen feel and many pedestrian streets to look at boutiques, bakeries, art galleries or enjoy one of the many terasses and outdoor cafes.

title: Wait I'm in China??
content: Felt like we were in Europe! Amazing history and really cool.  This area has tons of shops and outdoor restaurants.  Great area day or night.

title: French Concession - not much left
content: Christianity was important to those who lived here during the years of the concession. The Roman Catholic Cathedral was completed in 1910. It is a solid Gothic style red brick building , dwarfed by massive development works. Inside is shabby from lack of funds.

title: Walk through the early 1900's as if it were yesterday
content: The winding streets of the French Concession are a sight to behold, as Tesla's roll across the streets under aged but beautiful buildings. There are little mom and pop shops in the nooks and crannies in between and in front of the buildings. Take a moment to enjoy local breakfast on your early morning walk!

title: must visit
content: Now this is a place to visit during day and night as they offer two different things at different time. beautiful shops and fantastic bars and restaurants

title: A true Colonial Experience in period townhouses and streets.
content: A complete contrast to many neighboring streets forever developing in this bustling and expansive city.Home to mostly European families and businesses in the 1920s through world war II,kept in good order with fascinating Colonial architecture against a backdrop of modern China.

title: French buildings
content: very interesting place to visit, if you are interested in old French architecture, many sreets, shops and restaurants around

title: Charming!
content: Very nice area to walk, to explore Shanghai, lots of little boutiques, restaurants, etc. it is easy to get there and find the way out.

title: Always worth a day for exploring
content: If you are a people watcher or window shopper the old French Concession is virtually a must in Shanghai. I go there during each visit and find new and different corners, nooks, and crannies to explore. Not quite the Shook in Jerusalem but if you're not amused you didn't wander far and long enough, or you belong either on the gilded shopping streets or flea markets. There is great stuff in the concession - both for gifts and self - as well as chatchkies and waving cats.

title: Good place for lunch
content: Being in the French Concession made me feel like I wasn't in China. These area is filled with history and many great places to eat. A must for lunch or any outing!

title: A piece of European history in Shanghai
content: Former French concession is a pretty sizable area in Shanghai.  Take a walking tour or just walk around yourself in the tree lined avenue.  I used DK Eyewitness Travel book when I visited Shanghai.

user_loc: 新西兰奥克兰中心地区
title: Get lost here for the day
content: A charming area full of little boutiques, craft and food outlets. Right next to SML Mall if you need some 2017 style shopping too. The French Concession is well worth the visit to get a feel for Shanghai history which is surprisingly brief with most development only happening since 1840. We stayed in an Airbnb lane house and found this area wonderful, relatively quiet and a delight to wander around at any time of day. Also great transport access for subway in SML and plenty of cabs passing through.

title: Great neighborhood
content: We had dinner last night in the French Concession. I was very impressed with the cute boutiques and restaurants in the areas . The clothing shops especially had unique items . It was more quaint than many other areas in the city.

title: Great Foodie soit
content: A must to stroll around this area. So many great places to admire and eat at. Not a great spot to visit if it's raining.

title: Charming, am I really in China?
content: I live in Beijing and always love the stroll in this part of Shanghai when in town which reminds you of the diversity Shanghai went through compared to other parts in China. You'll always stumble into niche cafe/bar or boutique clothing store. If this is your first time to Shanghai/China don't miss out on this great little historical patch of town

title: A lot of history
content: We drove through at night and with the lights the place was surreal. Definitely worth a visit and with our coach driver giving some commentary we learned a lot of the history.

title: The Shanghai French concession is a must in spring and fall
content: There are a few cities on earth that are absolutely charming in spring and fall. Shanghai is one of them and the French concession is the epicenter. Morning breakfasts in one of the many bakeries and coffee places now. Afternoon lunches in one of the theme restaurants faux Italian, faux French, even the McDonalds is in a restored avant garde building. Dinner and then the "jazclub" into the night. Worth any romantic weekend.

title: Adorable
content: A lot of the buildings are being remodeled, so careful with all the bamboo everywhere. Exceptionally quaint and fun to walk through. Visited a coffee shop in one of the buildings, made friends with a cute cat.... seemed about right.

title: Relaxing atmosphere heaps of cafes
content: We went there one evening for a look around and a bite to eat. We were shown Jackie Chan's house on the end of the walkway. It has some green creepers growing up the front wall and the Godiva Bar opposite to it.

title: Very nice place to have a walking andr relax
content: Away from the bustled Shanghai center, the French Concession is a nicep lace to have a walking, discovering cozy shops and enjoying food and drinks until night. TOTally safe even not so crowded in some areas.

title: Night Visit
content: Visited the former French Quarter and Xintiandi area for an evening stroll and experience. This area has some historical sites to see but this is best done, if your interested during the day and perhaps on a guided tour. If like me you were interested in a light meal and a beer be ready to leave with a light wallet. The area is aimed at visitors and their money and I left very disappointed. Worth the visit to see the well preserved architecture of the former French inhabitants.

title: Stroll around
content: As with anything in a big city without a lot of it's own history (compared to the rest of China), this neighborhood with it's tree lines streets feels different from the rest of China. A little cozy, find the right streets and alleys and you get fun shops and restaurants, other streets are just pleasant to stroll down in the shade.

title: Great "European" Experience In China
content: The former French Concession is like a little city within a city - totally quaint and unexpected. Old, very well preserved buildings are now occupied by various western restaurants which almost all have outside seating like you would see in Europe.

title: An interesting area, popular with westerners and reminiscent of Paris neighborhoods.
content: This was a stop for our tour group to spend some leisure time. It's an attractive, cosy neighborhood styled after Paris with open air coffee shops and some high end shops. The area we walked was also closed to vehicle traffic (might have been some delivery scooters), and there were lots of narrow alleyways. We felt safe. There were lots of westerners hanging out here. It's a nice place to spend a couple of hours.

title: Visit to French Concession
content: We visited many historic sites in the French Concession......beautiful area of Shanghai! Love the architecture of the buildings! Went to Former Residence of Sun Yat-sen, and his wife's residence after he died.....Soong Ching Ling. Both were extremely interesting for those that like history! Also went by the Former Residence of Zhou Enlai, but it was closed until September for remodeling. Great to walk the streets of this area! Also went to the First Party Congress Of the Communist Party Museum in Xintiandi. Also visit Shanghai Jiao Tong University near the French Concession....I've done this on other trips. Jack was a very knowledgeable and great tour guide! Super day! Thanks!

title: Not China and not even France
content: Not a real China, expensive galleries, ecpensive food, "artists" all around. Nothing to see. Should be the last on your "what to do in Shanghai" list.

title: Feels like France
content: The Former French concession area feels like a "Mini France" as the building style there is way different from the others in China. There are cafe and book stores nearby and it's a great place to go.

title: Very interesting market place, where new meets the old
content: A very old colony/residential area converted to new shops/restaurants and tourist area.
