Could see how the old houses were and how they have been converted by the Govt. to a very happening place. Lot of art work around, lots of experimental things, good buildings also and lot of rush of people, but mainly westernized people.

title: Love it!
content: I loved the architecture,  the parks, the fancy shopping. It was beautiful, with tree lined streets and shuttered windows. ❤

title: Always a Great Walk Through History
content: Always a great place to walk around and discovery new places. The tree lined streets, lane ways and great bars and restaurants. There is always something new to see and discover.

title: a must in Shanghai to see
content: I did stayed in twelve hengshan luxury collection hotel thre and this area is the most beautiful one in Shanghai. in this area there a lot of bars and huge selection on restaurants

title: Great for walks
content: Many parts of Shanghai are good for being explored by foot and this is particularly true for the Former French Concession. You can easily spend a few hours strolling along the plane-lined alleys and the small streets with the old houses and all the little shops. There's so much to see! When you need a break you can sit in one of the many cafés, lots of them have rooftop terraces. If you're staying in the city for a few days I'd recommend reserving one afternoon for the Former French Concession. You'll also find a great variety of restaurants there for dinner afterwards.

title: My Favorite Marketplace
content: I stumbled across this place when I was walking around looking for something for dinner - boy am I happy I found this! Such a unique experience with all the shops and restaurants buried in the alleyways. Even if you're not looking for something to buy go here for the picture opportunities!

title: Nice place
content: I go to this place with metro but cant access to this place so easily, no body can help u. The concession was so many beauty and u can visit so many European tourists here.

title: Nice area with lots of resturants
content: This is a great area to walk that has lots of great places to eat and to grab a drink and sit outside.

title: I lived here for 2 years
content: If uour an ex pat in SHANGHAI. 99% you will be living here.  Uts the olace to be and be seen. Great bars. Clubs. Restaurants and amazing architecture of beautiful homes built back in 1890 ++

title: Dinner
content:
A great place for dinner & watching the cosmopolitian residents enjoy this area
All International Cusine is available

title: Vibrant Location
content: Spent an enjoyable couple of hours drinking beer and people watching in this very busy location. It seems to be the place to see and be seen in. Very popular with young people. Loads of restaurants to choose from.

title: A view of older Shanghai
content: The narrow streets and small buildings of the Tianzifang area give you some sense of what Shanghai might have been 100 years ago - but it is over-filled with with gift shops, restaurants, jewelers etc.

title: A village within a city
content: A great little area full of restaurants, shops, bars and a very pleasant area to wander around and absorb the atmosphere, some streets are pedestrians only. Wonderful old buildings and tree lined streets, a more leisurely pace than the main city streets. Shanghai Fashion Week was on during our stay and this was a great place for people watching.

title: French Consession
content: In two separate trips to Shanghai I have spent several days on each trip walking through the various streets and parks in the French Concession. I thoroughly enjoyed wandering, eating steamed buns and looking into tiny local shops and the big stores too. During the day Fuxing Park is splendid along with the smaller parks too. For American food Al's diner is great for breakfast or lunch with amazing blueberry pancakes! At night the Shanghai Brewery or the Liquid Laundry are super. Walk the smaller streets too so you can see how the locals live.

title: This is a great weekend spot.
content: Wonderful stores, restaurants and architecture of Old Shanghai. Great for Lunch or dinner and strolling.

title: Restaurants and shops
content: Little shops, restaurants and tiny bars or you can just take a walk through the labyrinth of narrow streets.

title: Old Charm
content: There is a good feeling about the French Concession area with restaurants of all taste, Bars and shopping.

title: Yet Another Face of Shanghai
content: You know that you have happened upon a special locale when you learn that both Sun Yat-sen and Zhou En-lai had residences here. It continues to be a preferred upscale area for those who can afford it. The tree lined streets, now an obstacle course in places due to the current anarchic bicycle rental system, are reminiscent of Edwardian Europe and the profusion of boutiques, restaurants, craft breweries and the ubiquitous Starbuck’s make this a desirable destination during the day or evening. The streets are safe and act as a magnetic, constantly drawing you back. Our favourite spot in ‘old’ Shanghai.

title: Pleasant area to wander around
content: A beautiful area of tree lined streets, old buildings and coffee shops.

title: heaven
content: this area has been beautifully restored and must be visited.  We returned a couple of times, enjoying Hagans coffee house with its delightful pastries and breads.

title: very nice place for tourist
content: this is highely recommanded place to visit, many old buildings, art shops, cozy cafes and many other interesting things you will see in this area

title: Wonderful walking neighborhood
content: My son lives in Shanghai and wanted us to see all the historic neighborhoods.  Great place to walk...many restaurants, shops, etc.

title: Upscale trendy place to hang out
content: This area had great bars, interesting shops and groceries and upscale chains like Godiva chocolate. After not having sweets for a few weeks the chocolate was very welcome. It's a beautiful area with nice restaurants too. There was a grocery that had an assortment of Serrano hams!

title: Quite a change of pace
content: We enjoy roaming around in the French district every time we come to Shanghai. It is very peaceful and shady compared with most of Shanghai. In some places I forget I am in China at all since it actually looks and feels quite European and many westerners, especially the expats, liv here.

title: Lovely to stroll amongst the lanes.
content: This was surprising area to me as wasn't expecting to see a French area in Shanghai but its well worth a visit with lots of quaint shops, bars and restaurants. The area seemed very safe and it felt very chic. A nice area to wander around.

title: Quaint
content: Lovely green leafy suburb with a fabulous maze of shops and bars. A must see in Shanghai. I would highly recommend it

title: 'Former' means 10 years ago
content: Strange to visit a 'former' section of town, totally transformed in a matter of 10 years. If you did not visit the French Concession before, you will have to content yourself with a rump of the past; a cluster of shops, restaurants and a few 'older' structures; all dwarfed by larger buildings filling the cavities of a razed history; the Shanghai style of development. No wasted nostalgia here.

title: A Pretty Area
content: The French part of Shanghai is very pretty and has a lot of delicious restaurants and cute shops. It is a nice place to take a stroll and look around or to enjoy an ethnic or international meal.

title: Historical moments in modern Shanghai
content: The quarter invites to a time trip to the former French in Shanghai and offers nice Little buildings, (french) or European restaurants and differs from the many high buildings in Shanghai. It is easy accesible by metro and should have be seen at least once; or even better: stay here!

title: Fascinating insight into a bygone era.
content: An interesting walk to through the French concession area in Shanghai.

title: charming
content: This trendy area is always in vogue, full of energy, could be eclectic in parts of the area.  Xin Tian Di is a good example of the area, remodeled Shi-ku-mon houses and well-preserved neighborhood.

title: Something Different
content:
You'll find a lot of foreigners patronising this place. 
It's old traditional buildings housed with cafe's and restaurants is indeed unique and nostalgic. Nice to visit especially during the evenings.

title: So much history in this area
content: This is one of the most interesting historical parts of Shanghai. For history buffs or for those who like high-end shopping you will want to visit the French Concession and walk the streets. This area has tremendous history over the last 125yrs or so and was once, as the name suggests, run by the French and was an enclave for westerners. There are many shops, hotels, and restaurants throughout the area that have quite a bit of history. We took a 3 hour guided walking tour and really enjoyed the history. There are also several high end custom tailor shops where you can get some very nice suits and dress custom tailored for pretty decent prices. Definitely, keeping that in mind for my next visit.

title: A must see while visiting Shanghai.
content: This is a wonderful part of visiting Shanghai. It brings in a very attractive part/balance to this huge city.

title: Very cozy place
content: A very cozy place to unwind ourself. Simply walk in their art street and eat the local foods. Simply amazing

title: Super Nice place for Dinner.
content: If you want some nightlife in Shanghai this is a good place to start. Over 20 restaurants all full and a lot of energy. Expect to pay at least 50 dollars per person without drinking.

title: Interesting to visit
content: Was part of our day tour and very interesting place to visit, lots of history.  Old Buildings have been restored, plenty of restaurants and bars, plus shopping.

title: Good restaurants
content: You will be tidy to get very bad and oiled food every where so take yourself to this wonderful part of the city. You can have lunch or dinner and then go to the pub. You also have all kind of restaurants to choose. You can also go shopping to its modern shops.

title: Stylish area with nice restaurants
content: Nice place to visit and have a meal here.   Normally quite packed over the weekends. Most multinationals with visitors would bring them to have a meal here.  There are some high end shops and a small mall with nice dumplings at Din Tai Fung.

title: A lot of shops and restaurants
content: If you want to shop or eat good you can here but prices on cloths are even higher then in europe however it is a nice district

title: If The Walls Could Talk
content: This part of Shanghai has fascinating 'layers of history' and mixes of architectural styles.   We recommend touring this area with a knowledgeable English-speaking guide who can address the cultural, social, historical, and architectural aspects of the area.

title: Pleasant & upmarket neighbourhood
content: I spent the day walking around the French Concession starting near Tianzifang and making my way back to the People's Square via Shaanxi South Road. The area is quite relaxed and has a friendlier feel than much of the rest of Shanghai. There are shops lining every street, many of which look fairly gentrified with expensive clothes boutiques and coffee shops. The architecture is really attractive and it's a good neighbourhood to spend an afternoon. I'd recommend starting in Tianzifang as it felt more authentic than further north.

title: Old Shanghai at its best
content: Great shops and food are every where in this area of Shanghai. Older examples of past architectural styles are around every corner.

title: Green oasis
content: A quiet oasis in the buzzing city. Green and relaxed. Good restaurants, bars and sights. Somehow a nice monument of glorious days gone by.

title: It was interesting to visit
content: A lot of European history here in Shanghai. Some old architecture and interesting cafes and street views.

title: Nice but nothings special
content: This ares was nice but nothings special. In Shanghai there are multiple different French Concessions so if you miss one don't worry there are plenty.

title: Not so french but it's fun!
content: A typical stretch of shops and eateries. Everyone is bound to find something nice here. Can spend around 2-3 hours at this place.

user_loc: 科罗拉多科罗拉多斯普林斯
title: Best neighborhood in Shanghai!
content: I wouldn't call it cliched - it's authentic and full of history. Sure there are a lot of small shops, many of which are expensive. But the area has unique architecture and is laid out showing the history of Shanghai. And it's a relatively quiet neighborhood. Doesn't feel like you are in a large city. And it's a wonderful mix of locals and expats. We stayed for 4 nights at an AirBNB with a 2nd floor balcony flat and enjoyed our visit immensely.

title: Atmospheric & lovely
content: Famously nice, a little cliched but definitely woth a trip.

title: A little bit of French in Shanghai.
content: The French Concession is a must visit. A wonderful recreation of the Shikumen architectual style which represents the old housing of Shanghai and woven into this is Galleries, bars, cafes and shops. Most open around 10am and stay open late. A mixture of Shanghai in the mid 1920's and the modern. Redevelopment was in 1997 to meld the old with the new. Spend the day here for a lovely lunch and dinner. All countries of the world are represented in this area regards food. Bon appetit!

title: Interesting, cute part of town
content: Went for a couple of hours in the afternoon. This place is definitely worth a visit! Lots of cute boutique shops and coffee houses, restaurants and bars. We had a wonder through and then went for a nice cocktail up in one of the bars. Think it would be even better in the evening time. One thing to note is it wasn't overly easy to find if you don't know where you are going, so best to get your hotel to mark it on the map for you ( it's also known as Tian Zi Fang in Chinese)

title: Great Part of Shanghai
content: We just wandered around the area, and had an amazing afternoon. In hindsight we could have hired a guide to learn more about some of the special places in the area. As it was, we thoroughly enjoyed just spending time walking about this very unique part of Shanghai.

title: Beautiful area...stylish and  trendy.
content: Absolutely beautiful area in Shanghai, both by day and then  night when it is ideal to dine there. We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner at Din Tai Fung, and have since sought it out in other Asian cities... amazing food..

title: Third visit love it
content:
Little streets filled with people shopping 
Small cafes people having lunches and drinks 
Happy place to visit 
Alley ways leading to shops selling leather goods etc 
Don't forget to bargain them down all part of th experience

title: Upscale and trendy
content: We were there during Fashion week. Great restaurants and shops. Stopped for ice cream at Haagen-Dazs. Lulumelon was going to be opening later in April. Great tea shops.

title: Nice but pricey area
content: Nice area to visit but be prepared to spend outside of what you would expect in China. Very hip, trendy area with prices to match.

title: New developing area with european flair
content: It was not easy to find a place where to start visiting the French Concession. So we went to Changshu Rd station with the subway and strolled at the area. Go North west and specially north east and you will come across new modern and expensive boutiques opened in 1 to 2 story renewed houses, as well as many small restaurants. It is quiet in comparison with other areas of the city, not much traffic and many young people around.

user_loc: 密歇根西布鲁姆菲尔德
title: Pretty streets
content: The tree-lined streets are the big attraction, but while pretty I was expecting more to this area after hearing so much about it. There are shopping opportunities and good people watching. Glad to have seen it but also glad that we hadn't planned to stay long.

title: Great especially Tianzifang and Xintiandi (New world)
content: Tianzifang is a very nice old area with great little shops (for women). For men ther is the friends bar where you can have all kind of belgian beers and enjoy the view.

title: The Former French Concession,Shanghai,China.
content: We walked for approximately two hours around the French Concession,wandering the backstreets and looking for the shopping 'hot spots' ,tiny boutiques and architectural diversity that the guide books had promised. Yes, we found architectural diversity from grand colonial houses set behind large gates and railings to high rise hotels,Sun Yatsen's former residence ( the father of Modern China) and Sinan Mansions which are exclusive residences. However the fashion boutiques and antiques stores were disappointing. Not only were the prices of clothes,adult and children's more expensive than UK but one would struggle to call them fashion boutiques. In my opinion our local charity shop is more fashionable. However one highlight of this area we found was the Boxing Cat Brewery. Our guide book suggested that the French Concession was one of the best walks in Shanghai. I do wonder when the author of the guide book actually tried to 'walk the walk'.

title: My favorite place in the city!
content: Almost every expat would probably tell you they love the FFC. That's because it's peaceful, full of great shops, bars and eateries and the tree-lined streets make it perfect for wandering around. My favorite thing to do is wander around the FFC until I find a coffee shop, bar or restaurant I feel like hanging out in..preferably one with a terrace. And then do it again...and again...all day. Perfect on a sunny day.

title: Beautiful!
content: It's wonderful to go there, walk around and have a bite to eat. Always remember that in China every price is negotiable.

title: Lost Haven
content: Totally a hip place to be for commercial strips and local experience. From small boutiques to great eateries are scattered within this place.

title: A bit of peace among the bustle
content: This area of Shanghai has been redeveloped into a leisure area, thronging with top end cafes and restaurants It was fairly busy when we went through there on a Sunday dinnertime, but considering the amount of people the whole area was spotless.

title: Overrated!
content: We have been there and it is definently over rated place!..locals dont even know this place under french concession name!i think there are so many other spots to visit in shanghai..this one shouldnt be on your top list..

title: Nice, but not a highlight for us
content: The former French concession is a stylish area with upscale restaurants and cafés. The vide is good, but it felt a bit hoity-toity. I guess it's a good spot for people watching and for lounging, but it wasn't what we were into, traveling with small children.

title: Beautiful tree lined streets
content: The best way to find your way there is take the hop on/off tourist bus. We took a taxi and they dropped us off in the wrong location and it was a very lengthy walk for us. Beautiful area with lots of great shopping.

user_loc: 密歇根西布鲁姆菲尔德
title: Nice place to visit.
content: This place is worth to visit. Beautiful area, old style buildings some built by French in 1920's. Lot's of parks, very green.

title: Worth visiting for its architecture, historical buildings, and restaurants
content: The Former French Concession still recalls the golden age of Shanghai (1920s and 1930s), with many interesting buildings built by the French and a wide range of shops, restaurants, and hotels.

title: Former French concession, a step back in time.
content:
Excellent place to visit after the Yu garden, what a contrast.  The garden was very busy, and full of tourist.   The French Concession is quite compared to the rest of Shanghai.  

Nice eateries and ambience.

title: Something different
content: An opportunity to experience some western style in Shanghai. A good selection of cafes and restaurants serving something classy.

title: Really a bunch of tourist shops and restsurants
content: It is full of tourists and has a history but really it is mostly shops and restaurants. Worth a few minutes but not more unless you want to shop.

title: Continental delights in Shanghai
content: This is where the locals hang out for something special. The atmosphere is delightful and the food is top notch and so are the prices.

title: Boring
content: We were bored here. Wouldn't recommend. No signage at subway. Spend your time in Dhanghai elsewhere and don't waste it here

title: What a pleasant surprise
content: Not far from People's Square but could easily be a world away. Delightful and quaint streets with interesting restaurants and cafes. And the place the communist party first meet in shanghai - they obviously had good taste then as they do now

title: Super trendy area
content: We only got to see this area briefly as part of a tour but it was obvious that what was on offer was an enclave of beautifully presented but expensive shops and restaurants. On the day we were there, the place was inhabited by Shanghai's mostly young, wealthy (by the look of it) elite. Interesting in that the Concession

title: Good place to visit in the evening
content:
Nice place to visit during evening hours.
Many restaurants, different food selections, nice bars.
Many shops to visit.

title: Great place for a walk
content: This was a really nice area of the city. We looked at each other and remarked that we couldn't believe that we were still in the largest city in the world. We saw lots of restaurants and bars along Fuxing St. looked like microbrews have taken off in this area. The tree lined streets are nice for a relaxing walk

title: Popular area
content: Popular eating and drinking area mainly ex-pats - lots of international bars and restaurants and gets very busy at weekends in the evenings..

title: great history
content: Walked through here on a day tour, great to listen to all the history and stories about the place...

user_loc: 加利福尼亚亨廷顿海滩
title: Sight seeing
content: Just checked it out. Lots of variety. French architecture from bygone years but now all Chinese. Nice high end shopping centers and little ma and pa shops around as well

title: Boutique shopping
content: Wonderful place to meander but not on a weekend. Need to go inside the smaller alleys to as appreciate shops that do not carry the usual tourist souvenirs.

title: Walking
content: Walked around the area over an hour.  Kind of disappointed, was expecting a more historical area.  Lots of shops and restaurants   If you're short on time, I'd recommend that you do something else.

title: A very nice area
content: Great place to relax and do some boutique shopping. Quite a few small cafes for a cup of tea or coffee and some good restaurants as well

title: Not so special
content:
It wasn't as historical as I had hopped. A lot of art galleries and fancy shops.
But it's still worth a visit if you're in the vicinity.

title: I don't get it
content: It's kind of interesting to find these old, European houses in Shanghai. But in terms of an "attraction" - I could have skipped this and not felt bad.

title: Nostalgic
content: The whole area is one of highly regarded area in Shanghai.  Best and most economic way to explore is to rent a bike and riding along!

title: Another world in Shanghai
content: Really nice old houses with many unique Shops and boutiques. You can find many different Restaurants.

title: What a surprise!!
content: The perfect mix of antique architecture with modern purposes.

title: Great restaurants and cute lanes
content: We stayed in this area, down a cute little lane in a loft apartment. There are lots of interesting wee shops, plenty of small grocery shops where you can pick up the basics. There are also plenty of good quality restaurants and bars nearby too, along with the label shops. The streets are all lined in trees, and there are lovely gardens, even narrow raised gardens alongside the traffic. Very pretty and worth a few photos.

title: Relaxed counterweight to vibrant New Pudong
content: The former French Concession in the heart of Puxi, Shanghai's Old Town west of the Huangpu river, offers (not only) western visitors an opportunity for leisurely exploration of living, shopping and entertainment areas which blend in a very relaxed (and mostly unpretentious) way western and chinese elements.

title: East meets West
content: this is one of the nicest parts of the city. western architecture somehow mysteriously blended with elements of Chinese decor. Vibrant mix of the 20th and the 21st centuries, open spaces and narrow paths, the spirit of liberal entertainment and the birthplace of Chinese communist party.

title: A mix of everything
content: Has a bit of everything there, cafe, shops and restaurants and bars. You will need abit of time to explore, was recommended by the locals to rent a bike to go around the area. Do some advance research on which area in French Concession that you would like to visit.

title: Pretty But Small
content: This area is pretty and upscale, but much smaller than we thought it would be. It is nice to see this part of the city preserved though. Seems a better area for dinner than just general sightseeing as most of the area has been converted to restaurants.

title: Buzzing area
content: The French Concession area is buzzing with shops and places to eat. It is a good place to go for a quieter night.

title: More shopping
content: Okay, it was really nice shopping, but I had had enough. If it says "fixed prices" they do not bargain. At least that was our experience.

title: CPC Museum
content: This was by far one of the cleanest areas I saw in Shanghai. Nice restaurants, museums, etc. Be careful if the streets are wet - they get slick.

title: Worth a stroll around
content: It's strange to find a French looking area in the centre of Shanghai. But it's one of the few areas with trees and French looking buildings. we were staying close by in the Jin Jiang hotel so it was all around us.

title: Shanghai visit
content: I love the mix of shops and restaurants,coffee shops in the French concession. There is still some unique architecture to see and some beautiful old villas. The vibe is relaxing and slow, a little bohemian perhaps.

title: Good evening
content:
It's a really good place for couples: a lot of different restaurants, romantic French atmosphere. There were also many pubs!
It was our great decision to spend our evening with good dinner there.

title: Great Area - Needed more time
content: Sorry we had limited time here, stopped in here late in the afternoon when everyone was tired from a full day. Wish we had gone here on the first day when we had more time. Excellent restaurants, shops and hotels in this area if you can afford it.

title: Leafy
content: It is a lovely more relaxed area of Shanghai with everything from local places to eat to hipster healthy option places, get your hair cut or buy a belt, worth a walk about.

title: Enjoyable walk
content: I used the self guided walking tour in my guidebook to wander round the Old French Concession. By far my favourite bit was watching the oldies dancing, singing and generally making music in Fuxing Park. I think the area would look more beautiful and take on a different ambiance in the warmer weather when the plane trees have all bloomed. I though Xintiandi was very over rated.

title: Shopping, Not History
content: I found little of real interest here, particularly in comparison with with The Bund District. The shops were standard international that you could find anywhere

title: A part of history of old Shanghai
content: This place is very interesting with East meets West kind of atmosphere. Bars & Restaurants of different cultures are situated here and choices are a plenty. After a tiring walk around, you could relax in one of these Cafes or indulge in different kind of foods along the stretch of street Restaurants.

title: Kleine häuschen, gute mini shops, nahe für vieles ;)
content: Nice neigbourhood to live. Small shops and lots of streetfood and bars. Also cafes an brunch! Places. From here you are close to everything you need.

title: Enchanting area
content: This area is full of boutique stores and little cafes. Spend a whole day here wandering around the  streets.

title: French Concession in the morning
content: This area is especially nice in the morning before it gets busy. I booked Jenny's Shanghai Tours and experienced beautiful architecture and learned about the history of this place on my personalized experience with Jenny's professional tour guide, Apple. Apple provided an unforgettable day-long Shanghai experience and took me to places I would never expect to see on a group tour. Don't miss this location if you are in Shanghai.

title: Peacefull Shanghai
content: It looks like you go on a little town in the south of France, in a the middle of busy Shanghai , AMAZING !

title: Shows a contrast to the moderness of Shanghai
content: We wandered here for a while but, since most of it is rebuilt, didn't get the feeling of previous eras when the French were making a big impact on the city.

title: Very eye-openong walk
content: Very much where the wealthy live. Extraordinary seeing lines 30 or 40 long waiting to try the latest ice cream. Expensive coffee bars and restaurants (coffee the equivalent of $5 US) - wealthy houses and historic architecture. Walked around on a Sunday and nearly without fail, everyone dressed in expensive clothes. We felt old among the young affluent.attractive people of all nations.

title: Nice place for have a great beet
content:
The architecture is nice and it reminds me a the great old French buildings 

Most of the shops are now turned into restaurants. 

I had my dinner and a few beers outside the restaurant looking at people coming by. It's great.

title: My all time favourite
content: Nice neighbourhood with lots of nice cafe. Head to Shaoxing lu if u are tired of the busy Xintiandi.

title: Upmarket easy walking upscale restaurants
content: Felt rich just walking around.  Clean, nice architecture, excellent restaurants.    Wolfgang Puck, Starbucks, cafes, cute shops.

title: A fun and interesting shopping attraction
content: A real fun place with original boutique stores and a good range of restaurants and fastr food outlets. I recommend you spend an hour or two just wandering through the alleys

title: Not a Historic Site
content: This is a disappointment if you want to see historic Shanghai but great if you want to get a Starbucks coffee!

title: Lovely surprise
content: Beautiful place to amble, great vibe, lots of lovely a cafes and restaurants, this area is an ideal place to stay.

title: One of he best preserved parts of shanghai
content: Lots of activities, lots to see, interesting restaurants and coffee and tea shops, as well as houses from the way it used to be in Shanghai that still retain their charm. An easy stroll makes this a definite place to visit.

title: Best of Shanghai
content:
A city inside the city.
Charmful architecture, pleanty of bars, restaurant, boutiques. Large avenues and small cozy street, where ypu can find everything and everyone, from old local playing card to rushing business man.
You won't get bored in FFC

title: a must see!
content: So much neat architecture, interesting shops and vendors, little food stops. Spend at least a half day here, wandering the streets, shopping and eating.

title: Need a guide to make this worth visiting,sadly
content: The status of the former French Concession as a must-see of old Shanghai is - at least today - a bit of a myth. Certainly any European will be hard-pressed to find yourself transported back into history, it is more about cafes, shops and restaurants designed to capture the tourists lured here by the hype. If you like architecture, it is certainly worth visiting with a proper guide - book or local - to bring the buildings to life and put into context.

title: Fusion of Chinese & French Architecture
content: A nice place to stroll and take a few pictures. A better choice than Tianzifang as the walkways are wider and it is less crowded.

title: Must see in Shanghai
content: Great place to discover the old part of Shanghai. You will find here few buildings with over 100 years history, designer shops and a nice restaurants.

title: Restaurant Haven
content:
This has become a high end restaurant area.
Very little to see if you are looking for French architecture of the period.
Many Western restaurants, including Wolfgang Puck.

title: Mainly a Retail Excuse These Days
content: Redevelopment means that there was not that much really to see. Shops, shops and restaurants is the main visuals of the area we were taken to by our guide.

title: Where time stands still
content: The old character is very much there. But also a large number of new age cafes, bars and restaurants.

title: Make sure to get lost!
content: To enjoy the beauty of FFC, there is only one way... getting lost in the streets: just walk, take pictures admire the platane trees, look over the windows and the doors...

title: Lovely Meal
content: I had a lovely meal of bangers and ash in one of the pubs here and a couple of glasses of red wine.

title: Great atmosphere in tree lined avenues
content: A good area to visit with attractive tree lined streets in French Colonial style and good eating places.

title: Great for History Buffs
content: As a history buff I loved this area. Safe and easy to navigate I would recommend it for any tourist. Just follow the streets and keep the river to your back and you'll be fine.

title: interesting area - worth exploring
content: It consists of several streets small and big including some narrow alleys and poorly lit lanes. Architecture varies but someone could find (not easily) some small treasures - most of which are occupied now by boutiques (most close at 9 p.m.), eateries and residential premises.

title: LOVELY area for shopping and dining
content: You feel like you are experiencing a bit of Paris in Asia. A bit of something for everyone. Lovely boutiques and unique stores. GREAT selection of restaurants, wine bars and coffee houses. Check out the Bunker - inside and to the back of Green & Safe. You wouldn't know it's there unless someone tells you - awesome spot for drinks.

title: Walking tour
content: Get lost in this area. The labyrinthine streets where you will chance upon hole in the walls cafes and restaurants. Feast yours eyes on the day to day lives of the local Shanghainese folk. Don't be shy on trying the local streets snacks. Some of the best can be sampled. Look out for locals who buying and these would be the best!

title: Pretty quiet place
content: Visited the Shanghai concession and find the buildings pretty lovely and the place pretty tranquil. Not many people are seen spotted there and businesses are pretty quiet. But nevertheless we enjoyed the lesser people and no crowds areas in a crowded places like Shanghai! We took a slow walk to admire the buildings and enjoyed some quiet moment away from the busy streets!

title: Yet more shopping.
content: This place was a bit soul less. Very well kept and spotlessly clean. Lots of clothes shops (none of which were mid-range). I'd hoped for a glimpse of 'old' Shanghai, but instead got 'Disney' Shangai.

title: Best in Shanghai!
content: Love it! The real international historical China. Chic boutiques, cafes, restaurants. I stayed at a Hotel in this area and decided to come back to Shanghai just because of this area! Beautiful area with beautiful buildings too.

title: Best part of Shanghai!
content: Getting 'lost' in the French Concession was the highlight of our 5 day visit to Shanghai. Beautiful tree lined trees, old buildings, beautiful architecture, bars, restaurants, nice boutiques.... A world away from the high rise buildings and shopping malls....

title: Pleasant Stroll
content: Spent the last morning on a pleasant stroll through the former french concession. Beautiful area, and a great respite from the buzz that is Shanghai. Along the way you can also visit Tianzifang, Zhou En-Lai and Sun Yat Sen former residence.

title: Walking around
content: Lovely residential, shopping, street food and superb restaurant area with old French architecture and trees lined up along the many narrow streets. This area is charming and an absolute must to visit in Shanghai.

title: Nice neighborhood to be in touch with an historical part of Shanghai
content: It's worth a visit during the day to enjoy the architecture of the historical building in the areas as well as the presence of the many trees that line up the streets in the surroundings. And there's also plenty of small boutiques and restaurants to look for, making it a worthy place to visit while in Shanghai. Could be crowded at times though...

title: Lovely area to get lost in
content: go without a plan and simply get lost, you won't regret it. Make sure you visit Tian Zi Fang for shopping and maybe a few drinks.

title: Get Lost In Time
content: Getting lost in the winding streets of the French Concession is a popular thing to do for Chinese and foreigners alike. The neighborhood is full of wonderful restaurants and bars, but the old buildings are what makes this part of Shanghai precious.

title: After work session
content: Great place to be after a working day in Shanghai. Several different restaurants and bars. Also malls and stores. Nice place with a mediterran and Asian style. We had great Thai food.

title: Nice place to walk around
content: Well-renovated western influenced architecture. Very 'western' and foreigner heavy. Lots of shopping around, and different style restaurants.

title: Interesting
content: Walk around this area with few friends at night. Interesting area. Very different with the other part of Shanghai. Lot of place to eat and hangouts.

title: Glimpses of Old Shanghai
content: Another area that features in Speilbergs "Empire of the Sun" with beautiful tree lined streets and much quieter than many parts of the city...

title: Upscale shopping, dining area and outdoor strolling
content: This is an upscale shopping and dining area where one is able to enjoy the finest, but plan to open your wallet to enjoy, unless you just want to stroll through the neighborhood and view all the goings on. From boutiques, a Tesla Motor showroom, Apple Store with all the latest Mac and iOS line-up of products and devices, the omnipresent Starbucks, come also the unique and quaint restaurants and bars that will serve up the tastiest and most innovative dishes and drinks you probably ever encountered, all for the right price of course. It is most enjoyable to stroll through the area on the many tree-lined streets.

title: Fantastic Art
content: I was traveling with my family for Christmas and we had our plans to go visit this area because of the beautiful architecture and amazing neighborhood. We were lucky we did it and less number of crowds as many had gone for holiday and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Never stop exploring.

title: Perfect place to wonder around...
content: Very nice, colonial neighborhood full of shops, bars and restaurants. Perfect place for a long walk on a sunny and not polluted day...

title: Emphasis on "former"
content: While some of the imperial grandeur of France's venture still remain, the majority of the architecture here is modern Communist drab. Concrete and cheap tiles have scrubbed most of the distinctions away, leaving laundry-strewn alleyways and grimy men spitting onto grimy streets. Any of the "Paris of the East" feeling has fled long ago under the bombardment of Mao's forces.

title: My favorite area in Shanghai
content: Here you can go for a sunday walk or for a dinner at one of the many restaurants to chose from. During the season when the plane trees have leaves its amazing to walk here.

title: City Within A City
content: The French Concession feels like an entirely different city from the bund/pudong areas. It is a lot more quiet, less crowded and more easily walkable which is nice. The neighborhood has small streets and lots of greenery between old French style buildings containing local restaurants and shops. Definitely one of the most interesting places in the world to see just because of the mix between Europe and China that really is indescribable.

title: love it
content: this is my favorite neighborhood in  shanghai!!! its so charming and cozy! especially xintiandi is nice for eating, afternoon tea or having coctails.

title: A pleasant area for a walk
content: This area of Shanghai is noted for its leafy tree-lined avenues and less modern architecture. Although there are areas which have succombed to the city building boom of recent decades, there are still plenty of areas which make for a pleasant walk, with opportunities to stop at coffee shops and boulangeries/patisseries for a drink and a snack. We passed an enjoyable afternoon wandering through the streets.

title: The food!!!!
content: If there's a place you must want to go to and have a great meal - this is it!!!! And don't forget to have a Godiva soft ice cream. It's to die for!!!

title: You'll love it if you like Upmarket Cafes
content: If you like upmarket and overpriced cafes/restaurants then you'll love it here. However, I would recommend you find what's known as the French Concession West which is about a 20 min walk away, you'll get lost in the maze of street markets, shops, cafes, food - everything! You'll stay for hours and won't be disappointed.

title: Europe in Shanghai
content: We loved walking the streets among the trees. There are gorgeous little shops and cafes that are more quirky and trendy. The French Concession has lots of students and young professionals in the area. It is nice to escape the main busy roads for a peaceful stroll.

title: Very nice area
content: I think this is the nicest area in Shanghai. Lots of narrow streets full of shops. Ideal place to walk for a couple of hours

title: Abundance cuisines
content: have abundance of choices of different cuisines. The former french concession is characterized by small houses and narrow streets. Enjoyed the most from my trip  at this  gorgeous area!

title: Good bars and street food
content: This area gets busy at night with lots of street food. It is quite easy to find a nice bar to have a few beers to wash your food down.

title: Beautiful part of the city
content: It's a great way to spend your day strolling around. This place has some very scenic buildings. Very relaxing atmosphere,

title: French Colonial buildings converted into bars and restaurants.
content: Nice area but only a block with couple of roads. Went in evening as part of Sinorama Tour. Very busy

title: The last old Shanghai place
content: As Shanghai is a modern city, if you want to feel the past and history in a peaceful place, go and visit this part of Puxi.

title: Leafy and calm
content: There is plenty to see and do in this area. Many of the streets are tree lined and there are cafes and shops along with new malls and developments. On a warm day there are plenty of places for coffee and so many little shops to wander around.

title: An old area in a modern city
content: French concession is a very nice area to walk to see buildings and to do shopping, much better then the anonymous malls: you can find any kind of product - clothes, shoes, old furniture, paints, books, ... - in small shops ready to negotiate the price.

title: Unsure what the big deal is - ok for a walk
content: I was walking around parts of shanghai one weekend while on business and passed through here. It was sort of cute but basically made up of restaurants and some associated shops. The restaurants looked good. There were one or two photo ops but I am not sure what the fuss is about.

title: A nice place to go for a feeling of old Europe in the middle of Shanghai
content: This is the area to visit if you want to get a feeling for old Europe in the middle of Shanghai and you will be guaranteed to been lots of foreigners at the bars and restaurants found everywhere in this area.

title: we were surprised
content: as  said   disapointed  by   what we saw   of that  district ,   .... except  some french name  on the entrance  of  some dwellings...

title: Lovely walking area with lots of bars and restaurants
content: Very recommended to visit this area both during a daylight time and during a night time when all pubs and restaurants filled with young people.

title: Walked and walked
content: Thought I was in Paris.  Most western part of most western city in China.  Clean and friendly, easy to get around.

title: My Favrotie Place In Shanghai To Stay
content: I have been traveling to Shanghai for 16 years and have stayed in many parts of the city. I can say without a doubt the French Concession area is the best. It is an area of older lower buildings that can be somewhat reminiscent of New York's Greenwich Village with trendy shops,restaurants and vibrant streets.

title: When in China....
content: The French Concession was fixed on our guide's itinerary, but we did not find it particularly interesting - perhaps because we are Europeans. There were many more Chinese places of interest that we wold rather have spent our limited time in.

title: Europe
content: Nice neighbourhood with platane lined streets with lots of bars, restaurant and musical instrument shops. Great area to stroll around!

title: Nice experience
content: Interesting experience. At least a walk there should be done. You ll come across interesting Chinese "old" buildings.

title: It is what it is.
content: Best area in Shanghai, by far. Pick 1 destination in designated area and spend the rest of your time wandering around. The wandering will outshine the destination. For faster travel times download the MoBike App and rent one of the thousands of bikes around the city. Worth every penny.

title: Shops shops shops
content: We didn't enjoy that much as to recommend here to anyone, i think this area was posh and somehow for shopping brands nothing to see much but great Resturant's also located here.

title: Fun for a quick stroll
content: Lots of places for souvenirs shopping, all selling the usual tea and silk scarves that you can find pretty much anywhere in China. Some quirky shops around which seemed quite intriguing

title: Shanghai´s Soho district.
content: A lovely quaint section of the city which reminds us of New York´s Soho district with narrow streets, in comparison to most of Shanghai´s streets, with cute little shops and wonderful restaurants with exquisite Korean food dishes.

title: Plan to Eat here
content: Very cool botique shopping and walking streets (no cars or bikes).  There are some amazing restaurants there. Beautiful old buildings built when this was a French settlement in the middle of Shanghai

title: Where are we hanging out tonight in shanghai?
content: The area called the French Concession in Shanghai is a must see. You did not see how Shanghai is cosmopolitan city if you do not hang out there

title: Consider an organized walking tour
content: I live in the FFC and it really is a lovely part of Shanghai. Generally low-rise buildings and lots of historical architecture and interesting lanes. It is a big area and for a tourist it would be worth researching ahead to find an organized walking tour, or perhaps there is a suggested walking route published somewhere that can be used if you want to see it independently. Nice areas include Shaoxing road, Taikang road and Tianzifang, Sinan Mansions area, Fuxing Park, Changle road (visit Blue Nankeen Gallery), Dong Ping road for nice restaurants, Wukang Lu and Anfu Lu, Nanchang Lu. Don't be afraid to enter the historic residential lanes. They are interesting to see!

title: Shanghai in European atmosphere
content:
I love to go to this place eventhough I could do for food hunting since I have not a shopping freak but they sell some interesting items.

There is no signboard in English in Metro Station.

title: Great French architecture
content: Very close to the central city and well worth a visit to see some of Shanghais history. Some of the area has been demolished since our previous visit which is a pity although what is left is definatly very scenic. The area is becoming very popular with the well heeled Chinese for morning and afternoon teas plus evening meals in the warmer weather. A lot of very good restaurants and shops in the area. A nice relaxing and friendly area to spend an afternoon.

title: Most beautiful part of Shanghai
content: This is probably the most beautiful part of Shanghai, at least the old Shanghai. On a sunny day its perfect for a stroll around and stop by one of the many restaurants and cafes.

title: Great to wander around and get lost
content: It's a beautiful part of the city. We went but didn't really have a plan of where to go, and it was amazing! We just turned right and left where we thought it smelled like nice food or looked like there were cute shops. It's a great way to spend your day strolling around, maybe take a picnic, or a take away tea. Very relaxing atmosphere, and gorgeous area!

title: A lot of choices for food
content: This place has some very scenic buildings, and also have abundance of choices of different cuisines.

title: Well worth a visit for some western cafes in China
content: If you're looking for fancy western restaurants and cafes then this is the place to go. You can get your cuppachino fix here along with your beers and stuff.

title: Visit it in evening!
content: Not much has left from the former nice quarter, as I remember it 20 years ago, but the remnants are good preserved and very welcoming in evening time when it is pleasant to sit in one of many restaurants

title: A little piece of Europe in the middle of Shanghai
content: If you are in the mood for a nice cappuccino or great pastry, this is the place to go. A bit of nostalgic feeling for European expats,  a great contrast with the Asian architecture and the hypermodern skyscrapers.  Love this city !

user_loc: 坦桑尼亚达累斯萨拉姆
title: A unique part of Shanghai
content: luckily there are still many old buildings which give the French concession its unique atmosphere. Unfortunatle more and more sky scrapers are being built. The French concession is a world cultural heritage and should be preserved as it is.

title: Right out of a Paris Residential Street
content: Take in the peacefulness of the residential streets. Had a quick lunch at the Green and Safe Cafe. Worthwhile.

title: Nice and lots of restaurants, bars and a few art galleries.
content: Nice but not very French, any stroll in Avignon or Arles is vastly superior. This said, yes, it is old fashioned and tree-lined, a plus in Shanghai

title: Cool place to spend an afternoon wandering around.
content: Great neighbourhood to spend a few hours walking around, stopping by boutique shops and cafes. Nightlife is also quite good here with all kinds of restaurants and bars.

title: So fun
content: Tons of shops and restaurants and such a cool experience. Come hungry, thirsty, and ready to shop! I would go again.

title: Shanghai's French Quarter
content: I love this part of Shanghai. My tour guide gave me a choice of going to another pagoda, or to this part of Shanghai she termed "The French Quarter". Otherwise known as the "Former French Concession" on the local maps, is this part of the city that I (and I'm sure most visitors) did not expect to see amidst the concrete jungle. To come here is to escape the chaos of city life and find fountains, buildings & alleyways to explore that make you forget you're in Shanghai, and instead make you believe you're walking around a peaceful, quiet town in France, Additionally, like Europe, the area has many al fresco restaurants and some small stores for shopping. If you get the opportunity to see this part of Shanghai, I highly recommend you do so.

title: Explore Old Shanghai
content: A visit to Shanghai is not complete without a visit and stroll around the French Concession. The atmosphere is very different than most of high powered modern Shanghai. Most of the French Concession dates from the 20's and 30's and has wonderful historic buildings to visit such as the Former French Club, now the Okura Hotel. Even a walk down any street is worthwhile. There are leafy sidewalks and interesting store fronts.

title: Cozy place !!
content:
The overall experience is good

Have many restaurants and cafes 

Defiantly a must try place when you visit shanghai .

title: Beautifully restored and maintained buildings
content: Buildings that belong in Europe are in Shanghai.  Feels wrong, but the bustling cafes and restaurants that now occupy a lot of them are great.  Interesting place to visit.

title: Beautiful area
content: Our tour brought us here to see a piece of the past.  Cobblestone streets quaint shops and restaurants and narrow lanes set the scene for this taste of France. There's a nearby shopping center. It's very clean.

title: Elegance and good food.
content: An area dedicated to cafes and restaurants of varying types - the French Quarter - is a most pleasant area to visit.  We were lucky enough to visit more than once and really enjoyed the laid back ambiance and of course the variety of cuisines.

title: Great little designer shops
content: This is a great area to explore on foot or bicycle. Watch out for the little designer shops and the side walk sales people ("crockery man" and the lady who sells mats of all sizes and colours). Don't forget to bargain!

title: Has a very French feel
content:
Very classy area and has a very fresh feel with very nice buildings. It is very different from the rest of Shanghai.
It is a must see if you are in Shanghai

title: Great spot restaurants, a cocktail or two or just look at the architecture
content: Great spot, trendy sit down have a cocktail and watch the passing parade.  Little lanes, nooks and crannies great buildings rebuilt from the time of the French quarter  a bit of fun!

title: This was our favourite part of Shanghai
content: We stayed in this area partly because of the amazing choice of restaurants - some of the best Thai and Indian restaurants I have been to and a nice break from Chinese food. There are also some great cafes for coffee and breakfast. It is a pleasant residential area with some very interesting old buildings, and it also houses the amazing Jing'an Temple - one of the best we visited in China (and we went to a lot of temples!). This area is way less touristy than other parts of Shanghai, and you will still see local people in the parks every morning doing their exercises or singing.

title: A small piece of France in China
content: A real surprise to find such Parisian style boulevard type streets, tree lined and with a real French feel. It makes a pleasant walk into the city from the south

title: View of a Different Time
content: Although somewhat interesting to see, the area is residential and really takes such a short walk to see.

title: Lovely architecture, great place for lunch
content: What a beautiful place! Narrow cobblestone lanes and beautiful buildings. Restaurants from many nationalities, something for everyone. Definitely worth a visit for lunch!

title: see this area on vintage motorcycle
content: We wanted to see this area well so we booked for a tour with Shanghai Insiders who took us about on vintage bikes with sidecars and it was a fantastic experience. Some drivers are expats and they know sights that are not included by others, we saw the art deco apartment building where the Japanese set up their headquarters during WW11. Treat yourselves, it is fun.

title: A pretty part of Shanghai
content: All things European? Well, only the buildings were well preserved and glad that they were! Very pretty. An area which has streets of boutiques, art shops, trendy eateries and stalls selling local designed products. The atmosphere is good, clean and friendly unlike most parts of Shanghai. I felt at home as soon as I arrived.

title: A Must See
content: During the colonial days, the French had absolute autonomy here. Their own police, judges, etc. Most of the wealthy colonists of all nationalities built houses here. Today, wealthy Chinese (and there are many) do the same. I love to wander around and admire the mansions. One day, I found a huge place being remodeled, so there were no guards and the gate was open so I could take pictures. WOW! Many excellent restaurants in this area.

title: Great place to walk and amazing bars/food selection
content: We enjoyed walking through this area. It is so pretty and clean and there are some many great bars and restaurants to choose from.

title: Cosy and relaxed
content: Today I spent several hours in French. Very cosy with small buildings and lots of places to eat and drink. Here you meet more western people than anywhere else in Shanghai.

title: Great area for wandering around
content: We enjoyed an afternoon and evening in the French Concession. Interesting architecture. Lots of great restaurants and bars.

title: Nice place to walk around but overpriced for Shanghai
content: A more upscale area to visit with a lot of restaurants in most areas as well as subtle more quiet areas with trees and a whole lot of wealth for Shanghai.  For the less adventerous..safe place to visit

title: Great neighbourhood
content: A must see in the evening or even during the day. Full of nice restaurants, coffee shops and stores.

title: great central spot in shanghai
content: Loved the area. Big streets, trees everywhere. Beautiful old architecture. lost a bit of it's luster with recent closings though. A lot of closed shops on Yong Kang rd. Still loved it though.

title: Lovely and quaint little enclave
content: The name is self explanatory! Taking a walk along the various streets in and around the FC permits you to travel back in time to when it was first built and to imagine what it must have been like to live in those times. The little enclave offered respite from the bustle of Shanghai and must have been and still is probably one of the most sought after districts to live in in Shanghai!

title: Nice walk
content: Good place for walking and to look some new things in shanghai. I like the neighborhood around this place.

title: the most pleasant district of Shanghai
content: This is an enormous area which you can't possibly see all of unless living in Shanghai for an extended period.  Beautiful tree-lined streets relatively cool in the summer heat full of fashionable boutiques and cafes, but also residential areas for the locals, so you see...

title: A touch of Europe in central Shanghai
content: Interesting to walk the few blocks of this area & feel you're not in China.  European restaurants, brand names in shops & iconic ice cream & snack shops.  A break from the China scene, if you need one.

title: A wonderful place to disconnect from today's modern society.
content: Ive visited Shanghai a couple of times and this is the first time I visited this area.  I regret not doing so sooner.  Its a great place to wander aimlessly with a loved one, nice restaurant, coffee shops.  You will feel lost in an older...

title: Step back into old Shanghai
content: I really enjoyed walking around this area, there are so many sights and places of interest to visit, that are all tucked away.  Try to find the Shanghai Propaganda Poster Art Centre in the basement of a residential apartment building, extraordinary.  The colonial style houses...

title: Nice mix of history and modern city
content: Old colonial architecture with renovated or original buildings. Many of them turned to shops, restaurant, bars or coffee shop. It is great mix of western and Shanghai culture. Prepare yourself for long walk in car you would like to see most of it.

title: Great walk on an old street
content: The shops and boutiques along this street are charming. There are cafes, places to purchase shoes and a science center that offers immersive experiences.

title: Coolest area of SHanghai
content: We loved the french concession and would absolutely return and spend more time here.  Propaganda poster art museum, great dumpling spots, awesome architecture.

title: Historical French Quarter area almost Parisian
content: Has a very Parisian feel with the West meeting the East with a great neighborhood, restaurants, cafes, bars, and shopping. Great evening to explore and see a mix of the old historic buildings and the new neighborhood development. A major surprise in Shanghai so you...

title: Great place!
content: Go there a afternoon... plenty of nice little shops. For Tourists: ask for price an beginn bargeling by 1/3rd ... give a little more and it is ok. Walk away if they not agree... they will follow you and you will get correct price.

title: Must visit
content: This area of Shanghai is a must visit. The area has been totally renewed in recent years and is beautiful with plane tree lined streets, nice homes and parks. There are lots of shops, coffee shops, restaurants and of course the designer shops of Huahai...

user_loc: 路易斯安那州新奥尔良
title: Old French Concession in Shanghai
content: I thought the old french concession a nice quite and very clean place to enjoy a pleasant weekend getaway. The restaurants are great and the prices are reasonable. Aside from that the architecture is well preserved. I could get used to hanging out in this area every weekend. However, I'm sure how much live music can found in this venue. But I think it would be a great idea to add a few live jazz bands to really wake up atmosphere.

title: Beautiful! Hermoso!
content:
Beautiful place to walk and take pictures! Cute little shops and coffee stores! 
Hermoso lugar para caminar y sacar fotos. Esta lleno de pequeños negocios y cafés!

title: Must See neighbourhood
content: Do not visit Shanghai without seeing the French Concession neighbourhood. Beautiful old buildings with many excellent restaurants and shops. We took a 4 hour motorcycle sidecar tour and were able to squeeze down streets where cars could not travel.

title: Unique place
content: Nice place to walk around. In this area, you also can find a tourist market that sells lots of unique things, street food and kid toys.

title: Atmospheric Paris in Shanghai
content:
Excellent area for wanderiing and generally  relaxing.Good coffee bars and restaurants
And many nationalities in evidence.

title: shops in buildings!!
content: Many shops in narrow alleyways crisscrossing each other. The shops are generally boutiques and expensive ice cream shops. The buildings were fine but nothing out of the ordinary. I suppose they are out of the ordinary here as so many new buildings surround them. On a plus point there is a very good gallery near the main entrance that you can't miss because there is a huge flower on the outside wall!

title: Colorful and Historic Shanghai Neighborhoods!
content:
Beautiful, historic buildings create amazing character in the French Concession!

Interesting shops and restaurants allow visitors to wander and explore for hours on end!

Great place to spend the evening dining and strolling, especially in the Spring or Fall!

Highly recommended for all visitors!

title: An eclectic mix
content: From the tourist-kitsch of Tianzifang to maple-tree lined avenues and French-style mansions; the area encompasses a hospital, craft beer bars, local food joints ... I love it!

title: V upscale area with trendy shops & restaurants
content: You see Godiva and Wolfgang Puck, every expensive name brand chain here - but it's such a pretty area with brick buildings, tree lined greets & chic alleys it's a pleasure just to stroll thru. Also has some must-do stops such as Sun Yat Sen's home.

title: Rive Gauche revisited
content: You wouldn't expect to find a neighborhood like this in Shanghai. Puts you right back to the Hemingway days of Paris' rive gauche. Before it became swamped with chain stores and restaurants. Of which there are few if any in the French Concession, but lots of independent eateries and boutiques. Lots of expats walking dogs on the streets. Great place to hang out and grab a bite to eat.

title: Interesting architecture
content: Interesting to see the French influences but not a lot to do or experience. Nice to walk around in but not very unique

title: Paris in China!
content: Dating back to when France controlled Shanghai as a colony, the streets are tree lined and the architecture is distinctly French.

title: The Soho of Shanghai
content: I stayed with friends that live in the French Concession last week and I love this neighborhood. It feels like it could be Brooklyn or Amsterdam or Il St. Louis. The bars and restaurants are all over the board. I had a great Italian dinner and a great Chinese dinner within half of a block of each other. There is a great French bakery at Lost Heaven and some cool night clubs a few blocks away. This is the only neighborhood in Shanghai where I want to stay.

title: I Thought It Was Ok
content: This is an interesting area in that all of a sudden out of nowhere come sycamore tree lined streets and little quaint buildings with numerous eateries, bars and clothing stores. We were able to find a nice tapas bar (I noticed many Spanish restaurants) and this is a great people watching location as I saw some outfits that would make Liberace proud. I would recommend Brownstone for tapas and their set lunch menu.

title: Nice, affluent, relative peaceful area
content: The area is very nice and clean, with beautiful European style houses and stylish shops. It is worth a visit.

title: More Like Home
content: When you stay in Shanghai for a longer time this is the place to make you feel a bit more home. The streets, the shops, the restaurants it is just great to be in this part of Shanghai.

title: Pretty stroll
content: Me and my friend's stroll through the concession, was super beautiful, Though, it was raining really badly. A sure recommendation from me!

title: Just wander
content: You can't help wishing you were rich when wandering along Huaihai Rd. Off the main streets is a great wander, and great eating.

title: Nice quarter from Shanghai
content: This is an awesome quarter from shanghai, you can take a walk there for few hours. You will find some former house, bakery or coffee shop... and the must!!! You will walk under tree!!!

title: Walking tour
content: It was worth a look. But wouldn't go back. I went at night. So might be more alive during the day. Some nice shops. But expensive.

title: Cute neighborhood
content: We visited the old French concession very quickly and it's a beautiful small neighborhood ideal for an afternoon stroll. However, it can be seen in 10 min. Very small but with cute stores and cafes.

title: Spent an evening there...could have stayed longer!
content: I suggest you take the day for visiting the French concession or combine it with your visit to the Bund. It's a nice combination of bistros/small shops/cafés/boutiques etc. It's lovely and has a unique je ne sais quoi. I didn't get any food  there but...

title: Chinese showcase in tourism!
content: This vacation trip to China was indeed an eye opener. Amazing how they not only copy Western technology, but also a great model of tourism destination! The Old French Concession neighborhood was completely revamped and beautifully illuminated to please our eyes; and to attract millions...

title: Nice visit
content: A great place to visit while in shanghai. Smal touristshops and narrow streets in a nice atmosphere. Try the drinks in bar located in the center.

title: Interesting
content: Didnt spend a lot of time here, was really hot and humid, lots of shops to visit, not a lot of places to sit unless you were getting a coffee or a meal.

title: Do not miss the oportunity to get the feeling of the golden age, soon all the lilongs should be one day destroyed
content: Art deco traces, the Normandy building, cité Bourgogne, (bugoali), south shaanxi Lu, Ruijin park, Fuxing park, a relaxing place after...

title: Old French Concession
content: What a great place to visit, craft shops galore, anything you want you can buy and as for food a vast array of everything. Great atmosphere, laneways linking all around, just an excellent place to visit. Highly recommend!!!

user_loc: 德国克尼格斯泰因伊姆陶努斯
title: Still worth to visit
content: Okay, the shops at the hot spots in the concession are getting more and more touristic, compare to the past years. But still the atmosphere is unique and worth to visit

title: Great, but not typical Chinese
content: Great place for lunch, dinner or to get drinks. Not a typical Chinese place. It is very Eueropean like, European architecture, European people and tourists, French , German, Italian and Spanisj restaurants. Interesting to see this becuadr this is what makes Shanghai so diverse and a really cosmopolitan City. Great place for a cup of coffee and to spend a fee hours.

title: Walking through a maze of tiny streets from 1900s
content: Nice and very popular area of Shanghai. Extremely busy so stay away from it during National Chinese Holidays as it become a complete trap. Here you will buy souvenirs, eat traditional food like octopus leg on a stick :)

title: Lovely leafy area
content: A massive area so you'll never see it all. Streets are lovely all lined with plane trees. Some really pretty areas and interesting old houses. Also some cool bars eateries and interesting shopping.

title: Fantastic area to visit
content: The old French concession is a great addition to the whole Shanghai experience.

title: Great Area For Souvenirs and Quaint Shops
content: We enjoyed this little shopping area. It wasn’t super tourist’y so wasn’t as crowded and our guide said that the prices were better than other more touristy spots. We picked up two dresses to take home to our daughters, bought postcards complete with international postage and stopped by the cat cafe!

title: Ok but nothing great
content: Took a while to locate the area. Nothing outstanding. Nice Western style restaurants. Something that can be missed if you are short on time

title: Nice plane trees but the French left long ago
content: Apart from the mature plane trees lining the streets here, there is little else left that suggests that the French were ever here. No French bistros or bars, no good French-influenced restaurants food or even nice shops different to those elsewhere in Shanghai. So there is really little to see nor specific "French concession" reason to go here.

title: Quite a surprise
content:
The transformation from mundane city street to the decaying elegance of the old French quarter is quite an eye opener.
Well worth a visit and an exceptional choice of places to eat.

title: Awesome place to tour! Find a tour guide for a better experience
content: Shanghai continues to 'renew' many of the original sections of the city, including the 'shen-kou-men' dwellings (those with stone-frame-doors) depicted in main listing photo. I have lived in Shanghai for 3 years and have wandered around this part of Puxi many times. But it was not until this past weekend when I arranged a private walking tour with a guide that I really understood the history of this area. Our guide was Haiyun (Lisa) Zhu, and she was fantastic. Our tour was about 3-4 hours - we visited local noodle factory, wet market, shen-kou-men dwelling, Fuxing Park, Zhou Enlai's residence and the developing shops area in the OFC. Lisa is a wealth of historical knowledge, and brings her unique personal experience to the discussion, which lends great context to the walk. We were absolutely impressed, and encourage you to Internet search for Lisa if you are visiting Shanghai for the first time, or just want to refresh your memory on the history of this rather unique part of Shanghai.

title: Shanghai's French Side
content: I enjoy appreciating old buildings and walking through different architectural designs. Shanghai is definitely the place for this!

title: Beautiful and fun neighborhood
content: Next trip I will try to stay in this area - there is just too much to see, eat and drink - great central location to so much nearby.

title: Strollers paradise!
content: Leafy trees and lovely walking conditions make this area perfect for strollers!  Read up on the history before you go!

title: Incredible area in Shanghai
content: I was fortunate to have booked an Airbnb close to the Old French Concession while visiting Shanghai and wow! Was I lucky! I had the opportunity to live for a few days in this area of Shanghai and was incredible! It is full of shops, markets, restaurants, bars, tea houses, parks, museums, designer shops, you name it! It has everything Shanghai has to offer: contrast of the new and the old part of the City. Plus, the area is super clean and super safe to walk any time during the day and night. You get a different vibe depending on what time of the day you are visiting: during the day, you get more of a sense on how people spend their days at the Old French Concession. At night, it transforms into a vibrant, multicultural setting with crowds from different ethnicity looking to have a good time. If you are travelling with kids, I highly recommend visiting the parks. They are super clean and really fun to visit. Overall, I would highly recommend the French Concession in Shanghai. It is a must see while visiting this gorgeous city!

title: To me the best place in Shanghai
content: Lovely with wide streets, variety of restaurants and shops.  It is an area to visit and relax in.  It is a world away from the rest of Shanghai.

title: Beautiful area in Shanghai
content: What a treat to roam around the beautiful tree lined avenues soaking up the sites of this historical quarter in Shanghai.

title: Something to really see in Shanghai!
content: There is so much to do in Shanghai... however, this area of the French Concession is a standout and one should allow for double the time you would expect as the little alleys and there are many, have so many wonderful diverse shops, businesses and restaurants. This was a standout of our 5 day stay in Shanghai. Very safe, too and cabs easily to be found.

title: Feels like rodeo drive in Beverley hills
content: I have to admit its been a long time since I came home but I was born here many years ago. A lot has changed but still the same feel as nothing feels like home. Fuxing park is a must and French cafes.

title: What is old is new again
content: WOW , a hug transformation. The use of the old into a fantastic group of food outlets and shops. A pleasant place to spend a couple of hours.

title: Best place to visit
content: Upscale, modern area. Best place to walk around, catch a snack, meal or drink as well. Many types of food choices. Shopping as well like most of Shanghai.

title: Europe in China.
content: This very high end area of town makes you feel in Paris, all the luxury boutiques and restaurants are in a small tree story high buildings with pebble stone roads.  The most luxurious condos are also in this area.  Must go when in Shanghai

title: Place to relax
content: A place to Relax away from the rush ,just stroll around coffee very good.cakes and pastries fantastic ,and still things to see .All most like the streets of Paris ,The statues without faces were quite good ,An All most place you have to see ,but it's getting there

title: French by China
content: small museums, galleries to visit, bars, restaurants a lot of people walking around. Visit also the site of the First National Congress of the Communist Party of China.

title: Very touristy
content: This disappointed us some. Very European and tourist orientated with thr usual world brands around. Lots of food outlets. Popular at night but we didnt bother returning to see.

title: Shops and restaurants
content: It's a historic area of the city with some examples of old houses (for example on the first floor) but the ground floor of the houses are now all shops or restaurants/cafes. The streets are nice to walk down as they are still tree-lined and cool(er) in the hot weather.

title: A little slice of France with an oriental twist
content: This is probably my favourite part of Shanghai. It definitely has the feeling of olde Paris in the East with its quaint little streets, various cafes, boutique shops and art galleries. Perfect for a Sunday morning leisurely brunch and stroll.

title: Nice area!
content: Nice historic area of the city, small boutiques some with unique clothing. Nice bars an restaurants all over the area.  A bit spread so is better to have a idea on where you wanna go and explore from there.

title: Beautiful tree lined street scape.
content: This is a beautiful well preserved part of the city. Fine dining and great shopping. Many nice hotels as well

title: Interesting slice of old Shanghai
content: A stroll round the French Concession gives an interesting view of Shanghai. There is enough of the old architecture that you can imagine the colonial period, but there is no doubt that you are in modern China

title: Worth Visiting
content: This was probably my favourite part of Shanghai. It has a nice atmosphere with some old Chinese streets if you wander of the beaten track and it hasn't been over done. It remains quite authentic compared to other parts.

title: Nothing special
content: There were few narrow old streets but very almost purely a touristical place. Surely it was pretty and cute but nothing special. I supposed to see more of french influense but atleast we did not happen to see it.

title: Not so great
content: Stayed in an adequate air B and B in the French Concession and although our lodgings were fine I thought the general area was run down.

title: Important part of Shanghai but not easy to explore
content: You almost need a humane guide to cover properly.  Spread out and could not find a good map or written source to assist in covering. Many important buildings but spread out.

title: Europe in China
content: Very nice area feels very European lovely setting lovely restaurants and a right good feel about the place without the high rise building

title: Hidden gem
content: Our tour just stopped here to show us some of the older style homes of the past. This area was full of hip, fun, restaurants, people enjoying food and drinks in a quaint atmosphere, rare for most of China that we saw. I would loved to have had dinner here or spend more time.

user_loc: 佛罗里达费尔南迪纳岛
title: Yea no
content: Thanks but no thanks. Very touristy and lo local flavor left at all. The outlying areas were much better but do not plan to spend more the 60 minutes there unless you want Wolfgang puck.

title: Just an old shopping-district
content: This might have been an old quarter with some history. But today it's only a shopping place. Not information on the history, just shopping. Skip it and go somewhere else instead.

title: Wonderful Part of Shanghai
content: We stayed in this area for 5 nights and just love the place. A real charm with tree lined streets and plenty of food, bars and coffee options topped off with some great small boutique shopping. A great place to visit as well as good option to stay. Only 20Yuan in a taxi to The Bund

title: Great Historical site to go visit
content: This is a great historical site to go visit.  For anyone interested in Shanghai's history this is a must visit location.

title: Nice during warm days
content:
