I am living in SH since 2years and the Old French Concession is a good place if you want to stroll.

Tipp: in warm days you could sit in the shadow and enjoy a coffee or another drink.

title: Plenty of Restaurants/Bars
content: Fascinating to see this section in Shanghai as you can immediately tell the heavy Western influence on Asian architecture. Plenty of restaurants/bars, though not the best local food.

title: Beautiful architecture
content: I liked the walk through the alleys. There are many beautiful buildings and Cathay theater looks great at night. Worth a visit.

title: Best place to people watch
content: The old French concession offers a wealth of historical interest, shops and restaurants. We revisited several times during our week in Shanghai, an easy taxi ride or train from our hotel on the Bund.

title: You will feel the French influence here
content: The streets are beautiful and mostly tree lined canopies that make you feel as though you are in France. Great restaurants and shops....there is even a Leica Store. Easy to reach.

title: Like being transported to a different place
content: When you go through the former French Concession it feels like you have been transported from China to France. The...

title: Merci
content: Great for a walk around, near Bund and other attractions and whilst. It Paris does have that continental feel. Found it hard to find somewhere to eat and drink. Mainly shops.

title: Interesting and quaint
content: Streets are lined with little shops offering wide range of local produce.  Subway leads to a huge mall.  Go during workday as weekends are overcrowded.

title: Friendly atmosphere
content: A nice place to visit and have a meal and drink ,with friendly atmosphere but not the best place for shopping.

title: This is a Hong Kong version of what they think you wnat to see. Go elsewhere!.
content: The French Concession area is a huge area that goes from the just West of the Bund to Xijiahui. It's definitely not a few refurbished streets in Xintiandi. If you want to see the real French concession area there are better places to wander and experience authentic, as in not modified, or occupied by a Western brand restaurant. If architecture is your thing walk around central Huahai Road and Wukang Road, the latter has a lovely museum with scale models of the most famous houses from the period

title: Very Interesting Historical Area of Shanghai
content: Many years ago a section of Shanghai was partitioned off and many major countries around the world had their own area. Not much truth about this area actually being the "French" area but it is a great place to sight see, eat, drink and walk around.

title: Place for western meal in China
content: If you need a break from Chinese meal go to this place. You will find variety of western food with plenty of drink. Options.

title: Brilliant!!! Loved it
content: Awesome place not to be missed!!!! Tons of little shops, alleys filled with lots of things which can be purchased.

user_loc: 南卡罗来纳希尔顿头岛
title: Shanghai light
content: It's a great place to interact with other expats. Shopping in the daytime, at night it comes alive and there are plenty of wild pubs with music and some see and be seen little restaurant lounges - lots of outdoor seating.

title: Integral part of Shanghai
content: Those old parts are now the most expensive areas of Shanghai. All of them are nice to look at and worth visting. Some guide books don't seperate well the different areas, which are:

title: Disappointing. No real focus to a large area.
content: Not worth visiting. It's a big area with no real focus. Anything you want to see in Shanghai can be found elsewhere and more conveniently.

title: Charming
content: A lovely neighborhood. Many of the stores sell international brands, so if you are visiting as a tourist, you may want for local character.  On the other hand, the buildings are charming, the sycamore trees are handsome, and the vibe is friendly.

user_loc: 缅因州缅因州中部海岸
title: A great place for people watching and some great coffe and food.
content: It is a lovely area to just wander...very compact with wonderful side alleys to give you a feeling of being in a French Quarter many miles from China.

title: Nice place for Kareoke
content: This area is incredible... nice for shopping, eating, having a drink. Shops will close around 10, try to enjoy it during the day.

title: A visit in the French Quarter
content: A good place to visit and easy to find yourself around without getting lost often. There are many Resturant Ann Bars in the area, plus many historical buildings.

title: Where to live in Shanghai
content: This is for sure the best place where to live in this city, and not only if you are foreign. Not only because is full of restaurants and pubs...but because is the place. Thousand of different apartments are available. And always new bar are opening. Really full of life and new ideas.

title: Great area for a long relaxing walk!
content: We stayed at the Radisson Blu in the area and couldn't have been happier with our choice. We were able to stroll throughout the tree lined streets and encountered many unique shops!

title: Cute architecture
content: It is a very interesting place but to be honest I was expecting it to be more beautiful. If it weren't for the unique architecture I wouldn't go there...

title: very nice historical place to visit absolutely in Shanghai
content: The French concession is part of the history of Shanghai. Along my visits during the las years in Shanghai, I have had the opportunity to go through, or alone, or accompanied by specialists of Shanghai and its historial heritage.

title: Not so interesting
content:
There are mainly two very different parts. One is only commercial (luxury stores), the other more authentic but 100% commercial.
You can skip both.

title: Good to stroll on a nice day
content: The French Concession is a draw for expats because of the restaurants and bars. It is also good for a look at architecture on a nice day.

title: Loved All of the Tree Lined Street
content: We had a lovely time staying on the border of the French Concession. You can walk forever and take in all that Shanghai has to offer from very high end shopping malls to restaurants to local stores that beckon you to come in. In the hot summer the tree lined streets provide some relief from the hot sun. A walk through Fuxing Park in the morning to see the ritual of the people in the neighborhood is delightful.

title: Old World Charm
content: Everything about the French Concession is charming and a little exotic. The quiet tree lined streets with homes, restaurants and shops are a peaceful respite to the bustle of Shanghai.

title: Trees galore
content: The French Concession was perfect for walking and exploring in.  The number of shops, restaurants and bakeries made this the place to hang out in.  And many of the streets are tree lined offering welcome shade of weary travelers in the summer.

title: Part of the French Concession will remind you of Paris.
content: Though much of the original residences have been converted into merchants and a massive tourist trap, the architecture will remind you of the quaint streets of Paris. We did some shopping here and bargaining is a must as we negotiated some really good deals on the kids souvenirs.

title: Interesting old architecture, shops and restaurants
content: Large neighbourhood with some beautiful old architecture. There are numerous cafes, restaurants and shops- both high end designers as well...

title: Most favorite place in Shanghai
content: I fell in love with this place that I went twice. Lovely little shops with nice cafes. Small narrow roads. You can buy all your souvenirs and gifts from here. Close to the metro station.

title: hardly anything french!!
content: this place has good eateries. a nice mall, starbucks and more foreigners than asians for a change. this should be on the list

title: Modern, Clean, and Touristic
content: A modern place, international crowd, and familiar brand. If you want to move away from the local stuff and have a break, the french concession could be a good place to go.

title: Great shopping
content: If you are looking for special occasion dress and one of a kind especially bridal and wedding party dresses we stumbled into a street with amazing tailored made clothes. Great food.

title: Old Shanghai
content: It seems this is what Shanghai looked like before the boom.... It is cute quaint and confusing. Be patient, not much English is spoken, but everyone is friendly.

title: interesting
content: Worth visiting but is very trendy and modern the old buildings have been restored and are now mostly restaurants it is worth seeing the old building where the Chinese are coming this party started very interesting

title: Tree lined roads
content: Lots of expats live around here. Lots of interesting residences to look at. Tree lined narrow streets up and coming areas. Good places to eat and bars.

title: "Lot's of Diverse Little Shops"
content: We enjoyed seeing the diverse shops. We did have trouble finding a taxi to return us to our hotel. We ended up in a very unfamiliar part of town where no one spoke English. We should have gone out at the entrance to the area.

title: Don't miss Tianzifang in the French Concession
content: Tianzifang is a smaller neighborhood (southeast corner of the French Concession) that is great fun to explore on foot. There are lots of interesting shops, restaurants, and bars with an international flavor. My young teenagers enjoyed it as much as their parents. Easily accessible by the Shanghai Metro,

title: City of contrasts
content: It is a place tourists should visit to understand the diversity and richness of this amazing city. Most people go to the Bund to see the skyscrapers presenting the new face of this China town or visit the Old City of Shanghai. The Old French Concession reveals another side of the multifaceted Shanghai. Quite unexpectedly you may feel at home. And in Europe - if not the inscriptions in Chinese here and there.

title: Little bit of history in this modern city
content: Always find it fascinating to walk through this neighborhood. It reminds me of what Shanghai used to be. Nice to visit some of the bars here for a drink and soak in the colonial feel and people watch.

title: A very pretty neighbourhood
content: Must visit. Take a stroll along the boulevards, houses and shops. This neighborhood oozes lots of charm and old world authenticity.

title: amazing place
content: Gem in the city, nice small streets with plenty of bars and restaurants. I can recommend punjab restaurant

title: Great fun, Great bar called FRIENDS
content: Great place to visit, must go to Friends Bar, amazing food and must have large lychee mojito. Also fun to go to Cat Cafe, best coffee and pizza.

title: Nice boutiques
content: Artsy area for walking and shopping . . there are some very nice artist made items to see and buy.  The architecture is historic and they are keeping it in the style it was constructed.

title: go discovery
content: not many people are aware of this place.  it is just old houses built, governed by the French and it has (still) retain the historical features, lots of large trees providing lots of much needed shade in summer. beautiful architectural.

title: This was a must visit according to the tour books
content: I must admit this attraction left me a little cold, yes the architecture is interesting but a must see it is not. The most fascinating part is some of the conditions that the locals live in. If you do go to this area do not expect to be amazed.

title: Disney goes fashionista
content: Totally rebuilt for the tourists and occupied by coffee shops and over-priced fashion outlets. Simply not worth the effort.

title: Loved walking around here
content: This area is just charming and very European so many boutique shops cafes and restaurants. A wonderful spot to people watch. We did some shopping had coffee and enjoyed the area. Definitely one of my suggestions while in Shanghi.

title: Paris of the East
content: If you go to Shanghai one must take a stroll around the French Concession. It's a beautiful area bursting with old and new buildings, abundance of character and style. Even sitting in one of the boutique cafes and people watch, it's a must.

title: Nice area but spread out
content: Large boulevards with trees. Nice area - there are a lot of nice areas to eat. There are also western food like Spannish or Italian food and loads of American franchises especially loads of Starbucks shops. Weather is a bit hot to walk from one end to the other end though.

title: Old historical buildings among the modern skycrappers!
content: It was very nice to visit this part. Located in an area called Xintiandi, you get to see all the buildings which were carefully maintained. The small alleyways are clean and well lit in the evenings. Lots of restaurants and shops. Easy access.

title: Maybe the best place downtown.
content: An awsome area very remote from the everyday hectic pace of Shanghai. Nice restaurants, cosmopolitan atmosphere. Don't miss it.

title: Awesome walk and Food
content: Very nice for leisure walk good places to eat out and drink ...  Godiva ice cream Parlour was just awesome ... Very nice crowd

title: Pretty place
content: Pretty area with lovely restaurants and shops. A lovely place to visit that show you how Shanghai used to be in the old days before all the cement went up.

title: A leisurely walk
content: This part of the city is slowly being knocked down.

title: The "Western" heart of Shanghai
content: Being originally from Paris and having moved to Shanghai a couple months ago, I had a hard time defining why I was feeling so good in the FFC. Then it's struck me: it feels like Chinatown in Paris: small streets, trees, sidewalks with shops, lots of foreign names but not necessarily big brands, lots of foods and lanes (perpendicular streets to the main streets that are usually pedestrian AND crowded most of the time). Shops, restaurants, clubs, bars, parks, monuments... you can literally spend days in the FFC and not get bored!

title: Plastic
content: To me the visit seemed like a walk in a plastic street, it's simply a fake "old street". Everything looks old, except that when you look up close you see a hundred percent of the buildings are renovated, even the plants are actually made of plastic! All stores are extremely expensive and tourist oriented so no truely-local or cheap stuff can be found there.

title: french in china
content: great to see the diverse range of buildings in old china...this is an important part of the old Chinese culture

title: Modern area
content: Cool western cafes and restaurants. Great vibe. Not much time to spend here if not eating. Nice to stroll around there for a bit. European style architechture.

title: It is a historic site, quite well preserved
content: My husband lived in that neighborhood. He is very lucky because the house they had is still there, the Primary , the High School and the University he went to are all there. Names have been changed, but all the buildings are still intact.

title: Lovely part of Shanghai
content:
worth a stroll through to see old buildings 
Have coffee and great pastries at the French Cafe,lovely shops

title: A lovely area for dining and shopping
content: When in Shanghai we love to spend time in this area. Having coffee dining shopping or just strolling. All the area is redecorated and lovely

title: The Highlight of Shanghai
content: Bored of the concrete jungle and classic Chinese architecture ? This is the place to be ! A walk through the old French concession, Wuxing Road and neighbouring roads was quite fantastic. It feels like you're in a small French town and some of the cafes are quire wonderful. Many good shops to pop in for some shopping, although they're just as expensive ;)

title: Reminded me of New Orleans
content: A glimpse into the history of the city. Wrought iron balconies reminiscent of New Orleans, beautiful old stone work and doorways, contemporary shops and art.

title: great for a nice stroll
content: the former french concession is a beautiful little part of Shanghai that takes you away from the buzz of the city. the trees lining the streets, little shops and cafes with restaurants never stop to amaze. lots of things to explore.

title: A relaxing stroll
content: The Old French Concession is a district wide area that will take some time to to stroll through. If you are into architecture, history and walking, you owe it to yourself to take the time to walk these old row houses and mansions. My favorite building is the Moller Villa that was turned into a hotel, No.30 Shannxi Road. Great hostory, great woodworking, stained glass, and craftsmanship not easily found now. The hotel is open to the public daily for you to just walk through and enjoy the grounds. You can also have a drink and dinner there. There are additional restaruants on the property that used to be out buildings.You should also visit the Shanghai Arts Center on West Nanjing. The architecture is actually Russian Classic. But it is a beautiful building/museum with rotating art shows. A few month back I went to the Renoir display.

title: France but in China
content: The best area in Shanghai! beautiful with loads of good bars and restaurants. If you get hungry, you can grab a croissant from one of the bakeries

title: Fun area
content: We had fun here...lots of good shops and restaurants. The buildings are cool and pretty...if you only have a short time in Shanghai there are probably way cooler things to do, but this was fun!  :)

title: MUST GO
content: Very nice as expected but the high point for us was the FIRST NATIONAL COMMUNIST CONGRESS MUSEUM. It is a must see in Shanghai, very small but very well kept with a nice caffe at the back with the best ice tea in town. It gives some emotion to know you are where the People Republic started.

title: Love it here
content: We stayed here for over a month and it really spoiled us with the rest of Shanghai. Amazing restaurants in the area. Literally everything you can think of here. Best area of Shanghai.

title: Loved it!
content: Nice neighborhood in Shanghai with a French influence. My husband and I spent a couple hours in the neighborhood and we loved every minute of it.

title: Beat the heat in the tree shaded streets
content: I spent a few hours wandering through the French Concession one afternoon. The nice full trees reduced the sun and provided lots of shade for which I was very grateful. I followed a walking tour route from my DK Shanghai-Beijing guidebook and found it quite useful.

title: Take a little walk through the French Concession!
content: Not only is it full of beautiful art deco style architecture, but there are lots of food and drink options and you feel like you're walking around some narrow streets in Europe when you're actually in the middle of Shanghai. We did a bit of shopping in the super crowded and touristy areas (like most Asian markets) but recommend just wandering around this area on a nice day. We stayed nearby people's square so it was very cheap and easy to get to on the subway.

title: Nice and relaxing
content: Perfect place to walk around and eat in a nice restaurant.. Chilled area close to downtown. A nice way out of crazy Shanghai

title: Really nice to walk around, crowded
content: It is very nice to walk around the area but it is located in the centre of Shanghai so lots of traffic passes through it and it is very crowded. Would recommend for architecture lovers but otherwise I would steer clear.

title: Feels like Hanoi
content: Having lived in Hanoi for 3 years I was surprised by this area which was really reminiscent of Hanoi. A must see while in Shanghai

title: Walk thru this area
content: Take a leisurely stroll. Look for a map that highlights points of interest , stop for coffee and lunch

title: Great area
content: The French Concession is a really neat area that blends the Chinese culture with the European culture. The area is very tourist friendly.

title: Beautiful Area
content:
If you're coming to Shanghai, try and stay in accommodation in this area.    Many apartments available - streets lined with trees,
very peaceful and quiet.    Subway Lines 1, 7, 8 & 10 pass through the area - quick and easy access to everything.

title: Nice stroll, interesting shops
content: The building architectures, and green tunnels created by the trees along the roads are really beautiful, and so are the many restaurants and shops in the areas. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Must walk for touristss
content: This place was on our to do list.  Interesting old buildings with a lot of history.  Everyone who visits Shanghai should take a stroll through the Old French Concession.

title: Historical Shanghai-A Must See!
content: Hub of Shanghai Art Deco style architecture. A walk through this part of town is a must do. It's as if you are back in Europe!

title: Go there with your date or friends...not alone
content:
It is just full of cafes and very calm... Godiva chocolate shop is there...try their chocolate soft serve it's the most delicious icecream i've ever eaten... 
And most of all there are no French people there just chinese

title: Walk Around The Old French Concession
content: Took a morning to walk around this area of Shanghai. The buildings were quaint and people in the shops were friendly. Many of the shops were not ones that I would wander thru (due to be specialty and expensive) and others were restaurants, but I enjoyed seeing something different in Shanghai.

title: Put this on your list...
content: This is a must visit for anyone traveling to Shanghai. It is fun to walk around and enjoy the street around you. Come hungry and stop in a local restaurant for something to eat or drink.

title: Interesting colonial area
content: The Old French Concession is quite interesting from a historical point of view. Search on the internet, and you'll find quite some interesting buildings.

user_loc: 新西兰奥克兰中心地区
title: A stroll down the lane
content: Beautiful landscapes here.  You actually felt like you were walking down a french lane.  There are some lovely chic stores that are a must to visit.

title: Beautiful area with great shopping
content: We had a hard time finding many of the old houses but enjoyed stumbling on the shopping district. Lots of nice goods and unique shops. Great restaurants as well.

title: High end shopping, food
content: If you're in the mood for shopping, by all means go here!  No bargains to be had, but it's very pretty and there are lots of higher end stores.  Quite a few food options, too, including a taco place if you're feeling homesick for Texas!

title: Nice stroll
content: This section of Shanghai is quant and worth a stroll around as the old architecture is worth seeing. It is great to see that they have protected a lot of the old French quarter, a must see place.

title: Great to get a drink with your spouse or friends
content:
The place is beautiful. 
And it has a very particular mood.
Go in the afternoon, walk around and get some dinner and drinks.

title: Beautiful!!
content: Amazing Clothing Stores here, this is the place to go to find stunningly embroidered, or elegantly cut, one of a kind clothes.  There are also some nice parks available for enjoyment.  We rode through on a private bike tour, which we thoroughly enjoyed. If you...

title: Beautiful architecture, lots of shopping!
content: The French Concession is very different from the rest of Shanghai. It is interesting to see the colonial influence. There is also a lot of shopping in this area. I bought a traditional Chinese qibao here for a great price.

title: Too big for one day so plan on a week
content: This area is a feast for the eyes. But we didn't have enough time to experience everything in one day so we'll have to return several times. Tree-lined streets (Sycamores, just like Napoleon planted in France) and wonderful architecture. The park is terrific and just...

title: Former French Concession
content: Coming from Montreal, I really didn't expect a taste of home in Shanghai. Love the old french architecture amongst the new modern building. Lovely place for a stroll & bistro stop!

title: Different part of Shanghai well worth visiting
content: Beautiful area from the French occupation of the city. Something very far from the traditional Chinese streets which makes it rather unique. Lot's of good places to eat and the whole neighborhoods has a laid back casual atmosphere. Definitely a must visit part of the...

title: Lovely place to walk around
content: It certainly is not a great reminder of Shanghai's past and the colonial influences, but architecturally speaking, this neighborhood is a gem.

title: Discovery of a former corner of France in the Far East !
content:
It is most interesting to see the former residence of the wife of the first President of modern China in one of the most fascinating and well preserved areas of Shanghai.
It is so far away from France and it attracted the creme de la...

title: A wonderful walk, great souvenirs
content: My family spent a rainy afternoon strolling here and bought presents for people back home.   Very pretty.

title: Lovely View
content:
The view at this area is unique and special. 
A different feeling compared to the normal Chinese Streets.

title: Great Neighborhood
content: I really enjoy my walks thru the French Concession. The food is fantastic. I enjoy ferguson lane to eat at Frank and later have dessert at Farine. The new Ice cream is amazing the salt Caramel Gelato is amazing.

title: its a nice stroll
content: nice to see different part of shanghai which is a little more european in nature . blend of restaurants are nice difference . even the sidewalks with shady trees and little speciality boutiques is reminiscent to the parts of france.

title: very charmful part of Shanghai
content: lovely part of the city with lot of local life. the street are lined with plane trees and little shop, cafes etc. lovely place to visit and walk around.

title: Old French
content: We were guided by Mr. Ofer Farjun from "Myway" special toures firm.

title: Excellent area for food or drinks
content: Really nice area in Shanghai, really worth visiting. Many nice restaurants and bars in the area and it is quite nice just walking around in the area, feels quite different from Nanjing road and the Bund. Go there!

user_loc: 新西兰奥克兰中心地区
title: Streets, alleys and delights
content: Used China highlights tours had a guide Jen that knows back ways alleys and how each place merges with the other. Taking us from the French concession on to Old city alleys and to food and lunch. Incredible history

title: A slice of France in China
content: A slice of historical France in the heart of China. This part of town, once owned by the French, retains much of its original character. A wonderful place to wander around and experience the mix of cultures

title: A walk in the Old French Concession
content: This area is really cute and stinks of money. If you wander around the streets and go down the alleys you will find cute shops and restaurants that are really impressive. Especially the bars and food. They seem to produce good value and high quality, very well

title: Lovely place for nightlife
content:
This area used to belong to the French so the ambiance is very European. There are lots of hip restaurants and shopping. Definitely a great place to people watch. 

It is an expensive area, so prepare for a splurge here.

title: It is so european
content: Incredible place, you don't feel you are in China it is so european. Great restaurants and boutiques

title: Historic Architecture
content: A little serenity of 1920's architecture and old sycamore trees surrounded by tall buildings. Hope the government keeps the neighborhood and avoids redevelopment.

title: Nice atmosphere
content: Finally on our last day we have visited the old french concession, i regret i havent planned it for more days, wish i had gone before, more reason to come to visit shanghai soon!

title: Best place in Shanghai
content: Amazing neighbourhood in Shanghai, full of nice corners to discover, amazing restaurants, shops and parks, with this touch of european influence, low houses and old style buildings.

title: Worth for a day trip
content: Old french concession area is big area and the different streets have the different feeling and fun. You may get some recommended route or street info from internet and make your own journey. Lovely mixture from European infusion into China and from Old and New. I spent a day walking around and was not boring at all. Enjoy!

title: Interesting place to wander.
content: The French concession area is an interesting place to wander the parks, cafes and restaurants with shady plane trees lining the roads very reminiscent of France and great art deco architecture. Good place by night too with many bars.

title: Nice Area
content: The area was nice but the number of bikes made it difficult to walk on the sidewalk in some areas. Along some stretches we had to walk on the road. We were on an unguided tour so it wasn't clear which buildings were of historical significance but the walk was nice non-the-less. When we popped out of the subway we definitely landed in the central area with neat artwork.

user_loc: 德国达姆施塔特行政区
title: Like being in Europe!
content:
Its streets and infrastructure are mostly European. Lots of restaurants which served western food. 
Take your time to walk all along the roads to find European buildings.

title: Wonderful step back in time
content: We walked and drove through this area, including visiting a merchant's former residence. We would have needed much more time to get any real understanding of what life would have been like in that bygone era, but it was fun nonetheless.

title: The best way to get a feeling for real shanghai
content: Go on foot and just wander between the many parks and green spaces to get a flavor of the real Shanghai

title: Best area for nightlife
content: We found the French Concession our favorite place for drinking.  Whether it be during the day at on of the many patio bars or at night at one of the clubs and bars, French Concession is where it was at!

title: We traveled the Old French Concession by motorcycle sidecars
content: Our guide arranged for our family to ride in motorcycle sidecars which was a great experience.  The area is very interesting and well worth the visit.

title: Charming
content: Together with the Bund and Nanjing road the French Concession forms the backbone of one's Shanghai visit. It is charming, full of great restaurants, at least one jazz bar and a great microbrewery. Shanghai makes some great IPAs.

title: Always worth a walk
content: From shady avenues, to chic restaurants, and traditional little alleys, there is always something to see and hear.  Take your camera and enjoy a ramble,  enjoy daily life by wandering along, or sit and sip at a cafe.

title: Visit to French Concession Aeea
content: You would not think you are in China when you visit this area . The streets are bounded by by lovely trees which is great shade during the hot months. There are many lovely restaurants and cafes to try out.

title: forget the time rush..
content: recommended for city dwellers who wants to briefly escape to more secluded, intimate and less noisy 'suburban' of Shanghai. I...

title: A well kept secret
content: I am still not exactly sure where or why it seems to be a secret. I can't find it on the tourist map and we paid a guide and driver to take us there at night. The entrance was a small unmarked area between buildings. Do your research before you get to China. It is vibrant and crowded with a lot of young people and places to eat. The courtyard had luminous rabbits you can sit on so it is very funky and fun. We ended up eating Chinese food but there are so many options including green slipped mussels from New Zealand.No doubt there is a lot of history that a guide could explain but it is not a large area and it would be nice to have more time if you went without a guide.

title: Nice to walk around
content: It looks a bit French. That is a bit novel. It is probably a nice place to live but as a tourist site it is nothing more than some nice roads that look out of place in China.

title: A favorite area in Shanghai
content: We found ourselves in the Old French Concession several times during our ten day stay in Shanghai. Everything was fairly easy to reach from metro stations. We ate lunch and hung out at a bar on Yongkang Road. We visited the market and ate dinner...

title: take a walk
content: take a side road and just have a look around, worthwhile to see and to have a break. There are still more places like that left in the center. Just have a look around

title: A must!
content: This was a great experience! Much different atmosphere and food than other Asian cities and it was a nice interlude. The restaurant options were all great and there was live entertainment outside for free. Very nice.

title: Chinese take on French suburb
content: It's a bit of an ask to call this a French area. The streets are a bit wider than normal Chinese walking lanes, but it's a bit tacky. The Tesla dealership is interesting though.

title: What a lovely area
content: Such a beautiful area with lots of restaurants, unfortunately the day we visited it was raining quite heavily so we probably did not enjoy it as much as we should have. If you're looking for a decent coffee this is the place.

title: Touristy but more authentic and unique
content: Yes, this is a tourist sop but it is cuter and more quaint than most. This is a great place to shop for tourist items as well as other unique items while strolling around in the maze of streets. You will find plenty of options for food and drink as well. Spend an hour or half a day, it is worth the visit.

title: Ok but might not be what you expect
content: Firstly, the area is very quaint and quite cute. However, it wasn't exactly what we were expecting for a French concession which might partly be due to our own misconception. We had expected something more similar to the Cambodian French quarters etc, but do not be mistaken there is not really any French food/ cafes/ stores around here. It is an area of little alleys with boutique stores. Having said that, there are some interesting stores especially selling photography prints.

title: Stroll down Mini Paris.
content: You actually forget that your in China when in the french concession. Architectiral condition of buildings is great. Place is filled with western pubs and eateries,places are costly though that note.

title: Nothing special
content: A bunch of expensive shops and restaurants with a supposed French flavour. If you have been in any old city in Europe dont bother going there. Very disappointing.

title: Little gem
content: This quarter is full of character. Get lost in the maze of narrow streets. Buy some local souvenirs. Eat some freshly made dumplings or tofu. The drinks here are on the expensive side but you can choose a quieter bar and they are usually a little cheaper. Well worth a trip for those who want to explore a different side of Shanghai.

title: nice walk
content: walk thru the area and you will feel you are not in China. Nice shops, some upscale, lots of places to look and see and eat.

title: Nice afternoon stroll
content: The French Concession aluways surprises with new shops and restaurants. Just walk along Fuxing Lu, Anfu Lu or Wukang Lu and get lost in an atmosphere from times long gone by.

title: is this china?
content: great place for walking, dining and basically people watching. You will never thing that you are in china when you walk through these alleys. Stop anywhere to have a drink, you will have a great time.

title: Charming district.
content:
This area is a charming mix of China and Paris: platane lined streets - hole-in-the-wall dumplings, western restaurants and superb shopping. We stayed in a flat during our visit, and enjoyed the restaurants and the tranquile trendiness.  

I will stay in the area again-

title: Go walk and Explore!!
content: A great place to wander the streets of Shanghai!

title: The most pleasant district of Shanghai
content: Tree lined avenues , grey & red brick Tudor & Art Décor buildings , interesting museums & good selection of restaurants & upmarket shopping puts the district on your must see list fo Shanhai

title: Nice area, especially for expats
content: This is the most Western place I've been in Shanghai. There are tons of expats here and of course, the architecture is French. It's a small but lively area, with the old historic buildings covering just about a couple blocks. The streets are lined with lovely lights and trees. There are also many restaurants and luxury clothing stores with brands like Burberry and Coach. Although I personally wasn't as amazed as some other reviewers, I still liked the atmosphere of the area and will definitely come back to shop and eat.

title: My favorite area in Shanghai
content: This area is quite different from the more traditional areas in Shanghai. this area is filled with bars, restaurants and a great deal of expats.

title: Off the Bucket List.
content: Be prepared for masses of people during the evening. It is a must to walk the laneways here during the daytime.

title: A quaint yet plush corner of Shanghai
content: Shanghai's French concession is serene but also reminds you of Paris. The epicentre of the Communist Party's founding days in China, the French concession and its picturesque small one or two storeyed buildings take you back to the early 19th century. Apart from soaking into its rich history, you can also enjoy the place if you are a diehard foodie. An array of plush, high-end restaurants don this lovely area combined with classy art nouve architecture.

title: Old charm
content: You feel like you are in Europe for a moment, and then you realize that China has this charm and culture intertwined with the local charm. The street music and the numerous european dining venues are a perfect option in the Chinese culinary world.

title: old european with China feel
content: this is an old French Concession area with many old french building especially with the french tree for over 50 years covering the small road with green leaf. There are also different restaurant and bar in the area attracting a lot of the western. Many old western building up to 60 years old make the area

title: Having fun, love it!!
content:
Enjoyed very much the French Concession neighborhood. Lots thing to see, buy & eat.
That area mostly tourist, less Chinese. You can eat in the fancy restaurant and sit outside, specially summer time. Great views.

title: Go for a stroll
content: A good area to walk around and people watch on a Sunday. We didn't shop or eat there as it didn't hold that much interest to us.

title: Great place for Lunch and stroll
content: Lots of cute shops and good food choices! Loved the tea and scarf shops. Shade from trees was nice on a hot day as well. No pressure shopping, a relief from crowded market areas.

title: Interesting neighborhood
content: Interesting streets to walk. Mostly two story buildings, quieter streets, small neighborhood shops of any and every kind. The side alleys are just too tempting! Try buying some fresh fruit from a corner vendor.

title: Great area to stroll around
content: Love this area. Full of boutiques, restaurants and bars. You can spend days just strolling around and enjoying all it has to offer!

title: Eh...
content: Was hard to find, and not very distinctive when we finally got there. Had poor successful care of drivers figure out what we were talking about, one of the few times in my two weeks in China. Part of me wonders if we really ever found it. Silver lining was that with my two teenage daughters and niece, got lost and got to wander around wondering where the heck we were at! Makes for a good story today!

title: Will not disappoint!
content: Very charming spot to visit as expected. Lovely lanes with leafy trees, cafes, shops to enjoy. Did bike tour through the area which was fun way to see it.

title: Lovely to wander and get lost
content: A beautiful part of Shanghai, tree lined streets, friendly residents and an endless supply of beautiful shopping, architecture and restaurants. Not to be missed on a trip to Shanghai. For just a wander around, breakfast, lunch or dinner.

title: This is a must see in Shanghai
content: Shanghai is an old colony town, so you want find many ancient treasures here, but it's still a fascinating city, one of the best in China and the French concession is a great place to spend a few nights, great clubs, restaurants, shopping etc and all within a small piece of France transported and converted to fit in China.

title: Paris!
content: An extremely large area in Shanghai covering many acres of the city. On a sunny day you could easily be in the suburbs of a french town. Odd but brilliant.

title: Beautiful area for a stroll
content: This is a really nice area of Shanghai to walk around, enjoy the architecture, and find a nice place for a meal.

title: Paris je ta me. Have you ever been to paris and looked at your MONALISA ...
content: If you are not from france then then you must be there... You try to find monalisa smile there in between maple leaves. Crowded and alleys artistic houses as if oil painted.. In rainy days i guess more beautiful because people say paris is beautiful in rainy days.. Exit 1 from metro.. Missing thing is opera music

title: Great place to visit
content: This part of Shanghai has a real buzz to it with shady tree lined streets and small shops and great places to eat. No visit to Shanghai could be complete without wandering through the French Concession.

title: Nice Way to Spend The Fay
content: This was a cute place to visit. Lots of small shops along a maze of narrow alleyways. The only problem is that many of the shops carry the same items, a common theme in China. There are some unique shops there as well. Grab a few souvenirs, stop for some lunch and have a green tea yogurt for dessert. Enjoy!

title: Ex-Pat Experience
content: While in Shanghai, I was fortunate to find the French Concession.  We had drinks and danced at Zapatas, alot of fun!  Many restaurants and shops along tree lined streets.  Great area to visit.

title: fun
content: this is a fun area to walk around....alot of little shops...lots of people watching...we had a great time here.

title: Nice traditional part of Shanghai
content: Former French Concession- Shanghai Mar 18

title: Night Life
content: A pricey place to visit for food and drinks. Nice to just walk around and see the restoration work. However the some restaurent is nice but pricey. Best to go in the evening where lots of tourist hangout.

title: Great European "village" in the middle of Shanghai!
content: We loved this area. The streets are narrow and the building are built of brick. We felt like we were in a city in Europe. There were outdoor cafes where people were sitting having a cup of coffee or a meal. Hard to believe it's right in the middle of Shanghai!

title: Great Location
content: If you are looking for somewhere to stay in Shanghai for a holiday, this is it. Central, accessible via the excellent subway, filled with varied eateries that cater for westerners and locals alike, the place has a cool vibe and an old world charm. I didn't explore it nearly enough and will stay there again next time I visit.

title: Tips and Review
content:
It feels like Europe. You can have a nice walk there.
The trees and the streets will not remind you of the Shanghai traffic and congested clocks.
A good walk there reliefs stress.

title: Great place to visit, especially if you're a foodie!
content: A cute little place with many western and Chinese style restaurants situated inside old-timey buildings, which gives it an interesting feel. Don't miss it when in Shanghai!

title: The past revisited
content: Walking around the streets of the Old French Concession gave a little different view about how Shanghai was influenced a century ago.

title: Nice to see once but never again !!!
content: Getting there was kind of tricky. you take line 9 to Dapuqiao station. come out at Exit 1 and you will be facing one of the entrances.

title: Great Area to Explore
content: Some great shops and eateries. Interesting people watching too. Do not skip the DVD stores for some amazing movies fir $1-$2 USD. Be sure to keep the receipt in case if does not play well to swap out. But for the price worth the gamble. Be sure to ask for assistance with the titles. I typed it on my phone and showed clerk who quickly retrieved my movie.

title: We wish we spent more time!
content:
We spent half a day in this area on a motorbike tour.

It had a fabulous atmosphere, cute quaint shops, clean & green, good coffee. 

Will definitely spend more time in this area on our next visit.

title: Back to memory lane
content: Not many new generation of shanghai residents are aware of this name. Even the first time I went the cab driver was not aware of French Concession location. The current name is Hang San Lu. Along the side lane and main road,there are many well preserved colonial buildings many of which have been converted into restaurants and souvenir shops. To appreciate the colonial historical buildings it will entails a bit of walking.However you may drop by at some of the restaurants to have a western set lunch or a cup of after tea. The western food served at these restaurants are authentic. The best time to stroll along this area is either spring or autumn when the weather is perfect.

title: Over rated!
content: The old French concession in the travel books is over rated, over crowded. The best way to see the old French concession is to walk around on your own in the area. Get a map and mark the area of old French concession, then walk around.

title: Beautiful area to wander and find 'quiet' in Shanghai
content: Walking around the Former French Concession is a treat in comparison to the crazy hubbub of the rest of Shanghai. The streets are green & leafy, quieter than the CBD area with less buses and beautiful old buildings only a few stories tall. Lots of small, local shops with clothes, shoes, etc. Quite a few Western style restaurants in the area with Western prices. Don't expect to easily find cheap Chinese food here, but there are some. Walking down Changle Rd, Xinle Rd and South Shaanxi were very enjoyable.

title: A must see!
content: Well worth the visit. Our guide Harris Gu walked us through the French Quarter and explained what is was about and we really appreciated what was here.

title: A great place for lunch, to wander around.
content: We walked around this area, and I wish we had had more time to explore the shops.  I was SO ready after 23 days of Chinese food for a Western meal, and there were several possibilities in this area, including a Wolfgang Puck restaurant!

title: Cute place to look for a nice Shanghai style gift
content: The old French concession is a cute place to go for a drink and find your friend a nice gift. There is a nice mixture of bars and cute little shops! Go there. Only a few min drive away from the Bund.

title: A good night out
content: A street full of restaurants and bars, in the evening it comes to life. A great place to go at the weekend.

title: fanstastic place to be at night for drinks, dinner, music
content: they have many different bars, pubs, resturants, many option for food, and many people to hangout. you can find many friends if you even go there alone. its a lovely place to be here atleast once if you are in shanghai.

title: Beautiful Area
content: Magnificent area with cafes, restaurants and buildings. French influence stood out. Like an oasis near the city.

title: nice area to walk and eat
content: Nice old area to walk around and look at. There were a few boutiques and cafes. Enjoyed the architecture and the quietness in a busy city. Went on a Monday morning and it was quite quiet. Would not spend too long here as there are other areas of town to see that I think are more vibrant.

title: Tree lined avenues, with colonial style building
content: The former French Concession is located in the Puxi area of Shanghai. It is worth a visit when you are in Shanghai. For the more adventurous, do a walking tour. Other options are guided tours (wheels or walking) or bike tours.

title: Resonate old Shanghai.
content: Situated in a central location, now a popular tourist destination. City council did well to maintain the original buildings. Good touch on modernness. However, always crowded, and way too commercial nowadays.

title: Laowais' favorite neighborhood in China
content: Promenade, wining, dining, biking, "arting" and more. Definitely one of the hypest western leisure and cultural hub in China.

title: Favorite part of Shanghai
content: A glimse of the old and new. The villas from 1930s and 40s, how the local people lived. The area has become very arty with small shops offering handmade goods, coffee shops and Shanghai Brewery. Great place to spend your time once you have done the major Shanghai attractions.

title: cute buildings
content: a good place to visit with lots of restaurants. shops tend to be high end but pretty shady for family to walk around.

title: Shanghai visit, 2016
content: Spent a couple of nights in Beijing towards the end if our trip. TBH, I wish I had been able to spend more time in this city - I hope I'll be able to visit again. Shanghai is somewhat more cosmopolitan than other large Chinse cities. It's got a bit of a European feel about it. Many tree-lined streets give it an air of the French boulevards.

title: Great for architecture, cafes, restaurants and shopping
content: Well worth a visit to see the old architecture of Shanghai meld with the new. Plenty to see and do in the French concession. Ideal for ambling around and taking you time as there are many cafes, restaurants and shops to visit.

title: Colorful, historic and interesting
content: Interesting gardens and small shopping areas as well the location of big hotels and temples.  It has played an important role in the shaping of Shanghai.  Currently much of  the small old homes and neighborhoods are being torn down for  housing developments

title: Get lost in time and space
content: Narrow streets lined with artist salons and shops.  Great fun to wonder and be lost amid the wonderful architecture.

title: Must visit hands down
content: Let's face it there's not a lot of places to see in Shanghai for foreigners. So if your looking for a feel of home with a twist this place is amazing with tons of reaturaunt choices and bars and even a mall that are very familiar to the eyes and tastebuds... Not to mention the history of the place itself !

title: A contrast between old and new
content: To appreciate this delve into a little bit of the history of Shanghai prior to a visit to get a feel for the area, the buildings and the influence the people of the time had on shaping China. I gather tours are available but just ambling down the tree line streets, past the busy bars is a wonderful escape from the hustle and bustle of Shanghai

title: Not Typical of China
content: Unfortunately, we came here when it was dark but what we did see were tree lined streets with busy bars, swanky restaurants like Wolfgang Puck and other international owners, and upscale shops. Architecture had lots of character. We passed by the building where the first communist party meeting was held. Would have liked to come here during the day for lunch and hang out. A change of scenery from the other areas in China. You can even get a hamburger here!!! After two weeks of Chinese food, the sounded amazing!!

title: A stroll through small alleyways
content: We visited the old French concession as part of an organized tour through Shanghai and enjoyed the walk through the narrow streets and a look into the small stores. A beautiful contrast to the modern and "westernized" city.

title: Along a "tree-lined" & "store-lined" stretch :)
content: It was a stretch of about 2 km that I walked from west to east along Huaihai Middle Road (which is like a "main street" of this area) with leaves of the trees on both sides towering over my head and with "trendy stores" to my left & right (across the street) which are housed in two-to-three-storied heritage buildings (all well-maintained and some with beautiful balconies); and yes while shopping or window-shopping is the main thing to do here (some big multi-storied shopping malls as well on Huaihai Middle in addition to the smaller stores along the street), there's also a fairly-sizeable park with its own tree-lined way (to your left on Huaihai Middle if heading east) although I didn't find it much relaxing due to the crowd, and also there are about three or four "historical sites" with the most important one being the place for the First Communist Party Congress where you can "learn a fair bit" about the founding of the party in the early 1920's through photo displays (turn right onto Huangpi Road from Huaihai Middle followed by just about a 5-minute walk). And I would also suggest (as time permits) to wander around the "leafy neighborhoods" (just immediately to the south of Huaihai Middle) with a calm atmosphere and where you'll see these "long houses" with multiple doors on their front sides (big solid houses probably belonging to some well-to-do families back in the day).

title: Charming tree lined avenues with interesting shops
content: There are still many fine examples of the old mansions built by the French located on leafy streets. TaiKang road has some nice and pleasant shops selling household items and collectibles. Just off this street is the Tian Zi Fang neighbourhood crisscrossed with alleys and craft shops and cafes.

title: History of Days in the Past
content: While the buildings and architecture are of a bygone era, the shops occupying them are new and in many cases expensive. It was a walk around the block viewing the shops and taking the ambience of the current businesses into account. Lots of food outlets but also jewellers and other high end businesses.

title: Delightful style
content: This area does not have as many high rise apartments. The buildings are lower and bring a different feel to the city. The streets are all lined in sycamore trees. Even when the trees are leafless the bark is still very interesting.

title: Travel back in time
content: Being French, I wanted to visit this historic quarters as the concession was under French influence for nearly a century between 1849 and 1943. It was raining so we could not make the most of the stroll but the café was just so homely.

title: A colonial legacy
content: A great area providing relics of the past which have been revitalised.The bar life is excellent with lots of little craft shops- a definate French influence which is great to see in a vibrant,modern city that is Shanghai.

title: Lovely area
content: This is a lovely place to visit if you have time to walk around and explore the quaint shops and cafes. There are many picturesque buildings and historical houses in the area. Wish we had more time to explore the area.

title: Great atmosphere and restaurants
content: Such a wonderful place within walking distance from Xintiandi metro station. So French so European such great variety of upscale shops and restaurants. A must visit place while in Shanghai.

title: Good area for evening drinks
content: You can discover some old colonial houses adapted to host hip cafes and bars, all overshadowed by large buildings. It is a nice place to have a drink in the evening but mostly if you are looking for a western-style entertainment. For real Chinese experience looks elsewhere – the whole area looks a bit artificial.

title: Very little of French
content: Swanky restaurants, international expensive brands cover most of the French Quarter. However, your guide can certainly show you some of the spots with the old French touch still maintained.

title: enjoyed
content: This area makes you feel as if you are in Europe. Was a surprise package on my trip. Will go again and spend some more time there

title: Nothing special
content:
Some old buildings filled with expensive, western restaurants. 
Nice to walk around for 15 minutes, but not very typical for China

title: Only the past is French
content: As Frenchman and without any kind of patriotism of another age, I was disappointed to note that most of the activity in this old French memorial is due to restaurants but that all of them represent several countries, mostly Italy, excepted France. What a real pity for our culinary culture and reputation.

user_loc: 加利福尼亚埃尔塞贡多
title: Great way to wander away an afternoon
content: Enjoyed the alleyways and French/art deco influence.  Wander down the alleyways that is when you see the real workings of the area.  The leafy tree lined streets are beautiful.

title: Dissapointing
content: We came in search of a great meal, not as many restaurants as we expected disappointing menus, very expensive, there were 6 of us not quite what we expected.

title: Beautiful place
content: Plenty of beautiful buildings. Many restaurants. Another attractive location in  Shanghai China. Please take time tasting food and take photos.

title: The French Concession is THE Place to Visit
content: The old French Concession area of Shanghai is terrific for so many reasons -- the low-rise architecture, the lovely streets, the excellent restaurants and bars -- including haunts for ex-pats.  If I were to live in Shanghai, that's where I would want to be!

title: pretty
content: very nice architecture. lots of restaurants and bars. nice place to walk during the day and the evening

title: One of my favourite things I saw in Shanghai
content: I walked through the old French concession for a good 2-3 hours onTomb Sweeping day this year. The architecture Is everything you expect it to be and the area has a definite different vibe to the rest of Shanghai. A must visit as there are so many good places to eat as well as some really good stores to shop at if you're a shopaholic! 5 stars!

title: Fun place to visit
content: Went with a local that new this place! Tons of bars and restaurants! Fun nightlife! Especially if you are missing kind of a western atmosphere! Plenty of European here and of course French! Very good restaurants in the area! A good break when visiting Shanghai!

title: Beautiful section of city where people live
content: A beautiful area of Shanghai that visitors really ought to walk about and admire. Keep in mind it is an area with cool restaurants, dense tree lined streets, and old style architecture; Not really any one thing to go see.

title: Beautiful...trendy and so relaxing!
content: go here if you want some chill out time...loads of awesome restaurants and shopping close by! our favourite area on holiday! sitting outside in the warm spring air was divine!

title: Really nice for strolling around
content: Make sure you know where to walk to and inform yourself prior to walking around. You can easily get lost. It is really nice, with a lot of small street and shops. Feels like being somewhere in a small town, but not Shanghai

title: Visiting Xitiandi
content: A part of French concession with modern shopings and avenues with all the expensive western "griffes".But also with recuperated tradicional houses with design clothes, furniture, etc from chinese designers, modern and beautiful .

title: Nice to see but expensive neighbourhood
content: This is nice to see for half an hour, welth and people with money. Very expensive to drink something here according to Chinese standards.

title: Embracing their inner capitalist...
content: Once the original French Quarter/concession, but purchased and re-developed by a Hong Kong developer, there isn't much to be seen here.

title: Beautiful Area, better by bike !
content: It is indeed a lovely area, quite wild so make sure you find a bike or book a bike tour to visit it ! Surrounded by plane trees, those streets will always leave me a beautiful souvenir !

title: Nothing much
content: The surrounding view was beautiful but theres nothing much here. Lots of expensive cheong sam stores (a bit overpriced) but its good if you hv some spare time.

title: Lovely French way of living 'sous les platanes'
content: It is a lovely part of the old historical consessions. Even after a century later, you can walk under the platanes. You will find cozy French style bistro's and even Italian restaurants. Shatered over the quarter you can find European entrepreneurs doing business in Shanghai. Some bric-a-brac stores along really high end design stores. Vraiment c' est un plaisir de parler Français ici, en dehors de la langue Anglaise, et d'être un analfabete complet concernant la langue chinoise.

title: Very nice place to visit.
content: Went with several friends to shop in the morning. Really was a nice place. Like all of China, it is too many people. My wife got some very nice shoes. The shops are plentiful and of good quality.

title: Vive le Paris
content: Fun little part of town, full of little cafe's and great atmosphere. Many ex pats from France here who settle in for the afternoon for coffee or drinks and eat light finger foods. Lots of fun, especially in the evening when people are finishing work. If you want a nice little table on the outdoor terrace, be sure to get there before 4:30pm. Otherwise, the outdoor tables fill up fast. This would be in the spring to fall months of course. Not as nice in the winter months because of the cold weather.

title: Great Place to find Western Food
content: If you're tired of Chinese food and want a taste of the West - this is the spot. By Chinese standards, it's expensive, but you get pretty authentic Western fare and many recognizable places. It is a little weird seeing a Chinese waiter in lederhosen, but the German food at the Pauliner Pub is the best you'll find in Shanghai. There are many other wonderful places to explore and enjoy. It's a perfect spot for an evening out.

title: Bonjour all the way
content: This little piece of France is absolutely beautiful. Tucked away in the bustling Shaghai metro, the tiny sidestreets and tree lined avenues provide a beautiful escape. Stores are littered along the way in this maze of alleys with amazing art and crafts on display from talented craftsmen. If you find time, this place is definitely a place to see. You get an idea of how an old city feels before the boom took place. Th French concession maintains so much of the old with that typical French flair...all in China.

title: Beautiful Are of Shanghai
content: We walked along the streets of the French concession on three different occasions over a 4 day trip to Shanghai. The streets are lovely, with beautiful trees covering the walkways. Lots of interesting boutiques, coffee shops and restaurants to check out. It should be part of anyone's visit to Shanghai!

title: Becoming 'touristy'
content: Lacking in authenticity but contains some lovely artesian shops with unique gifts and high end trinkets. Lovely for a wander through on a nice day but lacking in authenticity with Starbucks, Wolfgang Puck etc However if this is your thing and you are hankering for tastes of home this would be a lovely diversion.

title: Most fun part of Shanghai
content: We come here often, a great way to spend hours exploring little streets, shops, cafés, bars, restaurants - always something new to discover.

title: A totally different experience in Shanghai
content: This place is amazing, it will give you a feel of European environment. You may like to spend an evening there just to roam around and have some food and beer. Local products are being sold there too.

title: Very nice place that you don't feel like in China
content: Fusion of cultures between the East and West, many pubs and nice restaurants there, with beautiful decorations.

title: History in the old town
content: Shanghai has an amazing history of western influence during the opium trade period. The concessions have been shrinking as the recent Chinese administration seeks to remove the old for the new. Agree or disagree with this stance, the amazing architecture and historical flavours in such a developing country need to be seen. The French concession is simply a bucket list visit.

title: We found to be ordinary
content: This area was included in our tour package and I am still puzzled. There are nice shops and restaurants but this kind of area can be found in any city and for us did not present as anything special or unique. I would only make this a stop if you have more than two days visiting Shanghai.

title: I wish I lived here in 1930.
content: The opulence of the Westerners here was amazing.  Now it is one of the most trendy places to live.  Eat at Sasha and read the history of this incredible place.

title: Charm in the middle of high-rise
content:
Spent a good few hours and walked many miles exploring the many streets and shops of this area.

Well worth spending time here as it is such a contrast to the new city. Calm for China.

title: Lovely place
content: A lovely place to see the old buildings. Camera enthusiasts would find this place interesting. Though the place has been converted to selling local things.

title: A visit in the small commercial alleys !
content: We were told that if we wanted to feel a ''different'' Shanghai to go and stroll along the lanes 210 , 248 and 274 of the Former French Concession ! This was quite different from the commercial street of Nanjing Road and it proved to be quite an experience ! All the lanes were packed with people doing some shopping and sightseeing and if someone wants to see something non-westernized , this is the place to go ! A real cultural immersion !

title: Different from the business district.
content: Such a wonderful place to walk and see different sights. I had a beautiful day with the sun shinning and blue skies. Just walking around seeing the difference from the business side of Shanghai. Beautiful trees lined the roads and people walking around or sitting have a coffee at the Bakeries.

title: Interesting part of the city
content:
Interesting part of Shanghai- one of my favorite during our stay in Shanghai.

Lots of cafes, nice architecture, and many nice restaurants. Easy to catch a taxi...

title: Fascinating
content: If you come to Shanghai try to come here - it is not on the main tourist trail but is easy to wander around and has great shops and restaurants. Still retains a 1920s feel.

title: A Change from the High-Rises of Pudong
content: The French Concession provides an enjoyable change from the Bund and Pudong.  The mature trees shade a varied selection of restaurants housed in historic low-rise buildings near a park where locals practice their tai chi, ballroom (and other) dancing, and other pastimes.

title: Colonial charm admixed with Shanghai Chinese quirkiness
content: Really nice place to spend a morning or afternoon browsing shops, drinking coffee. The French got it right when planting the trees.

title: Very nice area
content: The area is very central, yet it feels very quiet and at night there is hardly any traffic at all. Very beautiful with tree lined streets.

title: Shanjhai French Quarter
content: If you have ever been to New Orleans French Quarter, this place will look familiar, without the mess of the strip joints, pan handlers and seedy bars. The building styles of the French quarter are seen everywhere you walk around. It is a great place to walk around, shop, eat, visit a local brewery. Nice area, clean and family oriented. Great place to visit while in Shangai.

title: Great for souvenirs and coffee
content: I was brought here to find some tea sets. Wow, what an amazing place. I found the tea set that I needed and enjoyed a good coffee and chocolate cake as well. Well worth killing a nice sunny day at.

title: Nice but hard to find
content: Very pretty area. But make sure you know how to get there. We were given the wring directions and waked around for over an hour looking for it. Finally found an English speaking couple who told us we were 4miles away. Got a cab and finally got there for less than $4

title: Beautiful but obviously European
content: The history of the French Concession can certainly peak your interest in seeing this area, however, if you've been to Europe, you've already seen this. This area reminds me of Passau, Germany, or the small, quaint streets of Prague. If you came to see China, don't waste time here. If you need a break from Eastern Culture, this is the perfect place in Shanghai to hang out.

title: Better place to shopping
content: Lots of restaurants and shops. this is one of the most unique place in Shanghai, very local place to be not too touristy, some locals hang out here as well!

title: WHAT A TREAT
content: we walked 46 miles in four days! And we're older! Tons to see, lots to drink, better shopping than Singapore or Tokyo it was way to good. We are going to stay for a month as soon as we can. We stayed at the Okura it's nice and central to the FFM. It was like a trip to Paris with out the Paris prices. FUN FUN FUN. the back alleys were cool, the streets were alive with shops! What fun!

title: Worth visiting
content: It was lovely to stroll around and see the old architecture and then walk straight into the modern shopping centre. Loved the street cafes where you could sit and watch the world go by. Very exclusive area with lots of young rich Chinese people.

title: Charming Area
content: Great area to walk though with the traditional architecture of the past. Great shops and restaurants to explore day and night

title: Ahhhh Chinoise!
content: Although you are in China, the French sensibility ensues! Lovely trees, intriguing bistros for a rendezvous, small boutiques, and grande designer magasin. It is a nice break from the modern China, although the hustle and bustle is not abated. You can understand how the French personalized their enclave here in Shanghai, and you can enjoy the remains of it today.

title: Lovely area to walk around
content: Lovely restaurants, coffee shops and shops in this charming area which was our favourite place to visit in Shanghai.

title: Worth a visit
content: Lovely place to get a feel of the old Pre-revolution China. Wonderful for browsing and sipping the..

title: Interesting yet missable if pressed for time
content: The area of the City is interesting and worth a visit if you have time. It is one part I would skip if hard pressed for time. Mostly interesting architecture and modern shopping and food.

title: Beautiful Shanghai Neighbourhood
content: Make sure you get to this beautiful area. The tree lined streets, wonderful architecture, cafes, bars and restaurants. Give yourself plenty of time to wander and soak it all in. Great atmosphere and sights to see. Kick back and relax at a bar, cafe or select one of the excellent restaurants.

title: Nice surrounding
content: If you spend a few days in Shanghai a visit to the old French Concession is almost a must. This trendy area offers a lot of nice boutiques and a wide selection of cafés, bars and restaurants. However, if you travel on a very tight budget this area might not be that interesting.

title: Not easy to find
content: Nice area, even there is no real walking tour or hot spots. You need to wander around and find little pockets of French architecture. You'll almost feel like in Paris calm suburbs.

user_loc: 加利福尼亚雷东多海滩
title: Historic!
content: Takes you back to 19th Century when foreign concessions carved out their own parts of Shanghai and created "a little bit of home" for the business, military, and diplomatic folks.

title: Quaint respite in Shanghai
content: Among the massive glass and chrome skyscrapers and the hustle and bustle of new Shanghai, the French Concession is a charming, cozy neighborhood that highlights the rich history of the city. I loved walking the relatively quiet, pedestrian streets and ducking in and out of quaint little shops and bars. With its bohemian flare, it reminded me of the West Village in NYC or the French Quarter in New Orleans. The architecture is unique and there are lots of trees, which also adds to the neighborhoody feel. I would definitely stay in this area on a future visit to Shanghai.

title: Surprising look at an old area of Shanghai
content:
Great pocket of old and new buildings in the middle of Shanghai.
We toured the a turn of the last century home with interesting examples of modern technology--like irons and typewriters.

title: Not that Impressive
content: Not sure what this was all about. The whole area was trendy little shops and restaurants. There was one house museum that was fairly interesting depicting average life of a Chinese family from the mid 20th.

title: A must see
content: A must see location. Amazing little district full of colonial charm. A great place to wander the narrow streets, try different coffee shops and boutiques.

title: A whiff of old Shanghai and European influence
content: Good for a stroll to sense the former Shanghai with its Euopean quarter. Lots of good food places, and very flashy shopping opportunities.

title: We love this area
content: We live in the French Concession and have done for the many many 10 years. We are so lucky to live here, in an old lane house, with a garden. It's peaceful and green and we are two minutes from Huai Hai Lu, one of the main streets in Shanghai.

title: Do not miss in Shanghai
content: this place is simply amazing it inspires history and reminds visitors of the International status of shanghai back in the 19th century. Architecture is great for a second you will think that you are in PAris or the old town of Quebec city. Shaghai and Casablanca are the only two cities outside of France where you can find Art Deco buildings. Many cafes french style in the district as well.

title: a pleasure to walk around
content: I stayed in this area for 10 days and it was a great introduction to the city. It is well serviced by several metro train lines, plenty of taxis day and night. Numerous fashion shops ( smaller sizes) , beautiful old buildings, parks where people dance, ti-chi or play cards. Several international standard concert venues in the area, art galleries and the Shanghai museum. If this is your first trip to Shanghai definitely plan to stay here rather than the CBD as the metro will get you to all the attractions wherever you stay.

title: Posh area
content: The area is nice and somewhat different from the rest of Shanghai - containing high end shops, restaurants, and bars. It is worthwhile to stroll around here, but it is nothing amazing.

title: They still call it the French Concession
content: A view of what it was like when the city was made up of international concession districts.  It gives you the feeling of a time gone by.

title: Tianzifang is the known name of the area
content: French concession is a big area and we were interested only in the old area with old buildings, narrow streets, little shops and restaurants which you can reach if you tell to the taxi drivers or at the hotel that you would like to go to Tianzifang, as it is the name of the area. This place can get really crowded on the weekends, peak hours as many locals go here too but anyhow it is nice to explore the area to eat, drink or buy souvenirs.

title: Loveliest part of Shanghai
content: Historical, busy but yet with a character of its own- slightly reminiscent of Hanoi and some parts of Ho Chi Minh but without the narrow buildings.

user_loc: 澳大利亚布里斯班地区
title: Old French Concession
content: The Old French Concession. This was quite pleasant, not my choice of shopping, very expensive. But nice to see.

title: Great at night
content: Great old part of town, old and new, great cafes and some restaurants. Good vibes going on al the time

title: The heart of Shanghai
content: Do not go to Shanghai without visiting the French Concession. Perfect for wandering around and getting a coffee--there's some really interesting boutiques, museums and bars.

title: Interesting old buildings
content: The French Concession area of Shanghai is a part of the city where the lanes still have some interesting old buildings from their colonial past. Some of the buildings are quite pretty.

title: Could be in Paris!
content: Lovely old Plane trees and narrow quaint streets--for a moment you could think you were in Paris! I would recommend that you walk around the streets in this area to get the feel of it. Sophisticated restaurants and chic boutiques ,old European houses--all remind one of the international history of this city. Lovely secret gardens behind big wrought iron gates--you cant help wondering who lives /works there. Some houses have plaques on them telling you who the former residents were--I presume long gone in the revolution. Definitely a reminder of the old Shanghai before communism.

title: Great place to eat and drink
content:
Well worth a taxi ride lots of places to eat and drink in a small area
Buildings are good to look at
Safe area to walk around at night

title: Beautiful, lots of restauranst
content: but also far too many tourist. the are is not so big so you can easily walk around. Many young chines people come to this area just to drink coffe or meet tourist.

title: Magnificent architecture, History in all its glory...Take ur time!
content: We only got to walk by and get a glimpse of these amazing French buildings. If I had time I would have hired a guide and spent atleast a couple if hours.

title: Super hip
content: Lots of cool bars, restaurants and shops. Perfect for young professionals and expats. Amazing contrast as usually found in Shanghai.

title: Walk around
content: Take line 1 from people square get of at heng shan road gout exit 4 turn right walk until 2 crossroad at Sasha's stop for drink in garden then turn right again wonder down dong ping road there's small shops and cafe bars turn right again onto yueyang roag till you get to Yong jai road turn left wonder the whole street great. Is of fernch houses and shanghnese working life locals .

title: FORMER French Concession
content: It's a part of Shanghai where people live and go about their business. Not a theme park. There is some interesting art deco architecture and hundreds of tasty eating spots.

title: Surprisingly small
content: It is an interesting area laid out with fancy shops and restaurants- all contained in preserved old houses. However it is a fairly small area and perhaps fails to live up to its expectations.

user_loc: 印第安那印第安纳波利斯
title: Great buildings and art work, fun restaurants and street life
content: A great place to enjoy a leisurely walk through time as well as a fun place for a wonderful modern meal.

title: Breath taking architecture
content: Absolutely breath-taking architecture!Especially if you come from asian countries. This is absolutely an eye opener! Excellent place for photo taking. However, it costs a lot to dine, wine and shop here.

title: Take a Stroll Through 20th Century History with Plane Trees
content: We always stay in or near the Old French Concession when in Shanghai. The Plane Tree linted streets and mostly low rise buildings make for a relaxing time.
