In terms of commercial activities, there are lots of small boutiques galleries and cafes. What was disturbing to me was laundry hung for drying over corridors and sidewalks by local Chinese residents with locals playing card and board games on sidewalks. The men are often seen with their T -shirts rolled up to expose the belly. The French element is only the architecture of the old buildings and villas.

title: Chilling in the French Concession.
content: A decent getaway from the Shanghai concrete jungle and crowds. So many cool bars and restaurants, cleaner streets and good for expats.

title: Tour Guide called this area the "OLD LANDS"
content: Tripadvisor shows a couple photographs of this area as part of the Former French Concession and there is a section within this area that the locals and the tour guide referred to as "OLD LANDS". It is a historic district, brightly decorated, well maintained and full of shopping, cafe's, bars, British tea house, etc.. It is colorful and a wonderful place to visit...but you need to ensure you find the streets we show in the photographs as the "Old Land" district is only a select part of the Former French Concession. We had a nice lunch, tea and visited a stunning "fan" shop where I picked up a beautiful hand fan that was hand decorated for my wife. The guides stated this area also has a lively night life of personnel transiting between the various bars and cafes at night. Well worth the visit.

title: Pleasant surprose
content: Had a hard time finding it because the map from trip advisor sent us to one street farther than the actually entrance to the former French concession. But once we found it we found all the little alleyways and shops really fun! Some great restaurants and shops.

title: FFC
content: Charming streets and good food, great walking. Bike rental could also be nice, look for small museums where you can enter the historic houses.

title: Feels like France!!
content: I loved this area of Shanghai! I love France so this was a dream for me. It was amazing to be surrounded by French architecture and cuisine and then to look beyond that and see skyscrapers in the back. It was an incredible experience. It's a very small area so not much time is needed. Would definitely recommend a visit!

title: Very European
content: Although it is a pleasant area and THE place to go if you want to see other european visitors, for me it was to european, I went to China to explore the Chinese way of life and this had restaurants and coffee houses that were very european. However there was a great tea shop where you could buy many varieties of chinese tea as well as tea pots and cups.

user_loc: 卡罗莱纳州戈尔兹伯勒
title: You would think you were in France!
content: As a francophile I love this part of the city. It is intimate, with varied architecture and lined with Parisian-looking plane trees. Another unique and charming quarter of this unique city.

title: Little Europe - nice but too small
content: This is a very nice area with nice restaurants. The area is samall so if you don't come to eat you can walk around for 1 hour and continue to other places in Shanghai.

title: Nice colonial area, but do you want to go European in China?
content: The old French concession area, is a quite nice area for a walk with small cafes and restaurants. Downside in my view is, that if you want to visit a French/European style area, it's better to go to France/Europe. If I am in China, I prefer more Chinese style areas and hence, do not frequent the concession area too often.

title: Beautiful place
content: Nice place to walk around. If you are European, this will sound familiar to you. It is a quiet place with human-sized houses, trees and a reasonable traffic.

title: Interesting and home to many expats
content: If you want to see a foreigner, you can go here. There are also lots of restaurants some foreign grocery stores, and it's a nice place for a stroll. Using a bicycle will make it easier to get around.

title: europe in shanghai
content: This is one of my most favourite area in shanghai. when you want to escape from chinese lifestyle, you can simply come here and you feel back in europe. It's full of western shops and expat. it's full of shops, coffee, bars and restaurants.

title: Experience both world
content: Old French concession is the best residence area in shanghai. Its buildings are western style with the touch of local culture. It is full of amazing cafes, restaurants, clubs, bars, even the French and American embassies located are here.

title: Best area of Shanghai
content: Maybe one of the best area of Shanghai, where you can see the real life of the city and also feel the human side of Shanghai, every life moments from dawn to dusk .... Every small building brings and shows its own story ... far away for all the skyscrapers ...

user_loc: 哥伦比亚特区华盛顿特区
title: Crowded but worth seeing
content: It is quite touristy but worth seeing. Avoid the open food vendors. The food looks tasty but is mostly fried, greasy and tasteless. Great for photos.

title: upscale
content: I imagine this is what France looks like. Ladies make sure to bring valentino shoes, chanel bags, and anything else highend. The women in this area dress very nice and I went in my touring clothes looking kinda bummy. People were a little snooty but its ok. Lots of shopping and eateries and luxury shops. Very expensive.

title: Walkable neighborhood with great food/drink/shops
content: This area is lined with great shops, coffee/tea houses and later in the evenings, spots for dinner.  Local food markets are the best in town. Very worthwhile stroll in Shanghai

title: Cool, but not really a destination
content: This area is very nice and certainly fascinating to walk around in. The French architecture will seem out of place but still very cool. Do not be fooled though, this area is much more famous for its history than any actual attractions. It is still a chinese neighborhood in Shanghai, it just has a couple more French bakeries than other places (which are not very good anyway).

title: Beautiful district
content: High end shopping. The place to be seen (locals) lovely old streets and buildings. Historic buildings all interesting.

title: Incredible
content: I was born in this area and never got tired of visiting it, after some 30 years of living abroad. The streets, people, trees, shops and signs do have a different meaning and you will never get tired of visiting here. A walk or bike tour is excellent choice but you do need a guide to explain because there are just so many hidden treasures...

title: Short walk
content: If you want to forget that your in China this is a great place to visit. A lot of small and expensive shops and cafes/restaurants.

title: Interesting walk.
content: The French concession is an area in Shanghai that is definitely worth going to!If only for a walk..but there is also so much more to it...nice restaurants and old houses make it a very interesting place..My favourite is Fuxing park where people dance,exercise,sing,play badminton,etc...I just love it!!

title: What...what French Concession?
content: So looking forward to sightsee this area, but was very disappointed. Re reading other reviews some of them tend to be reviewing Tianzifang area which is near/within the FFC area. However, I don't think it could be mistaken as French architecture?

title: Interesting for a walk, but lacking in culture
content: Was nice to go for a walk around, but to be honest it is a bit boring. If you are a foreigner or an expat that wants to pretend you are not in china then this would be perfect for you - probably why it is so popular with expats!

title: Small area BUT great spot
content: Dropped in with our guide and just loved the atmosphere. We where there during the day but I'm sure it kicks off at night with some top quality and interesting restaurants

title: Great area mixing old china and developing businesses
content: Great area, combining old china with people sitting in the street selling local food, killing chicken in front of you, selling vegan chinese stuff, grocery stores, vegetables, and then bars of any kind, a little more nord fancy fashion stores, and quite expensive malls. Good to stroll around

title: Crowded market
content: Went on a Saturday and it was too crowded for my tastes. Interesting to hear about the history but I was overwhelmed by the crowds.

title: Lovely to walk around
content: A lovely neighborhood with historical buildings, charming shops and nice cafés. Most definitely worth a visit to roam about.

title: Blast from the Past
content: lovely streets, lots of trees.  Good to see that Shanghai has retained some of historic past.  Son lives in the area, finds it safe, has good cafes and shopping

title: A french colonial outpost in Shanghai
content:
A very interesting, quiet, red brick tree lined neighbourhood filled with cafes, some with outdoor umbrellas and patisseries reminiscent of Paris and with prices to match !
We loved the art galleries, book shops, calligraphy shops etc.

title: Very nice
content: Lovely neighbourhood which seemed to have a lot to offer, ufortunately it started raining so we only had about 1 hour before we had to seek refuge in a small, cozy tea place

title: So fun to just walk around
content: There are many restaurants here so if you get tired of walking, you can stop for a bite.  It is just interesting to see the shops and architecture.

title: The "westernized" part of Shanghai
content: Best district in Shanghai for Westerners. Here you'll find the finest restaurants, bars and most "Laowai" (foreigner) density in Shanghai. It's a great place if you want to keep the Western lifestyle and if you have enough money because it is one of the most beautiful but also one of the most expensive districts in Shanghai.

title: No wrong choice
content: bar and restaurants are of good mix, you will not choose a "wrong" one as most are pretty decent and nice

title: Nice area of Shanghai
content: I enjoy eating pizza at  a western pizza shop in the old french concession and visiting the US consulate office for various reasons.

title: Great Place to walk
content: Lots of great restaurants and interesting shopping in this area.  Up scale boutiques and interesting shops.  Definitely take a little time here.

title: Nice!
content: Waooo! Really nice! Very clean! Very expensive, but the people speak English, are friendly! Many restaurants and bars. Again, expensive, but very good quality!

title: Idylilic and Eclectic
content: The FFC hosts many eateries, cafes where locals and foreigners like to gather, walk their dogs, cycle or just stroll on weekends. It's a place and the reason why most of us residents get out of the house. The neatly lined trees along the road make the walks even more enjoyable. Be surprised by the variety of post-modern architecture found every now and then, and the occasional local who zoomed (literally) pass you with their bicycles and electric scooters.

title: A Great Maze of Shops and Restaurants
content: We found this towards the end of our stay in Shanghai and I wish we'd found it sooner. There are so many shops and restaurants it's like a rabbit warren with new surprises around ever corner.

title: Old European style buildings, not crowded
content: Nice older / European style buildings & good for walking around. Only some of the historical buildings provide access as they are being used for offices etc. Area has also some nice small cafes and restaurants & is not so crowded as some other areas in Shanghai.

title: loved living here for three years
content: The French Concession is to Shanghai what Brooklyn is to New York. Cool, calm with a real vibrancy that makes you want to step out of your apartment and see what is going on around the next corner. The tree lined streets with limited traffic gave it a small town feel. If you have the chance, a must visit in Shanghai

title: Best neighborhood to live and work
content: The only place in Shanghai where you can escape the city and enjoy small quiet streets, old art deco architecture, great restaurants and don't need to take a taxi to get around!

title: A visit to Shanghai is not complete without a visit to the Former French Concession
content: The Forner French Concession (FFC) is my neighbourhood. I have lived in three different areas in Shanghai and this is by far my favourite. As a resident, it is centrally located and public transport - by means of Metro Lines, 1, 7 and 10 , as well various bus routes- is remarkably convenient. We are spoiled for choice for other conveniences, such as multiple supermarkets, both local and international, as well as an abundance of restaurants, noodle bars and cafes. There are a number of historic walks here, Wukang Lu and Fuxing Lu being amoung my favourite. FFC is arguably home to most of Shanghai's Art Deco buildings and old mansions. We also boast a number of good art galleries and scores of great shops and boutiques. There is so much to discover here, even after five years I stumble upon something new while strolling down one of the many tree lined streets. A visit to Shanghai is not complete without a visit to the FFC.

title: Feel the European at China
content: The building and architecture of this area are totally different from Chinesse architecture. Nice view and surrounding to feel a bit of European taste at China.

title: A bit of History
content: Many 19-century biuldings well preserved , a lot of maple trees and an old style charm. If you have to choose a location for your stay in Shanghai , definitely the old French Concession is the place to stay .

title: Nice quiet area
content: This was not quite the old Europe I was led to expect from the reviews. However it is a very nice old area with lots of old architecture and quaint shops. Very few cars design around, which was very nice. While you're in the area check out the propaganda poster art museum and then as the evening wears on, stop at YongKang road for a street FILLED with small bars and tons of expats. That part felt like Europe.

title: Yay
content: It's a bit of a LOL when I saw this place but when I went in it was great and different with any other Frenchy thingy in China. I'm coming back there for sure

title: Rainy day delight
content: Wandered off the Shanghai hop on/off bus. Was wet but not cold. Made our way to a hotel/bar, don't remember the name but something like a'Paris bar'. Originally went as my sis needed the bathroom. The bar was beautiful. We decided 2 stay & have a real French champagne (first time for me). Meet some other wonderful guests, hotel has rooms to let. Would luv to stay here next when I am in Shanghai.

title: nice place for a walk
content: highly recommended for an evening leisure walk to appreciate shanghai French architecture . lots of cafes and restaurants along the way

title: Great boutiques
content: If you want to find one of a kind items rather than tourist souvenirs or name items, this is the place for you. Ferguson Lane is a gem of a place, and we walked all over – there is quite a distance from shopping area to shopping area.

title: Cool part of town!
content: In the ultra modern city of Shanghai, there is a place where you can go that feels a little like Paris and a little more laid back. There are many very good places to eat, people watch and just stroll. Its a nice part of town that I believe is very different from a lot of Shanghai. There are very upscale restaurants to corner eateries (some of which are better than the upscale restaurants). Enjoy yourself here.

title: foodie delight
content: Lovely place for foodies and for chilling out with people.Many nice bars and restaurants are located here with some great architecture to look for one of the best place to visit in shanghai.

title: European style
content: Yoo can skep this area even got short time for your Shanghai visit. Vey stylish European architecture in the middle of Asia. Interesting history, nice restaurants, shopping and a walking place with interesting life style.

title: French Concession
content: Vey stylish European architecture in the middle of Asia. Interesting history, nice restaurants and just a walking place. Modern stores for shoppers and company buildings.

title: Wandering the streets is wonderful
content: The Former French Concession is filled with tree-lined streets and independent stores/restaurants akin to Abbot Kinney in LA or Valencia in SF. The best streets to see are Fumin, Wukang, and Yongjia. Be sure to have a pastry and coffee at Farine, the best bakery in Shanghai, while you're here. It's part of Ferguson Lane, which offers fantastic dining/shopping in the heart of the concession.

title: Beautiful
content: Best place to visit for a European style environment. Take your time among the vintage style decoration. At there there is a small museum which gives you some information about Communism and the entrance is free. You can find it there.

title: Fantastic place to wander around aimlessly!
content: We were on a tight schedule and ad very little time but managed to squeeze in 45 minutes in, it really does deserve much more time. Would definitely revisit this area

title: A night to Remember
content: Best Restaurants can be found here, perfect location; busy streets at night,unique architecture.Must see place if you visit Shanghai....

title: Largest liberty site worldwide
content: This is a European city within the city. Beutiful, nostalgic, dandy, decadent, sexy and charming as Shanghai can be.

title: Amazing architecture
content:
Wow wow wow one of he best places in Shanghai! There you will find many things to do (restaurants, parks, bar, etc)
I enjoyed a beautiful night there.

user_loc: 新西兰奥克兰中心地区
title: Beautiful setting.
content:
Lovely old mansions of French architecture set among superb trees that line the streets and form an avenue.
Gorgeous bakery shops with delicious pastries and buns, plenty to see and wandering around is enjoyable.
I recommend this to visit.

title: Quaint spot for a coffee or meal
content: We stopped here on our tour. We were tired and it was a nice spot to take a break from sight seeing. Quaint buildings, shops, cafes and restaurants. Very European feel. I agree that if you are time poor you could skip this, but for us it was a welcome respite.

title: Great area
content:
My favorite area to walk around
Nice little boutiques and cafes
Escape the chaos in quaint  tree lined streets

title: Nice
content: If you don't have much time, you can skip here. It is a place for walk with shops, some designers clothes are for selling there. Also if you need to do you nails or your hair, there are some great places in there.

title: Our goto area of Shanghai
content: We stayed in this area for part of our stay and loved it.  The shops, the restaurants, and the parks were all very nice.  Even when we stayed more down town we came back here to shop and eat and relax.

title: I live there and it has been for the past five years
content: If there is any history left in Shangai , this will be the place to be where everywhere else has been converted to modern buildings that u won't miss much in the western world . In FFC, u can just pick a little old lane and immerse yourself back to the old times .. Although u might wonder if u r really back in history or u r really in china given that u might see many foreign faces with its popularity among the expats ( Us being one of them despite our Chinese looking faces ) ... Even that , it is still THE place to b in SH

title: Old style
content: Lovely old 2 and 3 story french built row houses or individual mansions cover the area , with plane trees along every street, making for a stylish wander. Glimpses of the past are not hard to find in the atmospheric French Concession, with its interesting juxtaposition of European housing with Chinese characteristics

user_loc: 英国布兰德福德福鲁姆
title: Very Quaint and interesting
content: Very interesting place to visit, especially in the city, its very historical, and an eye opener to how people live, very quaint and loved strolling around these parts

title: Europe's influence on Shanghai
content: A good place to see the mixing of French and Chinese architecture,would recommend for persons who are interested in the history of the region. The tree lined streets do lend a bit of the french romance .

title: A Tinge of Elegance
content: I never get tired of walking around the former French Concession area even though I've been living in Shanghai for over 6 years. A walk in a cool summer afternoon is the best way to refresh and escape from the hustle and bustle of city crowds. The most fun experience is that there are always pleasant surprises here and there. It might be a new opening of a boutique store or a new cafe or a new craft store.

title: Biking is the best way to explore the area
content: It is one of my favorite area in Shanghai! Walking along the Fuxing road with all the trees well plants. You will feel so fresh and enjoy the walk to explore the old buildings with all small alleys. It will turn to different view in winter time. However, I like the area very much so. When I was in Shanghai, I bike to explore the area which I think it’s the best way to do so!!

title: Good walk like a local alien
content: The old French conssesion is the neighborhood of Shanghai where are allocated I think more western immigrants or western workers in Shanghai. So there you will find a lo of Italian restaurants, a whole foods like market and also restaurat. I think it is a very good way to enjoy the city like a alien living there. You can go there, take a long walk, try western restaurant, but also the Chinese food. I found it to be the cleanest Chinese food restaurants far away... Best noddles also, hand made in front of you but can't remember either location or name of the restaurant.

title: Fake true shanghai
content: This place is irritating... They tried to preserve the old Shanghai but it is clearly a fake experience: restaurants (chains), starbucks, shopping centres... Nothing to do with the cultural heritage of the place.

title: Small stroll
content: Just a small stroll through this area, to get to a nice Chinese restaurant for a delicious lunch. Interesting to see the French and Chinese architecture came together.

title: Out of China and into Paris!
content: Once to enter the French concession, you could almost forget that you are in China - the architecture is very Parisian, you see more Westerners than Chinese, and the food is decidedly European. I found the cafes and restaurants relatively less costly than their equivalents in Paris, so this is a good way to taste Paris without travelling to Paris (although a true food connoisseur might disagree)!

title: Factor this into your trip.
content: Not so much a, 'Thing to do' but a place to be.

title: A places to stroll, shop & a few beers
content: If you are visiting Shanghai it's a must area to go shopping. .. They are botique,  art, photography and a lot of bars to people watch... great places for Sunday brunch...

title: wandering
content: Walk through Tianzifan browsing at the shops and stopping for a drink and maybe a bite to eat. We stopped for a burger nachos and a pint or two of Stella.I bought two nice photos for my hubby and another two for my son and his partner. Lovely to wander around and so.etching for everyone.

title: Less than I expected, but alright
content: There are lots of good shops and small restaurants in on this neighborhood's side streets, alongside the big malls and global brands that sit on the main thoroughfares. It doesn't seem big on cultural sites, but it's a nice area to walk and see what attracts the locally, upwardly mobile folks.

title: Worth a stroll
content: from the great diversity of Shanghai streets with the cars everywhere, people sweeping the streets with a besom broom, to suddenly find ourselves in what looks for all the world like a little slice of the Mediterranean. We took time to sit outside a cafe and have an espresso

title: Nice and cute
content: Nickest part of shanghai for me, cute, nice shops and take away food, we enjoyed strolling around here

title: Old Colonial style surprise
content: Lots of character as well as western designer shops and boutiques in contrast to the skyscrapers associated with Shanghai.

title: Not really old or french
content: This is a tourist trap. It's a bit like Covent Garden in the UK. Heaving with bus loads of tourists and really nothing that special and overpriced restaurants.

title: Fun shopping
content: Great place to find trinkets and some unique gifts. The candy making was fun to watch and tons of ice cream choices

title: Quaint eateries
content: Once we found it, we went back every night for dinner. Amazing little restaurants that seat from as few as 8 diners. Some great foods and interesting little shops. Bit of a problem to find exactly where it is supposed to be.

title: Must pass through when in Shanghai!
content: Great shopping, cafe's, restaurants and bars! This area is lively and really nice to have a stroll! Early in the morning it can get a bit crowed by tourists but if you go after lunch you will definitely enjoy it!

title: Stroll through the Former French Concession
content: One of my favorite activities in the whole world (no exaggeration) is to stroll through the Former French Concession on a sunny summer or autumn day. I first visited Shanghai in 2008 and moved there in 2010, and still the streets of the Former French Concession enchant me every time. If you don't know where to fo, here are some of my favorite routes.

title: Wander Around
content: The French Concession is beautiful area of Shanghai to wander around and get lost in a really nice part of Shanghai, away from the other parts of the city that can get a little overwhelming.

title: This is the place to hang if you need a cosy moment in SH
content: So - this was the first area I visited in SH and its still the best

title: Beautiful
content: Beautiful place to walk through. A great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of Shanghai. Cute little coffee shops and boutique shops.

user_loc: 新西兰奥克兰中心地区
title: France in Shanghai
content: This is a little touristy but still quaint and worth a visit. Good shopping mall if you feel the need for some retail therapy. Food in the area is more American with burgers, sandwiches, fries etc but a little pricey.

title: A little germ in the city
content: Lower buildings in a big city filled with europeans. For a moment you forget you are in Shanghai with its high buildings and glittery skyline. A perfect getaway to slow down from the fast past city that is Shanghai

title: the best place for coffee
content:
I like the Quality food there.
dislike No sufficent time to relax, test and visit some other cafe and restaurants there

title: Great place to watch people
content: Many great restaurants and feels like being anywhere but Shanghai and worth spending a few hours watching people

title: Very traditional Chinese City Centre area
content: Great to wander around and take in the varied architecture, hustle and bustle of this area. Plenty of food shops and other interesting aspects to see including the water area with loads of photo opportunities.

title: Amazing choices at all price points, quality and sophistication
content: Ye Shanghai - high end and sophisticated; Crystal Jade - very good quality, lightning fast service, good value

title: Where is it?
content: Be aware, it is not a place, it is an area where you will find some french stores/restaurants.

title: Wander the streets of Shanghai
content: I recommend a walk through the French Concession of Shanghai. There are beautiful, tree-lined streets and interesting neighborhoods and parks to explore. I recommend following a walking tour of sorts to have some sense of where to go to make sure you see some of the unique buildings. A lovely place to wander for an afternoon!

title: Artistic European part of Shanghai
content: The old buildings are beautiful and well maintained, feels and look like you are in Paris or city in Europe rather in China.

title: Though very attractive, it was smothering with people
content: We did buy a few needed gifts for our trip home, but found the staff not helpful for anything but getting you to buy what they were selling.  Couldn't get directions, probably because of the crush of potential customers.

title: Peaceful and enjoyable
content: Our guide showed us around this area and it was an easy and enjoyable walk. There are a moderate amount of things to see. The shopping district was one of the better ones in the area. We had a good time.

title: Best nightlife
content: The best clubs and bars are in this part of town. Great mix of locals and expats. Would highly recommend it for a night out to any from 20-50 years old.

title: Best cure for Shang-low days
content: By far my favorite place to chase away the blues on Shang-low days. Find a wonderful little restaurant to wile away the hours and sit back and enjoy. Then go for a stroll. I recommend Salute at 59 Fuxing Xi Lu near Yongfu Lu. or Cotton's at 132 Anting Lu near Jianguo Xi Lu.

title: Lovely Restaurants
content:
You wouldn't expect this area in china,so amazing and different with its quaint little street restaurants.
Architecture is worth looking at.
Reminded me of being in europe.
Food is awesome.

title: So Much History, Amazing Photo Op's
content: Summary: Much of the old French Concession has been renovated and now has a distinctly modern feel but with an old look. The architecture is genuine, the atmosphere electric. Restaurants, shops, and cafes are sprinkled throughout the area which gives it a positively cozy feel. I love coming here and just walking around to take in atmosphere. It's addictive.

title: Well Worth It for the Architecture Alone
content: This area demands a visit, perhaps if only viewing it from the Bund, to get at least some feeling of Shanghai's colonial past.  A number of upscale hotels and restaurants are also located here.

title: Nice place but overratedif you ask me
content: Yes, the lanes are nice and there are many good restaurants. However I find the whole hype around this place a bit much. But it is ofcourse worth a visit.

title: Feels like not in China
content: Nice pedestrian avenue space with many quality food choices restaurant here. Ambiance is an European street with many nice looking buildings, well maintained trees and big space pedestrian. Suitable for short stop rest combined with food hunting

title: French touch
content: Surprisingly calming area in the middle of bustling Shanghai. Nice park and cafes to visit. And the old french building feeling

title: High quality restaurants, low dealing cabbies
content: Restaurants here high of quality and price, offering a lovely dining experience in charming surrounds. Good variety of cuisines, al fresco dining. At night, getting taxis away from the French Concession is a rip-off though. We paid 3 times more to get back to hotel than to get there. Long taxi line and drivers refuse to use meters or bargain and won't back down on the inflated prices. Knowing this will save you a bit of a rude shock at the end of your evening. Don't let it put you off going there, just expect it.

title: Xintiandi
content: I would prefer Tianzifang as opposed to Xintiandi. because Xintiandi looks fake (many restored building etc) as compared to Tianzifang. Nonetheless it is a beautiful area to walk through and spent few hours. There are many nice cafe to hangout or just sit down.

title: Quaint area
content: Nice shops and restos. Fun to explore. The only area wit french Phoenix trees lined up the main road. Just be prepared to use yucky chinese restroom. And always bring TP.

title: Pretty
content: Very pretty pedestrian mall with restaurants and shopping. Again good people watching but I went through rather quickly and could adequately assess any restaurant or other attraction,but nice to see

title: great walk of history
content: plan 3-4 hours minimum, lots of pretty places.  Many restaurants and historical areas. Shopping, clothing too.

title: A different era
content: Living in Pudong , the day trip to the French concession is a strep back to an era of beauty. The buildings are European style. Although they are mostly behind walks, there are beautiful gardens. The streets are treelined, and particularily on weekends, relatively quiet ( holidays excepted). The old French park is serene and peaceful. Much of the architecture has been protected.

title: So great that I choose to live here...
content: This area is so different than typical China. It is tree lined streets with such a cool bohemian vibe but still the essence of China. You can still see men and women walking about in their pjs, or walking backwards down the streets, washing in the streets...Just an interesting place. Such a great place that many want to live here...I am lucky enough to be one that does!

title: Nice district/concession)
content: Visited here in Nov 2012, it was fascinating to see this little French town in Shanghai. Different types of shops here were in French, similar to those in Beijing. Buildings are also quite Medieval times look.

title: nice quarter
content: This is a nice Shanghai quarter where you can see small shops, bars and restaurants as well as chinese people playing cards, mahjong and eating outside. Best way to enjoy is by bike or on foot.

title: Old Shanghai
content: A wonderful contrast to the ultra modern Pudong area the old French concession should not be missed when visiting Shanghai.

title: No very "french" but it's interesting to go
content: Not very Frenchy, but worth the trip to go. There are a lot of restaurants and cafes. Nice relaxing place to chill out. Ask the taxi driver to send you to "xintiandi".

title: Great historical area
content: The French concession is lovely and has a lot of Chinese historical sites, like the home of Dr. Sun Yat Sen and his wife Soong Qing Ling, Fuxing Park, the Site of the First National Congress of the Chinese Communist Party, just to name a few of the sites. You can easily spend the day there.

title: French flavor in Shanghai
content: The area has a very European feel with little shops and restaurants. This was part of our best of Shanghai tour. We also took a cooking class in the French concession. A nice way to spend an afternoon

title: Beautiful and lovely
content: This is the most beautiful and lovely part of Shanghai, a very different part from other areas. You should plan for a few hours to stroll on the tree lined streets, have a cup of coffee or beer. There are so many nice coffee places (not cheap though) and bars, as well as many small boutiques and shops.

title: Beautiful Area
content: Nice area to walk and enjoy the buildings. Stop for lunch or coffee at one of the many restaurants i the area.

title: Tree lined Streets
content: A very pretty part of Shanghai with lovely homes and gardens and interesting shops and restaurants. A lovely way to spend a morning or afternoon walking and browsing.

title: Don't come here at night the first time!
content: Our mistake was to try and walk this area the first time just as it was getting dark and even though I have a better than average sense of direction it was easy to get turned around and lost.

title: Nice place for a coffee
content: Took a nice walk thru this area. Lots of great restaurants and coffee places. Very much an area full of ex-pats. Cute markets. Worth 2-3 hours.

title: Excellent for walking..
content: Beautiful streets, quiet places, some shops, some small restaurants.... Nice place to walk around in Shanghai..

title: Great break from the hustle & bustle
content: The tree lined streets, fine shopping & quiet hutong/back streets could easily lead you to forget you are in Shanghai. We used the lonely planet walking tour guide which covered off all the important sights to see. Next time in Shanghai I would spend a couple of nights at the old French Athletic Club Hotel

title: The Green Village of Shanghai
content: This is from my point of view the most beautiful part of Shanghai because it looks like a park with a lot of tree's. In here you can also find tons of restaurants incl. a Paulaner Beer-garden with excellent western style food & beer. As the French Consession is not very big, you can come here by subway or taxi and can then just walk around. A good hotel close by is the Hilton.

title: DIFFERENT EPOQUE
content: Entering the French Concession takes you directly to the 20's in Shanghai and you imagine the life in those days. Houses are all wooden and not tall, beautiful. They keep their tiny gardens and it is really cozy and nice.

title: Like being in the Greenwich village new york
content: Very traditional, quiet with beautiful low buildings. It is a really posh place packed with super expensive shops. Restaurants are just expensive...

title: A MUST !!
content: if you're going to SH you just have to visit the french concession ..it's nice both in the afternoon and evening .. full of restaurants and coffee shops

title: Old Shanghai
content: Spent a wonderful morning exploring this beautiful historical area of shanghai. Lots of great local street food available as well as pretty parks to sit and relax in

title: New and Old French Concession
content: I had a private guide to walk through the new (restaurants,shops) and the old/local area of the French Concession. I learned so much on this walking tour and loved the area.

title: French Concession
content: Interesting, but disappointing to not be able to see some of the mansions there.  Interesting, upscale shops mostly.

title: We love this part of Shanghai
content: Its like being in Paris with lovely tree lined boulevards, restaurants, shops, bars and nightlife. Some lovely old buildings show the French influence in this vibrant city.

title: Old French Concession - Food
content: This is an interesting neighborhood with tree lined streets and interesting shops. Much of the expat community lives here. Because of this there are many restaurants that appeal to foreign travelers that have had their fill of Chinese cuisine and want a familiar taste in their mouth.

title: Nice walking area
content: Beware the French Concession takes up a major piece of land. Make sure you know where you are going before you head towards a shop in the French Concession because we couldnt end up in the same place as the day before that we wanted to revisit.

title: Retained beauty
content: The area demands a visit, if only for the past grandeur, the memories that bubble out from the surrounds, parks, and grounds.  Take me back 100 years, please.

title: Historic Old Shanghai
content: Worth a walk along the tree shaded streets here in the historic French Concession to look at the architecture and to see how the locals live in traditional lane houses. Lot's of boutique shops along the avenues for those interested in window shopping or more.

title: Trendy Expat area
content: I enjoyed just walking the streets in this area and finding little cafes and boutiques to window shop at. Lovely little spot to slow down and relax through an afternoon.

title: Must see on a visit to Shanghai!
content: The old French concession is a wonderful maze of shops, restaurants and gastropubs. Well worth a tour and situated in a beautiful neighborhood in the heart of Shanghai!

title: Went here for Lunch
content: You could instantly see the french influence after stepping in. The quarter is full of resturants with terraces and surrounded by boutique arts and design museums. Worth a visit if you are really missing home

title: Trendy
content: Very trendy part of town good food and a nice place to people watch.Many places to eat and drink a vert cute part of town ,small lane ways lead to who knows where.

title: Trendy area
content: Lovely little area tucked into modern Shanghai. Lots of bars and restaurants where you can sit and people watch.

title: Great architecture but very westernised
content: We visited the Old French Concession one night and really enjoyed the architecture and ambience of the place. The place is also buzzing which was good. However, most of the restaurants were western style with the obligatory Starbucks, Pizza Express and other western food outlets. If you are looking to immerse yourself in Chinese culture and to sample Chinese food this may disappoint you. It is worth a visit to see the old architecture and sights such as the fountain and other sculptures.

title: huge area not to be missed
content: The French concession actually covers a surprisingly large area with pleasing streets, sights and architecture. To fully appreciate the area and it's multiple attraction, one probably should lodge in the area. Largely unspoiled.

title: Wander the semi-European streets
content: This was the home of French. It can be beautiful old mansions or a rabbit warren of alleys and former warehouses. It is now a very toney area with HIGH prices on almost everything. But there are lots of shops and restaurants.

title: Favorite area in Shanghai
content: The French Concession is my favorite part of Shanghai so far. The quaint restaurants, shops and streets are something worth seeing.

title: Amazing environment and cute place
content: I had the luxury of being able to rent those pick up and drop off anywhere public bikes from a Chinese friend. Biking down the streets in the French Concession was a wonderful experience. The environment and vibe was amazing with the older buildings and trees that completely covers the sky stemming from either side of the road. It really brought the vibe and feeling of old Shanghai. Combined with biking, I let like I was in 1920.

title: Modern
content: Relaxing area with boutique shops and superstores. Nice cafes for ice cream, coffee etc.The area had character and was peaceful.

title: Little French Quarters
content: For us local expats in the city this is the best part of Shanghai. The tree-lined avenues and the many fine old houses in the area still retain an air of French period, nowadays converted into many trendy bars, boutiques and little (upscale) restaurants. My best advice is just explore, relax, eat and shop around, you can easily spend few hours there.

title: Worth a Visit
content: The French Concession is a lovely area to visit with great boutiques and restaurants.  Not quite so hectic as the rest of Shanghai.  Lovely area to have lunch on a nice day. Loads of restaurants with outside space

title: Old French Concession
content: Loved the architecture of this place. The sights are overwhelming and the period of time is represented perfectly by the historical aspects which are on display.

title: A bit of French architecture, made in China!
content: What remains from 180years of history is this piece of French real estate in Shanghai. It is converted to trendy eateries, galleries and shops for all to enjoy. Explore, relax, eat and shop around the nice alleys and plazas.

title: A piece of Europe in Shanghai
content: A wonderful area, best to visit in the early evening, clean and tidy nowadays. Perfect place to relax after intense day, to wander around some cozy bars and little restaurants. All the local expats come here to enjoy the city.

title: Swanky Area of Shanghai
content: This area is inhabited by the affluent Chinese and expats with ambition. There are some wonderful old buildings from the colonial period and it makes a nice change from some of the high rise in shanghai.

title: Beautiful and well kept
content: This is an excellent area to spend an afternoon, indulge in some food or wine or coffee and to admire the beautiful old buildings. Definitely worth a visit. The only catch is there are no public transport options close by and no directions in English. So if you are new to the city and don't speak the language, it can be hard to find, unless you have a specific street or business address. The closest you can come to asking or looking for, by yourself is the Site of the First National Congress. All tourist sites are usually displayed on a big brown board. Be prepared to walk, a lot.

title: The French Quarters.
content: A happening place to visit, eat & shop.  As we were on a tour, we only had about 45 minutes to look around.  We could have stayed there for 2 - 3 hours.

title: Excellent area for shopping, bars and restaurants, caters to westerners, can communicate easily in English
content: This area is heavily frequented by westerners as well as Chinese themselves, very good restaurants and bars, plus the most expensive luxury brands on Fuxing Road.  You can check Wikipedia for history and more on this area.

title: Great tourist place
content: Great place to eat and drink out. Loads of options to eat there. Catering to all taste buds and a very lively place.

title: Hidden oasis
content: This area of Shanghai is a hidden oasis away from the bustle of modern Shanghai. Well worth a visit with trendy bars and eateries

title: Cycling Through
content: The history and important people that tend to live in the French Concession was fascinating!  This is like a country within a country.

title: Great walks during christmas
content: When sun is in Shanghai ! Get out and walk around in the french concession ! very nice "balade" to do and many unique shopping places !

title: Worth strolling around in the French
content: Highly recommend walking around the French Concession over the course of one day. There's so much to see and the area is clean, safe and perfect for that foto opportunity. We followed this bloggers advice and thought that the route was really good. http://twosuitcasesandatinpot.com/self-guided-walking-tour-shanghais-former-french-concession-area/

title: Atmosphere
content: Nice area with amazing Atmosphere.Here you will find all expats community.Nice restaurants and bars available.A good place to start the night

user_loc: 明尼苏达明尼阿波利斯
title: Pretty Part of the City
content: One of our favorite parts of Shanghai, the French Concession has pretty tree-lined streets and nice boutiques and restaurants. It really does feel more European than the rest of the city. There is still the high-end shopping on the main streets, but head off a block or two and you're in neighborhood Shanghai. Come here for dinner and/or drinks at least one night. On our short stroll around one small area, we saw several places we wanted to check out.

title: Nice area, lots of restaurants
content: The French Concession area is nice, filled with European-style buildings. There's not necessarily much to do, but there is quite a wide selection of Western restaurants, and it's nice to see a different kind of area in the middle of the city.

title: Travel China Guide
content: The French Concession is the area of Shanghai that was established for the French government to administrate from 1849 until 1946. The tree-lined avenues and the many fine old houses in the area still retain an air of the "Paris of the East". In particular, the many wrought iron fences and stair railings will look familiar to anyone who knows Paris or Montreal.

title: Old French Concession
content: Part of crowded Shanghai, you will need some guidence to find the French Concession as it is in the center of Shanghai's crowded streets and businesses but a good place to drive through and stop to stroll around. Crowded but again, Shanghai is a crowded city bursting at the seams with new building going on daily. Many great shops once your off the tourist beaten path.

title: Comfort in an urban jungle
content: While my wife and I lived in Shanghai, going to a cafe in the French Concession and walking the tree-lined streets was a great way to spend a weekend. Wonderful part of the city

title: Great fun area.
content: Our tour guide Annie Guo took us to this area and provided us with the history of the area. The shopping in the area was great with both cheap and more up market shops. We returned that night on the recommendation of Annie to have dinner in a local restaurant. The restaurants in the area are of a high quality with varying prices ranges. Highly recommend this area.

title: A must seen
content: Very special are of Shanghai where you find the local and international flavour. Totally recomendable!

title: Amazing walking district
content: Having been a visitor to the Old French Concession for over 20 years I can tell you, it just keeps getting better (and more up-scale/expensive). Some of the trendiest restaurants, elegant shops and nice streets to walk on. Or just grab a book and watch the people go buy.

title: French Concession area - Shanghai
content: A lot of the old buildings in this area have been well maintained and restored. It is very pleasant to walk the old streets that are lined with many restaurants of all types of cuisine.

title: Interesting to see it, as a comparison with modern Shanghai.
content: This is a genuinely historical area, and I think the only relic of the original concessions occupied by many of the Western powers. One needs to look beyond the shop-fronts to see which are the original buildings, which are low rise in comparison with so much much of Shanghai. Now it is full of coffee shops, restaurants and other shops which are buzzing for most of the time. It is also somewhere where one can get a good coffee. The fact that the first meeting of the Communist Party of China was held in this area adds interest, and possibly piquancy. It's easy to find, as its entrances are well guarded.

title: Wander lust
content:
We spent a good day wandering the French Concession area. It is actually huge and you will not cover it all in a day. 
We enjoyed seeing the house that was the site of the formation of the Communist Party and visiting the markets.

title: a piece of Europe in China
content: What can I say? I loved it.

title: Very nice area
content: Went there with my cousin. We rode Mobike around this area. Lots of green, restaurants and bars. nice neighborhood. Recommend to go there with friends in the afternoon and evening.

title: Lovely to walk around
content: Very pretty to wander round and some nice restaurants.  There are lots of hotels and restaurants in this area.  For a modern updated experience visit the Xintandi area - restored with some walk through museum type houses and modern restaurants.

title: Lovely area
content: With an informative guide book in hand this is a marvellous area to explore. With the broad tree lined avenues and the unique shops, you could be in Paris.

title: Another unique in Shanghai
content: Great architecture, serene and upscale. Walked into a classic, huge InterContinental Hotel .. and a Shanghai Museum shop as well. Discovered Shanghai Slims, a great restaurant along the walk.

title: A Place you must visit
content: Brilliant place to visit. It takes through history of Shanghai. Many antique and souvenir shops with a large varieties of cafes and restaurants. Few of the best restaurants in Shanghai are there. Not to be missed

title: Old atmosphere and Colonial
content:
Loved the Colonial feel and wanted to replicate the feeling from the moview Empire Of The Sun.
Love the buildings, avenures, tress, retaurants everything

title: Tourist trap
content:
Just small restaurants,wine bars,coffee shops....a lot of tourists and a restauration of the buildings that completely ignores the Athens Chart.
Many more small old places with real local and touristic market around the city

title: a good place for dinner
content: This is a great place to find good western restaurants. Some offer outdoor dining which makes it a good place to watch the world go by.

title: A nice place to visit
content: This area of Shanghai is lovely to walk around. We saw quite a few wedding parties having their photos taken in this area. There are many rich people who live in this area and the architecture is lovely. There are many cafes in the area. This is also the area where General Chow En-Lai's residence can be found. It is a great place to people watch.

title: Did I Miss Something?!
content: Old French Concession?! Where exactly is it or did I miss something? There was nothing OLD about this place, except for some of the hotels. I was there on Sunday afternoon. Way to many people, way to many overpriced shops and malls. Since when did MasterCard not become an acceptable from of payment. Honestly, I was pretty disappointed with the overall experience. Maybe it was just me and I missed something or maybe I am 100% correct.

title: The (former) French Concession
content: A great place to spend a day peacefully riding bicycles through this gorgeous slow paced area, in the middle of the Shanghai Metropolis. Bikes can now be easily rented, and in the summer the trees form a canopy of shade over the streets. Most of the traditional architecture is untouched. One of the parts of Shanghai that vividly recalls the historic Twenties & Thirties Era

title: Interesting and different to the rest of Shanghai
content: It's a good place to walk around, to eat and to have a drink in the small bars that line the streets. The architecture is interesting. The shops were pretty touristy and expensive, but there are some nice ones hidden away. It feels much more European than the rest of Shanghai- not sure if that's a good or a bad thing! I liked it though and would recommend spending some time there.

title: Another side of Shanghai
content: If you have time this area is worth a visit. Architecture, culture and food. A nice way to spend a couple of hours. Worth doing a little reading about its history before visiting.

title: Nice Place with Good Variety
content: Spend a half day here just walking around and soaking up the sights. Plenty of good ethnic restaurants and shops to satisfy everyone. Grab a local map and try to get lost in the rabbit warrens behind the main streets, but also stop in the fancy shops just because they're there. Know what I mean???

title: Walk around
content: Walking around in the French Concession and now and then go inside a small bar, restaurant or bar is a great way to spend an afternoon in Shanghai!

title: Very hip, very cool
content: almost too hip for me, but I enjoyed the people watching and the cool stores--not much history left here, so don't look for it.

title: Great place for lunch or to walk and explore
content: The French concession (or French quarter) provides European architecture in Shanghai and connects to Shanghai's trading past. The area is now dominated by better quality cafes and restaurants - many without outside patios. A wide range of cuisine is available here and there are many high end shops to visit. There is a particular cluster of high end watch stores and, of course, many clothing stores with the latest fashions. The mix of people is varied. A great place to wander and people watch or see the sights.

title: Lovely, lively place with mixture of old and new
content: We went there at night and found the whole place to lively and with alot of restaurants and bars. Many of which were extremely modern with western drinks and foods. There was also a variety of Chinese restaurants and eateries to choose from. It was one of the few places that was busy and crowded until 2 i past midnight.

title: Very Cool
content: Beautiful tree-lines streets, super-cool bars and restaurants, great street food, trendy shops.  A must visit if visiting Shanghai.  A totally different experience than the Bund.

title: good architecture and restaurants
content: The area was where the expats lived in the 20's and 30's.  The architecture is preserved and the restaurants in the area are excellent, especially Lost Heaven.

title: Cute, but Western
content: The French Concession is a very nice, quaint section of town with pretty tree-lined streets and uniform low-rise European architecture. However, it's essentially an attractive shopping area of Western chain shops, akin to Boston's Quincy Market or NYC's South St Seaport.  Other than the Museum...

title: Not what we expected
content: It is a working district, not a tourist trap, so things are a little spread out and not easy to find. However if you have the spare time in Shanghai, and don't mind exploring, you can wander about and find somewhere to eat or drink.

title: If you are in the area
content: Maybe i didnt find the right area but i found this a bit disappointing, chique butiques and restaurants, some quaint shops, but over all a bit dull. Good for a walkabout if you are in the area anyway.

title: Lovely part of town
content: Compared to Nanjing Rd this area is an oasis of calm.  Low rise buildings and villas offer cafes, bars and boutiques.   Very pleasant.

title: Lovely and peaceful area to walk around and enjoy
content: French Concession is one of those areas in Shanghai that I liked right the the start. It has nice single family and brick building architecture and history. The roads are good for walking, there are quiet areas, cafes, small shops and boutigues in the are....

title: Looking for a little break in your trip - here it is!
content: A collection of bistros, restaurants, bars and fun. It's clean, safe and the establishments do their best to make you feel comfortable and relaxed. Worth and hour to catch your breath from the other excitement of the City.

title: A fascinating crowded place
content: There are many fascinating stores and interesting shops in this area; but with the very narrow and overcrowded walkways it was a challenge.  It is worth visiting though.

title: A great place to stroll
content: Parisian style boulevards, with a Shanghai twist! Definitely worth a wander if you have a spare evening. Shops, restaurants, international bars: excellent

title: Nice enough but no real significance
content: Also known as Xintiandi, this once dilapidated area was apparently purchased and renovated by the actor Jackie Chan. The area does have some nice restaurants (mid ti high price range) and expensive tourist shopping. Good if you are at a loss for lunch.

title: French Concession Area of Shanghai
content: Nice area, lots of souvenir shopping but not inexpensive. If you've been to France it won't impress but interesting area and certainly different from other architecture in Shanghai.

title: Wonderful Place to Stroll & Eat
content: It's a small area (about 2 city blocks by 2 city blocks) full of restaurants and small stores/botiques. You can find a Starbucks here as well as other cafes that have terraces to enjoy people watching, the weather and/or a nice conversation with your party. It's a great place to find all sorts of international dishes and take good photographs of the unique architecture that makes up the Old French Concession. My wife and I went there around 1130am and were there for about 2hrs. Having dinner there would have been equally sastisfying!!! A metro station is only 2 or 3 blocks away!!! I hightly recommended it!!!!

title: French Concession
content: It's interesting architecture for China, but if you have visited France you may not be as impressed. The houses are now bistro's, upmarket shops and galleries and so nice to spend time in and around and its all very chi chi and the cost is very high.

title: Nice architecture and good souvenirs shopping, although a bit expensive
content: The old french concession in Shanghai is one of the nicest looking parts of the city, it still feels rather authentic although it got a bit overcrowded recently, it moved from a cheap alternative area to a fairly touristic one.

title: Historical area of Shanghai
content: It's well worth a visit, and take the time to walk around and spend some time there. There's plenty to do and see. I went on a walking tour and the guide was a wonderful host and provided me with the background historical perspective that brings the area to life - but you could just as easily do some reading and walk around the area by yourself, or as a couple.... very safe I found.

title: Best part of SH
content: The former french concession is in some ways the best part of SH. The atmosphere is casual, and it's possible to find eatings from all corners of the world. This is a part of town that is strongly influenced from the western world.

title: Very nice part of Shanghai
content: I walked here just to have been here and seen it, but ended up walking around for hours just taking in the atmosphere. There is a really nice park, and in general just a good atmospheric part of the city.

title: A Gem
content: The area is reasonably large so a full day can just disappear. There's just so many different things to see.

user_loc: 南卡罗来纳美特尔海滩
title: Nice quiet area of Shanghai
content: We visited during midday on Monday and it is a beautiful tree shaded area of upscale boutiques, restaurants local to Shanghai as well as Wolfgang Pucks and Starbucks. There is a very beautiful park located adjacent to the French Concession. We found the area to be a nice break from the hustle and bustle of Shanghai. A nice oasis with unique architecture in the heart of Shanghai to have lunch and maybe spend another hour .

title: Enjoyable walk, shaded with trees
content: This is one of the few walkable areas in China that both locals and tourists really like. The area is shaded with trees during warmer parts of the year, and there are cafes, restaurants and boutique shops lining the area. If you're into local experiences, there are also hole-in-the-wall noodle and dumpling eateries that have an old-school vibe. Come night, there are great restaurants and bars with an international clientele, so there's something for everyone here.

title: Interesting
content: Quite a modern area, interesting market and shops. I really liked the relaxed, clean streets. Always try haggling

title: Nice walk..
content: I stayed here in a friends house.. The area is so nice, perfect to walk and have some drinks in the surroundings. There are a couple of bars over there, expensive... Yes! But worth it.

title: good night life
content: The french conseccion is a very western place so if youare tired of eating chineese take a walk here to see the  good bars and restaurants ,  very nice a bit expensive ,  but had a nice dinner .

title: architecture
content: walk this neighbourhood for hours , it was fill with alot of old building and also new  with unique architectures.

title: Elegant and exiting
content: Just to walk the streets of this area is a treat. There are masses of bars and restaurants to fit any budget

title: A little of France in China
content: Feeling a bit like Paris the area is full of restaurants, shopping and ambiance. A great place to sit out and have a drink while watching tourist and locals alike roam about.

title: Disappointing toerist trap
content: What was once an interesting area is now a tourist trap in semi old buildings. Lots of stores with nothing much to offer. Expected more

user_loc: 明尼苏达明尼阿波利斯
title: I don't get it!
content: Took the metro to the French concession.  Unless I missed something, I  don't get why you would visit here.  There are some trendy restaurants but little else. Walked around and then left.  What a waste of time. Tian Z Dang is much better

title: A must visit place to know Shanghai
content: Unlike Beijing, Shanghai history and culture is closely in relation with international concessions and relationships. Even Shanghai architecture is a mixture of western and Chinese architectures. To understand Shanghai as it is today visit this concession though you may not like it as I did not!

title: nice walk
content: Take Line 1 to South Saanxi Rd and walk along the road. Big department stores like Parkson above the metro. We enjoyed our walk along the South Saanxi Rd very nice tree and building structures. There will be a lady in a motor bike selling French jazz CDs. The loud blast of the music from the speakers on the motor bike give an nice atmosphere.

title: Didn't think this was worth a visit
content: Don't waste your time-lots has been renovated so really no character.  Lots of international food and beverage outlets.

title: Experience a different side of Shanghai
content: Full of real life, young hip and vibrant.  Eat local, cheap and tasty or upscale gourmet.  Drink local beer or a pint of Guinness.  Wander down these three lines streets and soak up the atmosphere of a previous mystical Shanghai

title: A good way to experience Old Shanghai
content: The growth rate of Shanghai has also been at a price - what used to be is becoming difficult to find. But in the former French Concession area the small shops and hotpot hole-in-the-wall businesses still thrive. It may be that the number of mini boutiques have increased but it is important to dare leave the main streets in this area to discover the traces of what was. Especially important if you what to see heritage architecture, which happens to be one of my passions, the former French Concession still has lots to to show.

title: Different archtecture, but nothing special
content: We walked here and looked through the area, but could not see what the fuss was about. Many cafe's and restaurants, but not too much else. We ate lunch here and found it more expensive than many other areas, obviously a tourist trap.

title: Upscale shanghai area
content: Nice streets, restaurants and bars in this area. Lower buildings and peaceful compared to the other shopping crowded area in Shanghai.

title: Away from the hustle and bustle
content: The Former French Concession area is vast, the area which I love and have an affinity to is found between Changshu Road that leads up to Jing'An Temple and east all the way to Huashan Road with Yan'An Road and Hengshan Road being the north and south border respectively.

title: A taste of France
content: Wow, how clean, clear and trendy, with restaurants and bars as well as French shops.. So unexpected and so welcoming. A big contrast tto the local streets.

title: Very nice place to find restaurants
content: From my point of view, this was the most interesting place in Shanghai. I loved the architecture of the place and the atmosphere there.

title: Beautiful tree lined streets and boutiques
content: The French Concession is a gorgeous neighbourhood with a European atmosphere. It was great to learn about the history of the area, enjoy the excellent shops and restaurants. It is quite pricey here though, so if you want regional foods and economical prices, then be sure to eat before entering this large neighbourhood.

title: Nice place to eat
content: Nice little area that has some nice shops, restaurants, and bars. Many of the Ex-PATs/Westerners living in Shanghai go here for dinner- especially on the weekends.Take 932 bus down there and back to the river/Bund area.

title: Expensive place for a drink
content: A very nice colonial place to see and worth spending an hour or so wondering around. Be prepared to pay £7 for a pint of beer.

title: Bleh
content: Somehow this place still has a reputation for being characterful and charming.  It's not.  It is a good place to people-watch, get some reliably good (but expensive) food, and enjoy drinks with friends, but I wouldn't put it higher than that.

title: Take a nice stroll down the memory lane
content: I'm so glad amidst all the crazy high rise development in Shanghai, there exists a section in the middle of the city, with tree lined streets, old villas, away from the crowds, the noise, the hustle and bustle of the large city. Where you are not pressured, and not rushed by the crowds around you. A place where you can take nice and slow strolls, and enjoy the much desired tranquality.

title: Many Passages and shops to venture in.
content: My husband and I couldn't believe what we had walked into. I felt like we had stumbled in the shops in Harry Potter. Narrow passage ways with trinket shops, restaurants, and little bars. We visited this place in the afternoon, but can only imagine how more magical it would appear in the evening with the lights, sounds and smells of the various little restaurants cooking their special dishes. Will definitely come to this spot again.

title: So cozy and nice
content: A very nice area to walk around the cozy streets, look at small shops and eat at nice cafes! A very western dominated place - a great escape for expats!

title: Not the REAL Shanghai !!
content: If you're looking for a Yuppie, overpriced, renovated part of Shanghai then this is the place for you. personally, besides the nice buildings (European), it did nothing for me. I would rather spend time in Old Shanghai (Chinese) to REALLY take you back in time to how it was & still is only streets away from this version.

title: Spend a week exploring
content: I recently spent a week at the old Jin Jiang hotel, and was basically on my own during the work week, as my only friend there was working. I was able to get around easily, the folks at the hotel were helpful, lots of good food close. Transportation is easy, with lots of stuff (shops, parks, restaurants, etc.) within walking distance, also the MTR in Shanghai is pretty simple even if you don't speak Mandarin. I certainly enjoyed it a lot, including walking down to Xintiandi and experiencing a little American culture at Starbucks :)

title: Nicest area in Shanghai
content: This is what I consider the nicest Shanghai's area.

title: Worth a breeze through
content: The French Concession is great if you are looking to see what Europe might feel like in Shanghai. It is also a super place for upscale dining - or a taste of what you might miss from home; there is a Haagen-Dazs store for ice cream. For shopaholics, this is the place but the fact that the stores actually take credit cards tells you they are all pricey. Definitely worth some time, but Shanghai has so much to offer, don't spend too much time here.

title: My favorit place in Shanghai
content: Great place - mixture of French and Chinese architecture and seem to be a small closed city for itself. Great restaurants and bars, local shops and exclusive boutiques. The streets are packed with locals and tourists but the atmosphere is aways positive. Highly recommended !

title: Hark back to the old days
content: We were told that it is called the French Quarter. Perhaps it is the same as the French Concession because it was here that the traders from France had a major presence. Realising the value of tourism and the lure of days gone by apparently the Government of China hired an Australian architect to rejuvenate / renovate the old French Concession and make it attractive for the western tourist. He certainly did a good job as also the Chinese authorities. It is full of lights and life in the evenings with many restaurants and street side cafes which gives a feeling of being in France. If you have an evening to spare do go there for drinks and dinner. Visit highly recommended.

title: The best area of Shanghai
content: I've been visiting Shanghai since the 1980s and I always stay in the French Concession. It's the most beautiful and charming area of the city. Of course it has always had the old colonial homes and buildings and wide, tree-lined streets, but in recent years it has also nurtured a large influx of trendy shops, bars and cafes. Yet the character remains very pleasant. At times you can forget you're in one of the world's largest and busiest cities. There are numerous subway stops that can take you down to the Bund or elsewhere. Prices have naturally gone up dramatically as the city has become more prosperous and drawn more tourists. But it remains good value.

title: Really nice area
content: It's a great area. It is not how I envisioned Shanghai at all. The area is much bigger than I originally thought and it includes a few different neighborhoods.

title: Best part of Shanghai
content: Came here first about 8 years ago - liked it so much I now live here - Nuff said!!

title: You'll know it when you see it.
content: There is a distinct architecture that symbolises the French Concession, and it should certainly be in your itinerary in Shanghai.

title: Lovely Neighborhood to Wander
content: We love strolling cities to soak in the ambience, and the French Concession is a great place in Shanghai to do that. There are plenty of tiny lanes and alleys to check out and many interesting facades and grand old buildings to see and photograph. It can be bustling and hectic but that also makes for a vibrant pace and lots of people watching. There are some nice places to eat if you check some of the little shops.

title: I live here, I love it
content: Where better to live in Shanghai. The prices are high but so is the buzz. Everywhere I need to get to is on my doorstep. Trees, boutiques, coffee shops, restaurants, bars, bakeries, IAPM mall with massive views towards Jing 'An, foreign supermarkets, top labels, Apple Store. Lots of narrow one-way streets makes it easy to cross the road. Cycling around is the best idea.

title: Pleasant
content: I really liked the French Concession, but it is an area rather than an exact place. It is not as clean and cogent as the Bund, and it lacks any major specimens of architecture. Small examples are haphazardly strewn across a rather large area, so I would just recommend taking a stroll without really planning on seeing anything. You will then be pleasantly surprised when you do stumble upon something. There is a distinct energy in this area, and there a lot of nice cafes and restaurants. I enjoyed it, but I would't recommend it to anyone who is pressed for time.

title: Beautiful architecture
content: Great place to visit to get a glimpse into the French colonial past - some of the architecture is absolutely stunning!!!

title: Very over rated
content: Not worth going there is little to see, getting there is a pain. although at night there are some very expensive night clubs, with I suppose the beautiful people

title: Nice place to spend a few hours.
content: Choose a dry day, a lovely area to wander for a few hours. Some very expensive, flashy shops and posh housing. Some traditional Chinese housing and some touristy shops, all in same area. God location for some fab photographs. Easy to find taxis in the area, lots of underground stations found locally too.

title: Whatever charm resides in Shanghai can be found here
content: There is little to enjoy in Shanghai and no charm at all, except perhaps in the old French Concession, where plane trees still line the street and you can lunch or dine in small and friendly cafes. It is a memorial to a more stylish period.

title: One the best places to visit in Shanghai
content: Excellent value. I spent a whole day exploring this charming super region, organized with beautiful cafes, restaurants and shops. Must for anyone visiting Shanghai.

title: It's a must.
content:
Boutiques, cafés, courtyards and western-influenced architecture. Tree-covered streets and families and ambiance. Restaurants and relative quietness. 
Great area to wander.

title: French Town.
content:
The area look so European and French style, modern and clean.
Lots of restaurants and shops in this area

title: Great place to walk around
content: Beautiful tree lined streets with nice restaurants and shops along the way. Worth a quick visit. We found two breweries in this area that are fantastic!

title: A very unique area of Shanghai
content: The former French Concession in Shanghai is a place I would really love to go back to explore. The architecture is so European and the tree lined streets give the impression of a stroll in any French city. This area has many excellent restaurants offering various cuisines but the food is quite excellent wherever you choose to eat. This is a very popular spot for tourists who also enjoy the fabulous shopping.

title: It deserves a stroll
content: I expected more than I saw, but it was really interesting to discover an European neighborhood in the middle of the greatest Chinese city and to have a walk through its streets.

title: Quitter area in the large city
content: If you are visiting the area you do not feel like being in a 24million city. You will find may shops and restaurants around. Nevertheless this is not a French concession anymore but a tourist spot to go

title: Just lovely
content:
We were lucky to catch a great cool sunny day and the place made so much sense for a lovely walk. 
Not crowded, full of restaurants and nice coffee shops definitely is the perfect choice for lunch or dinner .
Do not miss it.
Enjoy

title: A taste of the real Shanghai
content: The French Concession is an area of Shanghai that in late 1800s and early 1900s was administered by the French. From that time, it has kept its very agreable streets planted with 'platane' trees ('wutong' in chinese), which makes it very pleasant to walk. Many landmarks such as parks or famous homes (ex. the writer Lu Xun). The architecture of typical shanghai houses has been kept as well, sometimes restored for living or transformed into restaurants/commercial areas. There are many parks. Some blocks have kept their names in french, although the streets lost their french names fir chinese ones. What makes the French concession distinctive compared to other areas of Shanghai is its numbers if small boutiques and narrow streets. It gives you a real a sense of how people live here. The best is to borrow or rent a bicycle by a sunny day, stroll from cafes to boutiques, parks and restaurants and to escape for a while from the view of the modern skyscrappers and elevated roads. Experience it!

user_loc: 加利福尼亚雷东多海滩
title: Old China revisited
content: We had a chance to visit the Old French Concession which was a look back into old China. What amazed me were not only the sites, but the smells of the markets and foods. It was nice to see how the real folks live on a day to day basis compared to the glorified lux living in the fancy parts of Shanghai.

title: Melancholy
content: It has been a good decision of the authorities to pay attention to the architectural heritage of the French Concession. Apart from many houses, the typical French layout of the alleys creates an atmosphere of melancholy.

title: Awesome atmosphere
content: A good place to have a walk and see beautiful architecture, shop, have a coffee or eat ... a must see.

title: Wonderful corner of Shanghai
content: Beautiful French architecture an atmosphere, don't miss it. Great contrast with the high rises all around

title: Wonderful Vibrant Must Visit
content: This was our first stop on our small tour group visit to Shanghai. This is a wonderfully vibrant area with a very European feel to it. After our guide had shown us the places of interest including the beautiful fountain of Fulushou - Fortune, Prosperity and Longevity we were given time to look around. You can amuse yourself in so many ways, great shops, interesting galleries, coffe shops and restaurants. We were there on a Saturday so there were newly married couples having photo shoots in the streets amongst the architecturally old world buildings.

title: French as it is=)
content: You wanna visit France in Shanghai? You have such an opportunity!!!! A place where French was leaving. Architecture, foreign restaurants, everything will make you feel yourselg like you are already out of China.

title: Another world!
content: This part of the city is just like a whole other world! So different from the buzzling city and so much old European / French style. Lots of small shops, cafés and restaurants, narrow lanes, trees and tiny parks. Easily spend a day here!!

title: Marvellous!
content: wonderful area, full of life, history..just great. It has such a wonderful atmosphere to wonder around.
