title: Nice corner
content: Well-known in town, it's the place for dining, drinking, fooding and laughing.

title: In love
content: The place to be once in Shanghai. It feels like a corner of Europe in this amazing, fascinating, multi cultural city... Love the place and love the atmosphere.

title: Nice solo afternoon walkabout
content: Enjoyed a long afternoon by myself in the former French Concession. Learned about it reading "Shanghai Girls" by Lisa See who talks about it in the 1930's. The clothing boutiques are intriguing and affordable. Ditto photo galleries. Other shops fun. Look for the guy who makes the most tasty yoghourt imaginable - he gives samples. Available with granola. Nice break from pork and dumplings. Explored the surrounding streets of homes/shops and found "Why Glass?" a gallery/restaurant best I can figure that looked very interesting and a gallery designer store with "Pagoda" in the name, so large it's on both sides of the street. Chinese New Year and store of tassels for local people on the street was a nice find. Several take-away good dumpling joints too. Whole area is as interesting in terms of as how much walking energy/time you have.

title: Must see
content: Beautiful streets and great shopping - a must see for Shanghai! Have a coffee and go for a walk around the gorgeous shops.

title: Really cool part of Shanghai
content: Beautiful tree-lined streets, quaint shops, with a very "hometown" feel. It's a nice part of the city to explore, and a nice break from the busy, touristy Bund area. If you have time, it is worth spending a few hours there- grab a coffee at a local café, check out Fuxing Park, and walk along Hengshan Road.

title: Know the history behind it
content: You would like how clean is the area in spite of being old ... you will see fancy villas side by side to simple houses but your eyes would not get hurt .. worth a tour after knowing the history behind the area ...

title: Stayed in the area for 6 nights
content: It was great staying in this area. It has many contrasts very large colonial houses and small narrow streets, small shops etc. also the area is near the centre of shanghai. If you are in shanghai do go and spend a good few hour there even better stay in the area.

title: History and shopping.....
content: There's lots to do and see here, so much so that next time I visit I'm going to find a reasonably priced hotel within the French Concession and really give myself the opportunity to go exploring in more depth.

title: European vibe
content: The French Concession is one of my favorite parts of Shanghai.

title: Easy to kill a day here and very picturesque.
content: We walked here from the Westin Bund Center Hotel (about 3 km) through really untouched and authentic Chinese neighbourhoods, sampling authentic and very cheap Chinese street food on the way. We had a page cut out from the Guardian recommending this and that but ended up following our own itinerary. You can still feel a Western (if not French) influence and all the little shops and cafes are really nice. Hard to put a clear reason to recommend it, but it was really easy to dawdle around all the attractions in this area which were far removed from the Americanised horror show that downtown Shanghai has become.

title: Good for a neighborhood walk
content: My colleague and I were visiting Shanghai and fortunately had Sunday to look around. This is a great walking area. As others have said lots of interesting older buildings, shops, cafes, etc. Something new around every corner.

title: Fun to explore
content: This area is full of interesting shops, good restaurants, cafes, tea shops. The scale of buildings is more human scaled as it was built before the modern building boom. It's a great area just to walk around in, absorb the atmosphere and take photos.

title: Compact shopping
content: This area is mainly arts and crafts plus jewellery etc. The buildings were french colonial style and the lane ways were very narrow. We were told that it wasn't busy when we visited so I'd hate to see what it was like when it was crowded. Many of the items are way overprice but then again it's really a tourist attraction so that goes with the territory. Good way to spend an afternoon.

title: Great place to visit
content: Good shopping area and lots of great food choices - LOVE Element Fresh.  Good people watching as well.

title: OLD FRENCH AREA
content: This was an interesting area but not an awful lot to see. Wandered round in about 1/2 hour. This units/homes are now used for businesses.

title: Bars and shopping, cosy area
content: French Concession is nice with interesting architecture and many good places to go shopping or enjoy good food or drinks. If you go here can you be sure you will meet a lot of international habitants. You are in the biggest expatriate area of Shanghai when you visit French Concession. You will feel it. This part is a must visit in Shanghai.

title: Tour of French Concession
content: We arrived in Shanghai on our first visit to China. We wanted to have a tour of the French Concession with a guide so we could make the most of our trip. Kelly our guide was excellent. Knowledgeable, helpful and great company. The tour was conducted at a our pace and never felt rushed. We went on a 3 hour walk around the area. Kelly took us into a number of hotels and buildings. I would definitely recommend.

title: Old French Concession
content: The Old French Concession is a very posh area, with many shops, restaurants and bars (most pricey).

title: Much larger and less Disney than I expected
content: It's still a large and vivid area with loads of interesting buildings and street- night- shopping-life...

title: So May Good Bars & Top Class Restaurants
content: Spoilt for choice +++ Shopping, food lifestyle and incredible atmosphere. Spectacularly good as a first foray into a diverse and bustling city.

title: Lovely
content: This was such a lovely area to visit, and so easy to just walk or cycle around for the day. I was surprised at some of the prices and expat culture in the area but I had not visited China before and the major cities have undergone so much growth in recent years.

title: A must visit
content: A very beautiful part of the city, very well preserved. The restaurants are great and so are many fixed price handicrafts shops.

title: Lovely, quaint part of town
content: This part of the city is what makes Shanghai so interesting. There is so much culture in this city, and this French-themed architecture is truly gorgeous. From the plane trees that line all he boulevards, to the fusion of French and Chinese architecture, it's really a great place to go! Oh, and the bars, food, and shopping are terrific.

title: A different atmosphere
content: we went there briefly at night but we loved it. The atmosphere, the restaurants, bars and shops are all wonderful with a touch of elegance.

title: Full of options
content: Nice neighborhood. Ideal for dinner, many options to select from. There are fancy restaurants as well as casual pubs, It will depend on your taste.

title: Gorgeous Architecture and Shopping!!
content: We loved all the great boutique shops, the history, the buildings, the homes, etc.  Could live there!!

title: Quaint and a refreshing change from the hectic city and noise
content: I lived in the "FORMER" French Concession for 6 years. Note: do NOT call this section of Shanghai "French Concession" without inserting the important word, "Former", when speaking with Chinese.

title: Luxury Shopping
content: The best stores are in this area and many luxury restaurants. We had a great time shopping and strolling around.

title: Good for getting the Shanghai vibe...
content: On the world stage, not special. But definitely a good place to visit to get the overall Shanghai vibe. It helps also to put context to history (in some spots). Good place for a "flaneur" and just walking around and taking in sights.

title: extraordinary, a european street in Shanghai
content: We ate hamburgers and drunk Paulaner beer in the German restaurant. Many chinese walk by to watch us.

title: Lovely architecture
content: This is a really pretty area to stroll around and have a coffee or grab lunch during the day. There's also quite a few shops but they're very expensive. We also visited during the night and it was crazy busy! There was a 200 yuan entrance fee for many of the bars and restaurants, but it was New Year's Eve so I'm not sure what it's actually like on a normal night.

title: YOU CAN SPEND A T LEAST A COUPLE OF DAYS WALKING
content: get the Shanghai guide map for walks and just wander around ...max 2 days to float around the area and take in the history

title: Go there before it's to late!
content: Great vibes, super for photographers. Be ready to shot lots of strange moving objects (seen from a european lens)!

title: Not sure why we needed to see this
content: No big deal to visit this place ... seen similar places in other parts of the world.

title: Lovely
content: It was really pretty area, but a little expensive! Showcased some beautiful architecture and gardens.

title: nice wander but nothing special
content: This is not China! ha ha ha - walking through these streets you'd think you're back in Europe. It's full of Westerners and you double take when you in fact see a Chinese person here. Pleasant walk but not as amazing as the guide books make it out to be.

title: ** Take from an Expat Resident- Visit the FFC **
content: When in Shanghai, please do yourself a favor and visit the Former French Concession.

title: Quaint area of Shanghai
content: A truly amazing place to walk around. You feel like you are in Paris. Beautiful places to shop and more than you can choose from places to eat and drink. If you walk from marks and Spencer's you can take in all the big shops along the way, when you get to this area is really is a hidden gem in Shanghai. In one of the shopping malls they had stalls around the centre. Great vintage pieces and I bought several pieces of hand made jewelry from a lady. Can't wait to come back for a visit.

title: Roam the streets until your feet hurt!
content: This is my favourite part of Shanghai and I could walk the streets for days on end and not get bored. So much to see and experience apart from the colonial architecture. Great if you're an amateur photographer looking for interesting contrasts, faces, authentic life studies.

title: A place for an interesting walk in the evening
content: Nice place for walk.

title: Nice visit
content: Nice place to walk around. Lots of higher end shopping on the outskirts. Do not really feel like you are in China in this area.

title: Nice buildings but only if you have time
content: Coming from Asia, the buildings looked very colonial and unfamiliar to me. It was a nice stroll and I saw many interesting sights on the way but I would say skip this unless you have a lot time to spare. The buildings were not located in one place but sparsely along a few roads.

title: A great place for a stroll
content: Although most of Shanghai is ultra cosmopolitan and commercial, this is one area of the city where you can experience the old colonial charm. The a lot of architecture has been restored from the old French Concession era. Not many skyscrapers here. Streets full of tiny cafes and bars and restaurants. Boutiques and small shops etc. A lot of greenery on either sides of the road.

title: Quelle Ambiance!
content: All day long, it happens something in the Old French Concession.

title: The prefect antidote to shanghai
content: It's leafy has lots of lovelly old buildings and some great eating spots. If you're heading to Shanghai and want to see some of the old town this is the place to go.

title: A nice area
content: as a good combination of the french building tecnique and in china envoronnement with great restaurant with class ond not to expensive. A must go.

title: Nicely spent morning
content: Nice place in Shanghai, was a bit difficult to find. But inside there are cozy small shops selling miscellaneous stuf - leather, books, sweets, restaurants and so on..

title: A little Gem in the city
content: I would not say it is an exceptional place to see but if you stay for long time you might want to be a bit far from the hustle. The french concession is a cute place to visit during your stay

title: Old and New Together
content: All the "in" spots, restaurants and coffee spots have taken over the French Concession. So it is great for eating, drinking, and people watching as you appreciate the architecture. Make sure to go to the best restaurant around - world respected and ranked. and have the pork show mai (sorry for spelling)

title: Worth a visit
content: If you have been to Paris, you can forget about visiting this place. If not, it's still worth a visit. You get to see buildings with Paris influenced along the street. The Shanghai cultural center is located along the street. Worth to look at some performance if you are fan of it.

title: lovely area
content:
lovely houses and architecture. Great for walking of cycling. 

Several european style restaurants are available.

title: A must visit
content: This area reminds me of Europe. Its very quaint and really beautiful. The area is not very large but it has all the boutique stores as well as trendy restaurants and bars. Its a nice place to visit, after you have visited Nanjing street. You can see how different it is and you can take the atmosphere all in.

title: Europe in Shanghai
content: The redevelopement of this area is certainly welcoming for all us European expatriates. You can stroll, drink and eat at your pleasure, all of which come of course at a price...

title: trendy threads, gastronomic grub and chic cocktails
content: If getting away from strip-mall shopping (like Nanjing Rd) is from where you need to escape, preferring to idle through boutique stores and trawl for unique fashion-finds; if drinking in funky bars and eating in rad restaurants is your thing, then the Old French Concession is for you.

title: Old Europe New Shanghai - Check out the Propaganda Museum
content: Great area to walk around and capture the essence of European concessions of yesteryear. Make sure to walk through Ferguson Street and stop for a cup of tea or snack. Check out the Propaganda Museum nearby - located in the basement of an apartment building. Learn about the Communist Revolution via actual poster art

title: The most beautiful and bustling area in town
content: All the splendor from the old mansions and tree lined alleys mixed with great local cuisine and shops, it worth to take some time to walk aroundin no rush and for sure you will discover an amazing place hidden in some corner....

title: Best part of Shanghai
content: My first recommendation for guests in Shanghai is always to stroll about the (former) french concession. A unique part of a strange city.

title: Historic and fun!
content: At the French concession, you will see old structures and restored structures. The restored structures have been transformed to restaurants, bars, and shops. A great party and hang-out place for both locals and tourists, old and young.

title: Paris in Shanghai
content: For me The Old French Concession is a tremendous area to stroll, and a must visit for anyone travelling to Shanghai

title: wonderful walk and architecture
content: We could not believe that this is a communist country = you have to applaud the chinese with their innovation, hard work and achievement in such a short time. Beautifully renovated and wonderful buildings that blend perfectly together - great design and a pleasure to walk around with cafes and restaurants that would put a lot of places in europe to shame

title: Worth a visit
content: The huge Garden area where the locals come to practice Thai Chi , Karaoke, Play Badminton, Dance and simply hang out is a must. You could find yourself caught up in a Tango move or get a free massage.

title: Nice different neighborhood
content: Check out this neighborhood if you have the time... But it is not a must. Its the old style french look and way older and different style.

title: Still in Shanghai?
content: Beautiful area, lot of small cafes, galleries, boutiques and nice old buildings. Definitely a must visit when in shanghai. Especially the area Tianzefang with it's shops and restaurants.

title: French Quarter
content: Old French style buildings and street cafes. Worth a visit. What is most unusual for China and you may be in need is great coffee and proper cakes! Stop and people watch for a few moments and try the pastries!

title: Best area for exploring on foot
content: Just put on comfy clothes and shoes and just wonder..who knows what little jems you will find. There's a mixed of local fashion and antique to designer brands. Theres also a few vintage fashion shops in this area but they all hidden in lane-ways and old lane houses so just explore

title: A bit of Paris while in Shanghai
content: designer shopping on main streets

title: French Concession - October 2014
content: Wonderful area with so much charm. We almost skipped this and that would have been a big mistake. It was so enjoyable!

title: Charming area
content: This is a lovely area to stroll along with tree-lined streets, lots of restaurants and some itinerant flea marketeers along the way. Very interesting area and a must-see.

title: Great shopping and café culture in old colonial quarter
content: Take a stroll and relax in the cafés in this area, It will take you away from the hussle of the Bund and Is well worth a visit, the shops are excellent and there is a lot on offer.

title: Worth a visit
content: Interesting, at best, as part of the history of Shanghai. Perhaps, a bit overated but a must see in order to understan their colonial past.

title: MUST see
content: This area was unlike any other area in Shanghai. It's like you've stepped back in time and into Paris. Beautiful tree-lined streets, iron gates and balconies, and fun little boutique style stores that keep you engaged all day. Definitely come here and stroll to your heart's content- and don't forget Fuxing park as you watch real China in action.

title: Mini Paris
content: Great designer shopping and great cafes and bars on side streets will make you feel you are in Paris instead of China. We loved the mix of locals and tourists. The area was friendly and welcoming.

title: A Must
content: A great area in Shanghai. If you are looking for great restaurants and Bars. Need to visit a few times, at least once during the day and once at night time.

title: Wonderful and take your time.
content: I had the good fortune to follow a walking tour of the old French Concession on a phone app which was ideal if you only have a short time in Shanghai. I did but thankfully I took my time wandering through this delightful area. Having sites pointed out with some background made for a very pleasant 5 hours. Plenty to look at peaceful and a pleasure just being there.

title: French getaway in Shanghai
content: Great place to get lost for an afternoon. Cozy little shops and excellent restaurant choices. It seriously feels like your in Europe!

title: Scenic area to walk and wander around
content: With its tree lined roads and old residential buildings the French Concession can almost remind one of New York's Greenwich Village.

title: Great and nice building
content: Was there had a hi tea with rmb 298 for 2 great places n environment to be at. Quite and magnificent building.

title: European feeling in Shanghai
content: Nice place to walk around! It feels as if you were in France or some European city. There are many cafes, bookstores and boutiques. Very unique for China. We also enjoyed a good dinner in the area.

title: Nice to walk around and visit to eat mainly European
content: Not a real must in a city what offers so many different restaurants, but when you are looking for a place to eat outside in the summer this is a nice area to sit or stroll around

title: Is it in china?
content: You'll be amazed from the first moment you set your foot in this area, just like France, very french indeed. It's a beautiful neighborhood with shopping malls, bars and restaurants, with a beautiful view, we went there 2 nights, and if I'm gonna come back to shanghai, french concession will be definitely one of my destinations.

title: Great cafes
content: Would love to have spent more time investigating this area of Shanghai. Had some lovely food and walked some of the streets. So different to the city. A must to see.

title: Felt like in France
content: If you want to get the true impression of Shanghai as a city, you cannot skip old French concession, the cosy district with upscale restaurants.

title: A Taste of Paris
content: This is a great little piece of France in Shanghai, the French influence is obvious from the architecture to the food. It is well worthwhile spending an afternoon wondering the streets of this area.

title: Great walking experience
content: An area that the guidebooks all recommend, but there's no way to provide good guidance on paper. Every time I try a travel book, I find 3 other interesting things for every 1 attraction highlighted in the book. Tons of restaurants and shops, and often changing. It must be walked and explored. The tree-lined streets give great atmosphere in the middle of Shanghai's hustle and bustle.

title: French Concession
content: Most of this has been modernized, and this has the feeling of any tourist area in the world. There are a lot of wetern kinds of accommodations. But, if you are careful you can also see something of the real history of this area. There are some museums and residences. There are some very fine restaurants.

title: Yes, it does feel/look like Paris!
content: While you won't mistake most of the streets for the Champs Elysees or historic streets on the Left Bank, the French Concession does have an authentic Gallic feel to it. There are several things that provide this feeling - the sycamore tree lined streets, the lack of tall buildings, fabulous small restaurants and boutique stores and lots of people out on the streets. It is an area you should explore when visiting Shanghai. Make sure to grab a dinner - my favorite was Lost Heaven.

title: Worthy of a few hours.
content: Although a fairly large area we only covered a small section but what we saw was fascinating. Take your time exploring as the building offer a glimpse into Shanghai's fairly recent past.

title: FRENCH
content: This is part of a tour of Shanghai.The area looks French,with old French building.This can be covered in days Shanghai tour.You can just drive past.

title: Love this area!
content: If you want to explore this area, put on a pair of good walking shoes and spend an afternoon getting lost. Its quiet safe and you can always flap your arm(s) for a taxi when you get tired.

title: Great Spot to Explore
content: As a photographer, this is a target rich environment with lots of small shops, interesting people and tight quarters to shoot in. Great variety of architecture, flowers and colors make for lots of fun. Many food, drink and shops to explore.

title: Nice diversion
content: Very cosmopolitan area with lots of restaurant choices and some history thrown in too! Good to visit for a few hours mid day. One building is presented as where Mao started the Communist party.

title: Great to stroll in the evening
content: Really nice neighborhood that is great to just stroll around. Lots of small shops and restaurants, pedestrian areas - all comes alive at night. Great choice of restaurants from simple and local - to chic and offbeat. Cool place to hang out!

title: Cosmopolitan but Costly!
content: The old French concession area is a very scenic area located in Xintiandi and easily accessible by subway (underground train) and getting off at the station of the same name. It's a very popular area predominantly with tourists and expat foreigners. The streets are lined with pretty shops, bars and restaurants. The latter caters for mostly Western taste and you can find the likes of French, Spanish, Italian cuisine and more. We enjoyed Spanish tapas on more than one occasion washed down with European beer.

title: Fun and hip
content: This area is jumping and full of great buildings containing interesting stores and restaurants.  It's well worth 1/2 day visit.

title: A must walk thru
content: If you like old architecture, big trees and a little slower pace then you should visit the French Concession. I was here for one year a finally moved into the French Concession about one year too late. I found myself always ending up in the French Concession walking, taking pictures and finding really good places to eat and have a drink. So many small places (hole in the wall joints) to discover and the food is some of the best you will find. There are several parks in the area as well as other attractions. You could literally spend days exploring this area and still not see it all. Definitely check this area out. Ask someone you know or get tour maps so you can find the main attractions and then do what I do, wander around, you might be pleasantly surprised what you may find.

title: An all-purpose place to visit.
content: There are a lot of options in this area, from shopping to food to night-outs. Unlike most tourist packed streets, this one is clean and safe. A good option for a Saturday evening or Sunday morning to spend a few hours admiring the european style architecture.

title: Going back in history -
content: This is one of the nicest areas of the "Old Shanghai" on the PUXI side of the city! You can stroll around for hours and feel like going back in time when the French were in town! Still lots of streets with trees, which have disappeared in other parts of the city!

title: The name is misleading -- no one singular spot
content: The Former French Concession of Shanghai (Shanghai is VERY particular about referring to it as the *Former* French Concession, FYI) is not exactly one specific, self-contained, quickly walkable neighborhood, as many people seem to assume. There are many areas in Shanghai that fall under the "French Concession" label, and they're not all conjoined either. There are areas in Jing'an, areas in Xuhui, areas in Luwan, etc., all broken apart then by skyscrapers and blocks of modern architecture. Furthermore, there are few actual "landmarks" that let you know you are, in fact, IN the French Concession; it's more so just the name given to the areas that were under French influence and still retain the old architecture of those days.

title: Fantastic
content: This is the place to spend time at. It is steeped in history. We did also enjoy the shopping. Lots of variety and selection. This would be the preferred district to stay in on any visit!

title: Happenin' Place in Shanghai
content: Great place to walk and explore the streets and alleys during the day, then return at night to visit a bar and/or restaurant. This neighborhood has a true international flavor and is one of the most hip neighborhoods in Shanghai. It is accessible via several subway stations and is a great place to stroll on a lovely day.

title: Very Cool
content: It is a broad area, but the overall assessment is all 5 stars. Really fun place to wander through--can soak up multiple hours easily.

title: Glamourous
content: Its very hip in the night, classy style yet unique. a lot of cafe and old building, very interesting..

title: Wander freely
content: The French concession is great for wandering around, with boutiques, cafes and a GIANT Uniqlo store.

title: Old French Concession, Shanghai
content: On our last evening with our wonderful tour guide SOFI, she took us to the French Concession in Shanghai. What a wonderful place! So many interesting shops to visit...so many restaurants and bar, so much European and Chinese history in that place! The whole group, some 10 people in total, enjoyed that evening very much and hoped to be able to come back again one day soon, to magical French Concession in Shanghai...and of course to meet up with our knowledgable, friendly, energetic and lovely guide SARA!!!

title: Nightlife
content: Lovely place with a lot of cafés and bars. Weather was nice to sit out and enjoy the beers. Lots of small boutique shops around the area for shopping not that I shopped a lot. Need to take a taxi back in the night to the hotel as no metro stn near to walk

title: My favorite places in Shanghai
content: There is a lot of fun and interesting to visit this place at night. More choices and something really different of the French influences to experience...surely is one of my favorite places in Shanghai

title: Fun walking area
content: We stayed in the Hilton that is in the French concession and really enjoyed the area. It has beautiful trees that line the streets and great sidewalks that have overpasses to keep you from walking through traffic. Fun shops and good bars and restaurants.

title: Off the beaten path
content: I actually had a good walk around the area and managed to cover most of the places I set out to visit. Mainly, Zhou Enlai’s former residence, a peek at the Sinan Mansions, Sun Yatsen’s Former Residence as well as Fuxing Park. I even got a seat at CHA’s restaurant around noon, which is probably it's peak serving time. Nevertheless, I enjoy how quaint the area was compared to the hustle and bustle of Shanghai and my only regret is not being able to sample apparently a good cake shop located along Gaolan Road. Signage was sufficient although I managed with Google Maps (Sun Yatsen’s Former Residence was the most tricky). Really good if you enjoy learning about the country's history.

title: Colonial Shanghai
content: Shanghai is definitely a city of neighborhoods each inheriting from it's time of development and local colonial power. You can feel the french influence on the layout of streets and parks in the french concession. There are also some fantastically preserved buildings from the colonial period

title: Walking through history
content: This part of the city is really worth visiting as you get a sense of history. I did it initially as part of a walking tour but then went back on my own.

title: Beautiful, interesting shopping and dining area
content: Just came back from my second visit to Shanghai on holiday and would definitely recommend the Old French Concession area to explore. Interesting little laneways and shops selling a variety of things. Also great little bars and cafes.

title: Fantastic
content: A must! Fantastic district with great atmosphere with tiny boutiques which offer single pieces of local desingers, small restaurants and cafes...conveniently located as well.

title: Nice place to go and visit
content: You can walk and be there 3-4 hours and you will not notice the time. Beautiful area, lots of stores and shops you can spend your money there - and don't forget to argue.

title: A great walking area to take in the beautiful sights
content: This area is littered with restaurants, shops and specialty mom and pop businesses. Beautiful setting and clean streets makes this a great area to walk and take in the sights. Restaurants are quite good in this area and it is very safe. Also some beautiful hotels in the French Concession that will put you in one of the best areas in Shanghai.

title: Relaxing
content: A great area for a relaxing hour. Sit and have a nice glass of wine or an ice-cream, then do some great window shopping.

title: Nice and relaxing
content: This is a village in the city with a lot of cool places and little cafes to chill out ...A french "je ne sais quoi" in Shanghai !

title: Mini Paris!
content: Experience the french bistros and street shops in the Chinese heartland. Frequented mostly by foreigners...if you get over the Chinese food and crave for an European meal..this is the place.

title: Foodies Delight
content: This area has a ton of shopping and some of the best restaurants in Shanghai. The offerings are very diverse. Great area to shop and eat.

title: Lovely little cobble stone streets shops and cafes
content: I love this place just walking and shopping stopping in little cafes takes you back in time sometimes you forget your in china

title: Great area to get "lost" in for the day
content: We were in Shanghai for a week and spent two half-days in the French Concession. It's a big enough area that you can easily wander around and lose yourself for the day. Fuxing Park is right there, which is a gorgeous spot to rest and take in some of the local entertainment. There are tons of little restaurants, bars and shops, as well as high-end shopping and foreign cuisine (if you're tired of Chinese food). The streets are wide and lined with sycamore trees, and it has a very calm, cool feel - a nice break from the noise of the city.

title: Ex-pat heaven?
content: You will know you are here when you see all the tree lined streets. Some great bars and restaurants for the ex-pats looking for a taste of home.

title: Old old and new old
content: The french concession now has two faces: a refurbished one and the old old. Both have their charm. Refurbished is more spacious and luxurious, the old old is great for the hustle and bustle. The old old has some great antiques and pictures shops. Both a must see on a trip to shanghai.

title: Go in the evening for the best atmosphere!!
content: Great people watching opportunity in the evening. The who's Who of Shanghai in the evening especially at the weekend.

title: A bit of France in the middle of China
content: Totally worth a stroll down the street. There are several nice restaurants and coffee shops, and it`s always interesting to see the contrast of poor and rich parts of Shangai.

title: You could be anywhere but in Shanghai
content: If you want something more Shanghai traditional this is not the place for you. You could be anywhere in the world. High price shops. Great for people watching!

title: This place is a Beut at night !
content: I loved walking around at night as the lightings of the Building were breathtaking, nice restaurants from different cusines. However, make sure you get the right metro stop as i have been there 3 times and still ended up a bit far from the concession haha

title: With sensible shoes, this is a great day!
content: It was awesome to see the old stores next to the new ones! We spent an entire day just walking through this expansive neighborhood. Make sure you take the side streets, too. Lots of charm, lots of character. We ate both street food and Starbucks. We even took in a blockbuster movie that was in ENGLISH! For bathroom stops, we took advantage of the hotels. Thank goodness, I'm too big for the clothes in Shanghai, I would have left there broke, but I did get some cool sunglasses. Bring a camera!

title: Great night place
content: There is a lot of atmosphere and fun in this area. A wonderful sense of the old and nostalgic mixed with some modern day good food and drinks. Lots of choices and something really different to experience.

title: A Place with a lot of charm!
content: This is one of my favorite places in Shanghai. It feels like a little European city in Shanghai. Small streets lined up with lovely trees and nice shade, so many different shops and restaurants. Go there and be lost, every small street has something to offer. I think you can take metro line 1 and line 7, and they will get you there. Once lost take the metro back to you hotel or another landmark in the city. By the way Shanghai metro seems overwhelming at first, but after your first ride it becomes easy to navigate. It is in English as well as Chinese. Clean and extremely safe even in the late hours of the day. It is much safer than Europe or New York metro. And also much cheaper.

title: shanghais clarque quay
content: This place is a nice place to spend the evening or night its a smal version of Singapore clarque quay consisting of about 20 bar and restaurant s with a romantic atmosphere

title: Great time- very crowded
content: If you want to see a bit of old China, come here. Streets filled with stores and vendors of every type. Be wary of crowds, but this is a great place to come to visit when in Shanghai.

title: A nice walk around
content: A touristy area with restaurants & shops, featuring refurbished early 20th century architecture. A nice walk around if you have the time. There are more interesting attractions in Shanghai if time is limited.

title: Fantastic!!!
content: We enjoyed our afternoon walk here in French Concession. We felt like we are in anothery country while walking on it's streets. A place worth visiting!

title: Great way to loss a day
content: Fantastic area to walk around and find all the different shops and attractions. Recommend to set aside a day just to wonder around and get lost in the environment.

title: A Pleasant Day
content: Yes, there are more developments now in the Old French Concession, but the charm remains. It is a wonderful place to for a morning or evening stroll before heading to one of the many quaint dining places. Do go!

title: Green paradise in Shanghai
content: Small streets, lots of trees, nice atmosphere and lots of restaurants and shops.

title: Beautiful area
content: Scenic to walk through. Stop and eat at a cafe. Walk the parks by the children's museum they are amazing!

title: Historic Walk
content: Shanghai is a relatively young city so to get a feel for the history of its development it is essential to do the two walking tours recommended in the guide books. The Old French Concession also gives a feel for modern living away from the tower blocks that surround the area. It is nice to wander around the area but is appreciated best with the help of a guide book.

title: Maze
content: A maze of tiny passage ways filled with local vendors & restaurants. A little crowded for my taste, but still pretty cool

title: sweet
content: a prety place where to live and enjoing day and night life in Shanghai. together western and chinese style life, amazing

title: International area with nice bungalows and restaurants
content: This area is so different from the rest of Shanghai with all the skyscapers. Lovely to walk down Hangshen road and take side roads to explore the small corner shops. Lots of hairdressers, restaurnts and designated cafes/restaurants. A "must" stroll when in Shanghai,

title: A hidden gem
content: The French Concession is a tree lined area as part of The Bund that has a charm all of it's own. Make sure to go into the original narrow street area where you will find gift shops and restaurants and which is a great place to people watch.

title: Great Area for drink
content: its very nice place. great atmosphere, charming with very nice restaurants and bars. Don't miss this place in shanghai

title: A great place for a walk.
content: The French Concession is a large neighborhood in Shanghai with beautiful homes and gardens. It is a quiet area with tree-lined streets, small shops, and places to eat. We spent a Sunday afternoon wandering for hours and loved it.

title: A lovely area of Shanghai, a respite from the busy city
content: This area of town is full of colonial buildings and parks, alongside new and interestingly built high rises and shopping malls. We took the Metro to get to an area near the French Concession, and used one of our guidebooks & its enclosed map to navigate the area. We started at Fuxing Park, a huge and lovely old park. It has various areas: a lotus pond with picnic shelters at its edges, a path with mini caves, a rose garden with arbors and benches, a large Italian-style garden plaza with a fountain, and a children's park with several rides and activities. People were singing Chinese opera in the picnic shelters and by the Italian garden, others were just strolling through or enjoying the benches in the shade. There are several shady walkways that go by various statues, some decorative, some historic. We also followed the guidebook's walking tour, passing several historic homes of former Communist leaders, writers, and artists. These were not open on the Monday we were there, but looked interesting enough to warrant a visit next time we come. We stopped at the historic Moller Mansion, now the Moller Mansion Hotel, and took several pictures. The brickwork is beautifully done, as is the woodwork inside the hotel. You can walk around the grounds to a sushi restaurant there, or have tea at the hotel's own restaurant. Beautiful landscaping & interesting historical photos and descriptions. This looks like a lovely place to stay. We wandered through the little streets, enjoying the sights, the shops, and the laundry strung from windows to coiled power lines along the street on wooden poles. We found a fun restaurant that looked like something out of The Jetsons-very futuristic, and had a delicious meal, chosen from the photo-rich menu. We ended up at Xiangyang Park, on the northwest corner of the French Concession. There, we saw patients from the hospital next to the park practicing Tai Qi to regain range of motion and balance, men gambling at cards and Mah Jong, a fitness area, an area dedicated to badminton, and beautiful flower gardens. We'd come this far because the only remaining Russian Orthodox Church in Shanghai is nearby, but that turned out to be the only disappointment of the day. The once-blue domes have been repainted black, and a series of businesses in that location have failed, leaving it empty & locked up. There isn't even a descriptive plaque to explain its history. Wandering back toward the middle of the French Concession, we found our Metro station & headed back to our hotel. A long, lovely walking day, with many more attractions to visit when we come again.

title: A beautiful, old, cosmopolitan area
content: A wonderful area to ramble around and take your time. Lots of shady streets, cafes, restaurants and hidden shops.

title: Too busy, too crampled, too expensive!
content: Go to old street instead - same goods, better prices, more genuine street food, and it's possible to move around!

title: Hobb nobbing down a classy road
content: This is a classy little area. Nice fountain in the walking strip. Had a very nice drink of German beer & wine and hot wedges in a little pub. Watched the people pass by. Very enjoyable.

title: A beautiful Quartier
content: The Former French Concession or FFC is a nice place with European architecture. Almost all the shops, restaurants, cafes or bars have some french names. It's a pleasant place.

title: Lovely area to explore full of shops and eateries
content: I'm lucky enough to have just moved to the French Concession as I've moved to China for work, and it's a lovely part of the city. Well worth just wandering the streets, which are full of some great shops, (as well as some selling tat) as well as nice bars, restaurants and spas.

title: History
content: Interesting to see the history of how China and especially Shanghai developed from small fishing village with different nationals entering to do business with China.

title: Like old Bucharest and Paris
content: Small buildings, nice restaurants, boutiques, tailor shop's, museums, it's a mix of cultures! From luxury compounds to small houses (where chinese families live), thé Former French Concession it's a "one of a kind" place!

title: Charming!
content: Surprise...as we were staying at The Shanghai Hotel, this was only a block walk for us...and what a nice find! Uncrowded streets on a Sunday..Ex-Pat community with a good selection of restaurants from Italian, French, and German. Nice bakes shops with Huge Bread selections! Found an Ex-Pat grocery store with all the things you could find in the states too, including Ben & Jerrys Ice Cream, and Florida Natural Orange Juice!! If you need a fast taste of home come to this area...Ate a fabulous Pizza with great German Beer at The Garden, which also has a BBQ on weekends and a huge spice & herb garden!! Will Review that soon, but this is a heads up, they also take Credit Cards.

title: Pretty
content: This is a pretty area. If you like opulence and pretty things then this is the place for you. I don't feel like it shows the real Shanghai though. Lots of high end shops and very expensive to eat etc here. Not for me but others may enjoy it.

title: Very disappointed
content:
Expected so much more. 

Yes the buildings are nice but they look brand new. Whatever character was here is long gone.  Full of people taking photos impossible to walk around and enjoy.  Frustrating.  

Lots of expensive restaurants.  Free wifi

title: Take a stroll!
content: Somewhat more relaxed, plenty of trees. Go to Fuxing park on a weekend. Really fun to just walk around.

title: Quaint and interesting
content: We went for a walk around the old French Concession area in Shanghai. It reminded me of some old neighborhoods in Paris and also Pondicherry in India. There are wrought iron gates and quaint Art Deco buildings. We saw some older mansions and the streets are lined with boutiques and eating places. It is a very nice area to just stroll around and soak in the atmosphere.

title: You could be in any City
content: Many stores, bars & restaurants in this area noted for its old French style buildings. Full of young, trendy people dining or drinking outdoors with their expensive cars parked nearby. Really you could be in any modern city in the world not just in Shanghai.

title: Definitely a must!
content: The food was authentic Shanghainese food, and it was one of the most delicious array of food I've ever tasted.

title: Good all round
content: The old French Concession suburb has it all - historic sites, architecture, boutique and mall shopping, great mix of restaurants and bars, parks, etc and it is easy to get to by metro.

title: Pretty and interesting walk with a European feel
content: We visited the Old French Concession area twice. The first time was on a very, very rainy day with our Shanghai Guide. We started at the Taicang Road area. There are many upscale stores, restaurants, a Starbucks and a very pretty fountain. The pedestrian area nearby called Xintiandi is very pretty with tree lined streets, small alleys, paved courtyards and shikumen. From this area we walked to the site of the First National Congress of the Communist Party of China which is a museum. We spent an hour or more at the museum. If you are interested in Chinese Communist History this is a good place to visit. There are many photos and items showing the history and the various leaders. If you do visit there, you need at least an hour and could spend more depending on your level of interest.

title: Beautiful area
content: Reminds me of a nicer version of the French areas in Hanoi. The area is perfect for a stroll and there are a number of nice restaurants you can choose from to begin or end your night out

title: Be sure to stroll around the area and visit into one of the cafes!
content: Founded in the XIX century, the former French Concession, in the south-west, adjacent to the Old Town.

title: nice tree lined streets
content: good easy walking area with nice restaurants and bars quaint shops and tree lined streets make this a popular area of shanghai

title: Fascinating and stunning
content: Really interesting for history and shopping.  The museum showing an original house amongst a shopping district is fascinating.

title: Walk the French Concession
content: We liked the quiet, tree lined streets of this concession area, the european style of the buildings and the great restaurants and shops

title: Beautiful and calm
content: Wonderful shops, architecture, people watching, and I understand any number of great places to eat. Not far from Fuxing Park and a couple of train stops. Save a morning to walk around the area and pick out a restaurant for the evening.

title: If in Shanghai, don't miss a slow tour through the area.
content: This is increddible, laid back mix of Chinese and Europe at its best.

title: Pleasant Walk in Old Shanghai
content: As the name suggests, this section of Shanghai takes you back to the quaint streets of the late 19th and early 20th century. Lots of European-influenced buildings, bustling squares, international restaurants, and boutiques.

title: Beautiful Place To Walk and Dine
content: I visited this place on one of the weeknights and it made for a terrific walk and a good place to have dinner with several options. As such, this is an upmarket place with some high end shops and high end restaurants.

title: The highlight of the city
content: Rich in history and beautiful Art Deco and Baroque architecture. Early morning is best if the building are what you are interested in.

title: Place to chill
content: I was there in march 2014. This place is good to stroll around and to enjoy the nice architecture buildings that was left behind by the french. I recommend you guys to visit this place during late afternoon to evening period, before dark while there is still sunlight to see the architect clearly and also to enjoy the ambience during the night.

title: Simply Beautiful
content: I loved the architecture and the ambience that prevailed in the old french concession area..makes you feel like you are in another country and not China..the atmosphere was very nice and we chilled around..was very enjoyable!

title: Smaller than I imagined
content: Enjoyed the environment but not the shopping. A very tourist focused experience and crowded on weekends due to the narrow streets.

title: Empire of the sun!
content: Wander around the beautiful houses and imagine what a life they used to lead.great shops and restaurants here too!

title: Relaxing
content: A nice area to relax, have a coffee, enjoy some shopping, watch the world go by. Quite scenic - enjoyed the museum there too.

title: Trendy shops and restaurants
content: I did not have time to walk through but looked like a cool happening place with loads of trendy shops and malls, local restaurants and chains. Sightseeing green bus route passes here so if you buy a 48 hour bus ticket you can come back to do some serious shopping,

title: Quaint find.
content: Our friend brought us here.

title: lovely
content: this is a great atmospheric place to visit, rest a while and watch life pass you by. the architecture is like a forgotten Paris.

title: Old French Concession
content: Not at all like it was b4 everything went modern. You wouldn't know you were in the heart of it unless someone told you. Most of the stately homes are now converted into shops, etc. Sad to see that it wasn't kept up.

title: Old French Concession
content: I really loved this area for people watching, day or night. So nice to see so many trees lining the streets. Felt like a bit of Paris in China.

title: Great place to visit on a guided tour.
content: We decided to get a private tour with a guide which our hotel arranged and it was superb! The detail and descriptions that the guide gave us only enhanced the whole tour even more and it is more memorable because of it.

title: A nice slice of tranquility
content: A pleasant area to walk and have a coffee (at a premium), not as crowded, I expect because it's a little more expensive, a good escape from the rest of the chaos that is Shanghai.

title: Beautiful old streets lined by trees
content: A very special place to escape the hectic city and surrender to the tranquility of old Shanghai. You will find historic buildings, restaurants, parks and unique sights around every corner - go there and let yourself drift.

title: Lovely quarters - great restaurants and ambience.
content: Beautiful quarters, nice places to eat, fun shopping, and very charming. Feels like a mix between Paris, West Village NY, and modern Shanghai with glimpses of history and every day life.

title: Favourite area of Shanghai
content: This has always been my favourite area of Shangai. Great for wandering and exploring - the Fuxing park always has locals playing music or dancing somewhere, there are always lovely boutiques in unexpected places as there are restaurants off the beaten track. Xintiandi and Tianzifang are definitely worth a look but for me I prefer strolling the less congested areas. The villas, the avenues of trees, the former residences. Enjoy.

title: Not that worth seeing
content: We went there and where a little bit disappointed as we imaged the French concession to be more spectacular, but at the and it looks European and thats not what you want to see in Asia ;)

title: Covent Garden of Shanghai
content: Great places for food! The buildings are old but the restaurants are modern. A few quaint shops around. I would go again just for the food and the beautiful atmosphere. It also seems to be where the upper class locals are hanging out at.

title: Pretty/interesting
content: Pretty interesting area.  Hustle and bustle.  Very busy place.   Bit dirty tho.  Largely residential with local shops.

title: Reminiscent of old world Europa!
content: Loved walking along the tree-lined avenues see all the vintage-looking old houses with wrought iron fences and stair railings that's very reminiscent of neighborhoods in France. This is a well fashionable area with picturesque older buildings. You'll find plenty artisan themed cafés, boutiques, galleries, bars and shops abound for people watching or wasting the Sunday away!! It's really a beautifully scenic area to get lost in! I also loved walking through the Xin Tiandi area that has somewhat of a similar feel with the main difference being the Chinese style Shikumen houses and buildings that aren't in the French concession area.

title: Hip and Chic Day or Night
content: This is a must visit place in Shanghai. You will see a mix of the world walking, shopping, chatting and dining. The easy access via the Metro and exit into a mall or into the a nice shady shopping street makes getting there and getting around a breeze. Tian Zi Fang 田子坊, Is a walled shopping and dining experience East, West, North and South all gather in cafés, pubs, eateries and shops. It is pricey, but nice, especially at night. Spend half of a day, preferably afternoon and evening and enjoy yourself.

title: SHOPS
content: Really a maze of shops, cafes and galleries - just interesting enough for a short visit. Not enough restroom facilities!

title: Worth a visit
content: Seems like you've stepped into France even though you are in the middle of Shanghai. It is wonderful to see so much has been conserved and some of the colonial architecture is wonderful. Found a walking map on the web which took us round the more famous buildings. On the way, there were all manner of boutique shops, restaurants and bars to divert us

title: Peaceful for Breakfast
content: After abandoning our hotel buffet breakfast we went here one morning and had a great breakfast in peaceful surroundings as a lot of the bars etc were just setting up for the day. We had a few cafe to choose from and found a lovely one close to the middle of the area. We really enjoyed walking around afterwards and looking at all the lovely buildings. We got a cab from the Bund- was easy.

title: Walking
content: Terrific area to walk around very European in feel. Lots of places to eat and little shops here. Picturesque as well with tree lined streets. Food markets nearby for interesting exploration.

title: Just wish I had more time
content: A lovely area with lots of history and lots of wonderful shops. Unfortunately it was raining the day Sunny Chang from Toursbylocals took us through here so we were kind of in a rush. Had I been on my own I would've spent much more time going into the lovely shops....not your standard souvenirs but a little pricey. Sunny did a great job navigating us through the small streets. Don't miss this if you can.

title: The best place to eat
content: There are many restaurants for you to try here with outdoor area eating as well.

title: Definitely a must!
content: The former french concession is characterized by small houses and narrow streets with dozens of shops, bars and restaurants. Truly unique!

title: Very pretty but expensive
content: The type of development you see in many cities - old buildings restored and filled with restaurants, bars, little independent gifty shops. Haagen Dasz, a Paulaner Bavarian Restaurant, etc (only the Starbucks wasn't horrendously expensive).

title: Lovely gem of tree-lined quiet pocket of SH
content: A great escape from the madness of downtown Puxi and the high tech world of Pudong. Well worth exploring (and getting lost) on foot, and try some local hidden gems of restaurants and coffee shops along the way.

title: A village within the city
content: In the heart of Shanghai, in the shadow of the skyscrapers and tucked away from the busy business craziness, this historic heritage neighbourhood is quite unique with its cosmopolitan multitude of cozy bars, small restaurants and cafés. Great experience to get a bit lost in this labyrinth of narrow streets. A village within the city.

title: Picturesque
content: It's a perfect place for a long walk or for coffee. The building are picturesque, the place is not so crowded and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants. I have also vistited the former residence of Sun Yat-sen, which is nerby. For those who like green areas, there is quite a nice park there.

title: Go for a walk, have a coffee
content: It's a little bit further walk from the Bund than you think. Lots of smaller, tree lined streets. Lots of cafe's, lots of shops. lots of places and excuses to spend money, other than than, nothing really, to write home about.

title: The fusion of China and Western
content: It could be an enjoyment for walking on the quiet paths in this Old French Concession area, you will pass through lots of boutique shops, cafe, bistros, and restaurants. The buildings were built in French Villa style and have been kept very well.

title: My favourite part of Shanghai
content: Such a lovely area with beautiful art spaces, cafés and real street appeal. Stop in at Kommune for a good coffee and just enjoy the ambiance. We went on Sunday morning, not too busy and just wandered...could have stayed longer if we had more time.

title: AWESOME
content: We live here and what do we say waiguo central! It is the heart of Shanghai and everybody is so friendly!

title: Most interesting with understanding some History
content: Went with a tour guide to shed light on recent history...the last 100 years. Interesting architecture amidst gardens, people and shops.

title: Great place to live in Shanghai for a single man!
content: I am an Expat living and working in Shanghai. Moved here in April 2014 and moved into my apartment (41 Hengshan) in May. I love this location. Lots of Bars and Restaurants in walking (crawling) distance.

title: A must in Shanghai
content: Every time when I am in Shanghai I have to visit this charming district. You will find many restaurants, bars, shops and people from all over the world. Nice local designer shops. Fantastic flair and architecture. Simply a must in Shanghai.

title: The past meets the future eats...
content: Ah... the Old French Concession area. Old buildings, .. brings you back into the 1920s-1930s old Shanghai. Lovely place. Then when you walk into the back lanes, it zips you into the present times... but eateries and pubs.

title: A maze of small shops
content: There are many shops here some are unique others could be anywhere in the world. I was looking for a tea shop in a guide book I found tea different tea shops here but, not the one I had hoped to find. The architecture was what I enjoyed the most from my trip here.

title: The charming part of Shanghai
content: Do visit Shanghai in spring/autumn to walk along the leafy streets in French concession - the real Shanghai experience

title: We went with a tour guide
content: It was very nice lots of great restaurants shops but expensive . There were lots of small alleyways . They were once houses but turned into shops

title: Very prestigious Area
content: Its very prestigious and international area. its full of restaurants and i find it less traffic and people, we really enjoyed the restaurants and the cafe shops and i highly recommend to visit this area.

title: a great place to tour
content: It looks more like old Europe than China and has astounding buildings like you would find in New York City. Nice and pleasant to walk around and eat,

title: Nice stroll
content: This area is a nice stroll and a few streets with old buildings worth checking outbut might have lost it's charm a bit with how commericalised/modernised it has become. Go on a cooler day or check out the numerous cafes in the area

title: My favourite in Shanghai
content: Followed a tour suggested by my guide book and it was amazing, great atmosphere, small tree lined streets, charming cafés, beautiful boutiques and very friendly people. If I could only do one thing in. Shanghai that would be it!

title: If you have some time, take a stroll around
content: This will remind you of European neighbourhoods, this being obvious since the French built it.

title: It is a very special region of Shanghai, there the life is real
content: You just go there and spend a day walking, drinking in a cozy bars, eating in one of thousands restaurants, enjoying the "nature" Chinese life, and at the end try one of many nightclubs, like Zapatas or Hollywood. It's gonna be one of the best days in your life.

title: Nothing much to see
content: It was great to stroll around the area but I got bored after seeing many of the places was either undergoing renovation works or stood out like a sore thumb for no reason.

title: A Taste of Paris in Shanghai
content: Refurbishing the old French Quarter was great idea and gives this very moderns city another place of interest.

title: Love the trees
content: It has a lot of trees. I visited Tianzifang and then walked around the area a bit. There are some shops and so on, and some interesting architecture and buildings, but it didn’t feel like a tourist hotspot and was mostly just quiet and charming. Mercifully there are a lot of trees lining the streets and all around, which makes it an absolutely great place to wander on a hot summer day.

title: Excellent place for a fashionable, relaxing day.
content: If you want some elegant, fashionable, chic down time in a busy and hectic Shanghai, XinTianDi is definitely the place to go. Classy coffeeshops(though not the best coffee), interesting boutiques, old houses, bars etc. makes the French Concession a favorite amongst both locals and foreigners.

title: Great restaurants
content: Beautiful area, great restaurants and boutiques. Felt very safe walking around. Close to hotel, great to be able to walk to restaurants and back.

title: Great restaurants and shopping in Xintiendi!
content: Great pedestrian only neighborhood, with upper scale shopping and a great variety of restaurant options. Lots of places have both infdoor and outdoor seating. Cool brick buildings and long alley walkways to stroll through. Some spots have a great late night party crowd, but there are also several quieter, more romantic spots for couples. Tons of shops from home decor to clothing to beauty shops. We loved the LUNA restaurant and appetizers and drinks at T8!

title: Lovely afternoon
content: We spent a very enjoyable afternoon wandering around the shops in the French Concession. It is very touristic, and full - it's difficult to navigate. Most of the shops seem to sell much of the same things but it is still nice to wander. There are good restaurants in the area, although there are some tatty looking ones too!

title: tree lined streeta
content: this was my favorite part of shanghai, the tree lined street and multiple bars with out door seating was very charming

title: Got a little lost, but it was worth it
content: If you have the time while you're in Shanghai, take a walk through the tree lined streets of the Old French Concession. I went in the summer when Shanghai is hot and humid, but it was well worth it. Plus, there are a ton of cafe and boutique stores to jump into to cool off and grab a bite to eat.

title: night tour of Old French Concession
content: my travelling buddy and I had a personalised tour of this are in the evening, the weather was perfect, just meandering around the small streets with all the variious shops.

title: Amazing streets to get lost
content: The old french concession is a charming neibourhood with plenty of shadows, interesting things to take pictures of, nice restaurants, bars and cafes. Really good choice to spend an afternoon during your visit to Shanghai.

title: French Concession
content: Many places to eat, with very good quality. Also a great couple of Jazz Bars, as well as live bands. Sit outside and enjoy the evening, baring any huge pollution issues.

title: Very characteristic
content: Don't forget to go to porto matto restaurant to enjoy italian pasta and pizza. You can trust italian chef...it' s really italian. Los of mexican good restaurant nearby too.

title: Great restaurants and shopping
content: We thought this was a small area. It is huge. Some great shops and restaurants. Classic old French architecture, some beautiful brownstones, and both high end shops and touristy shops. Great place to see.

title: Favourite place in Shanghai
content: Start on Taikang Road (explore the lanes, which are a little touristy but there are some real gems tucked in the tight alleyways. Ladies if you like contemporary Chinese fashion - check out the small shop URBAN TRIBE - beautiful linen clothes and jewellery - 14 Lane 248. Highly recommend this.) Then wander down Sinan Road to Fuxing Park and on to Huaihai Middle Road. While thing takes about 2-3 hours at a very leisurely pace. Great architecture, eclectic shops and lots of cafés to refuel and refresh. We were amongst only a handful of Western tourists we saw all morning. It was a great way to see a little of Shanghai's history.

title: History
content: The Old French Concession has a sense of history. The narrow streets, the buildings with their unique architecture. The numerous "watering holes' - pubs clearly patronised by expats. We had a beer at a bar that was New Zealand orientated ruby of the giant screen. Walk around the place and enjoy its atmosphere.

title: Just OK
content: Just OK, very touristy, very expensive, really not what i was expecting. Its quite leafy and there is one area which is quite disneyfied.

title: Well worth a visit
content: We began our exploration of this lovely and historic district at the Old China Hand Reading Room. We lingered for over an hour at this delightful library and cafe, taking in the soulful background music and relaxing with a snack and cappuccino.

title: Great Place
content: Full of character. Part of our Jenny's tour which I highly recommend. Loved this place. Small narrow streets teaming with people and loads of eating places, bars and small arty / craft shops. A must see when visiting Shanghai. Not cheap for drinks but worth every RMB.

title: Great, but was better
content: The French Concession was at some stage the most popular place in Shanghai for the expat community, now it is shifting to different areas. Nevertheless there are many great restaurants here and the same for bars and clubs

title: Nice park
content: We walked through this pleasant neighborhood and its park with activities of all types going on all around. Delightful photos.

title: Nice lunch
content: Nice area lots of places to eat and some nice shops, had a nice sandwich for lunch absolutely huge more than I could eat.Had a walk around the area very relaxed and well worth a visit.

title: Fun spot for the evening
content: Xin Tian Di is a great spot to go for a drink and some people watching. When I need some 'western' food and entertainment after a few weeks in China, this is my go-to place. I like Paulaner Brauhaus, a German pub, for a beer and catching up with friends. The Fountain has a wonderful ambiance and a great burger. Their bucket of mussels is also a real treat.

title: Old French Concession
content: worth a look not much to get excited about a few shops and a pleasant area some restaurants just a nice place to be away from the bustle of Shanghai.

title: A place full of surprise
content: This is quite a huge area and I only able to walk by some of it such as Wukang road, Heng Shan Road, Dong Ping Road and Tao Jiang Road. Slowly discover this area and it is full of surprise because many nice scenery and building here.

title: Really loved this
content: Loved this area. You felt you could be in a Paris suburb. We even found a nice little bistro for lunch.

title: Old French Concession
content: Very quaint with a flavour of old Shanghai. Necessary to see to understand the vast changes in the city.

title: Time travellers enjoy
content: The concession still has a Gallic feel about it, not just the architecture, but also in the restaurants and patisserie. Paul's spring to mind and the barquette and other goodies they supply are straight out of France. A lovely part of town,

title: Old French quarter of Shanghai
content: This was a pleasant area to stroll around with some of the original buildings still preserved, albeit adapted for modern tastes and comfort. Very much a tourist quarter but certainly well served by bars and restaurants (not particularly French!). Still the French influence can be seen in the generous sized streets and trees and smart shops.

title: Colorful area
content: With tree lined streets and boulangeries serving croissants and good bread this area is quite stroll able. There's fine upscale shopping available in this concession as well.

title: The place to be in Shanghai
content: many excellent restaurants, bars and a good vibe all day long. A young persons destination. Fun shopping as well.

title: Vibey area ....a must !
content: Wonderful area full of vibey restaurants & bars. Great shops & interesting places of interest to visit.

title: Camel bar
content: Need a sports fix? Australian ran, you can check whats being shown before you go on their facebook site. Food was great pub style.

title: Great area for dining & drinking
content: This area is ful of little bars, bistros & french styled restaurants. It's a great area for a rainy day (in our case it was) plenty of choices & the prices are reasonable too. We entered from the Huangpu Rd area but there is a central courtyard that you can meet up with people if you become laost. There is toilets in the shopping complex at one end of the area.

title: Authentic
content: A lot of authentic buildings. I would recommend to come inside one of the areas. Internal yard. There are so many beautiful and unusual things

title: like alton towers does an old french concession
content: its pretty but feels rather contrived and is definitely overpriced but go if you have time to spare whilst in shanghai.

title: European feel in pretty corner of Shanghai
content: We only walked through the French Concession and grabbed ,you guessed it, a coffee at a little cafe who name I didn't catch.It was all about the coffee at that point and snapping pictures of the lovely umbrella covered tables on a sweet side street. I was surprised that it actually did feel like a little piece of France plopped down in Shanghai. Worth exploring more if I had made the time.

title: East meets West in a simpler time
content: This is time well spent and a unique experience in China, let alone Shanghai. The area is largely restored with some beautiful architecture and several historic houses that are also museums. There are also plenty of watering holes and opportunities for people watching. Take your time, use a good travel guidebook or better still one of the excellent local guides.

title: Good area to pary
content: This area is full of bars and lounges frequented by expats living in Shanghai. The area is good for people like us visiting Shanghai and would not like to see only Asians everyday. A must visit in Shanghai.

title: a bit of chic glitz within a metropolis
content: loved the small lanes and numerous bars and restaurants, There was a good happy hour at Kabb bar and bistro worth stopping by. Not a place for bargain shopping. Element Fresh , good food in very large servings, try sharing

title: Great Afternoon Out
content: We nearly couldn't be bothered going here on our last afternoon, however people had recommended it and so we dragged ourselves along .. and we were SO pleased. Just to wander around and enjoy looking at nice things. We sat at Starbucks for a while (ok not very authentic!) but was clean and enjoyable. It is well worth a wander around .

title: Old Shanghai
content: This was one of my favorite places to visit in Shanghai. Many locals refer to it as the former French Concession, as the Chinese do not like to be reminded of the foreign occupation of their city. The buildings are lovely and the streets tree-lined and quiet. There are lots of quaint cafes and shops. Take the time to wander and explore the side streets, too, where you will see small apartments, lots of flowers, and residents going about their daily life. I loved seeing the bird cages on the streets and the cats sleeping in the windows. Keep your camera handy for some of the best photo ops in Shanghai.

title: Old Shanghai at its best
content: Great restaurants and away from the towers of Pudong, remarkably quiet with an old-school French flair.  Not to be missed.

title: A must in Shanghai
content: Feels like you are strolling on the boulevards in Paris. So charming with lots of small cafes, bistros, restaurants and little boutiques. You round a corner and a new experience awaits you. The old houses and mansions so beautiful and full of history.

title: Favourite District!!
content: walking through this streets feels like beeing in another part of the world. the trees along the streets in this district make a sightseeing walk tour very enjoyable and relaxing. go there! youll like it!

title: Excellent restaurants quaint streets
content: Trendy part of Shanghai plenty of places to eat. They have a wide range of cuisine to choose from. Also lots of little boutique shops , prices reasonable too. Toilets are smelly though , even in nice restaurants this is the same anywhere in Shanghai only places that aren't are the Hotels .

title: My favorite part of Shanghai
content: I had some time in between meetings to walk around. I was fortunate enough that my hotel was in the French Concession area. I love how green the area is and love the art deco architecture. It's also nice to have the all the businesses that cater to westerners in the area. While I love the food in China, it can get tiring to navigate through every interaction without much Mandarin. It was also nice to run into co-workers out at the bars on the weekend. Made a large city feel much smaller.

title: Have a walk
content: A nice place in Shanghai.

title: Delve deep into the Old French Concession
content: We started at the Starbucks and had lunch at Element Fresh. We took a walking tour that brought us to the untouched area. It was beautiful in its simplicity. The people were so kind. One guy showed us how to make rice and dates in lotus leaves. Cool.

title: Shanghai's old French Concession area
content: Take the subway and exit at the South Huangpi Station ( Exit # 1).

title: Where East blends with West
content: The Old French Concession is a great place to stroll about and take in European architecture. The look and feel is definitely Western yet the location is Eastern - in Shanghai. Hang out at one of the many bars for a beer or wine and...

title: A good vibe
content: This is less historic than it is fun. Lots of little shops to wander around in and little restaurants for a drink or a meal. Lots of tourists but that's ok. It is still a fun place to wander for an afternoon.

title: European feel
content: A great area full of interesting shops and restaurants, tree lined streets and wonderful ambience. You can easily spend quite some time simply wandering and soaking up the atmosphere.

user_loc: 德克萨斯州科珀斯克里斯蒂市
title: Fun and Unique
content: We had a blast walking through the alleyways of the Old French Concession. There are all sorts of artisan shops and an abundance of uniquely themed restaurants (ie. teddy bear, cat, toilet, etc.). We went back twice during our stay in Shanghai!

title: Great vibes a must of visiting shanghai
content: We were lucky enough to be staying next door. Not typical Chinese as lots of old historic colonial French style buildings. Great place for tourists and locals alike buzzing day and night. Interesting buildings and alleys and sculptures too. So many bars and restaurants and some shops too. Mainly pedestrian and the Main Street also has some nice little shops with unusual things. There are your places like Starbucks and Godiva and Wolfgang puck and pizza express and then other restaurants. All cuisines to be found and all sorts of beers and places to smoke indoor and live music too. A great place to hang out and it was all decked up for Halloween too. Definitely worth a visit. Public toilets were also suprisingly clean.

title: Relaxing but quick walk through
content: An adventure in architecture. Small sidewalk cafes - excellent for that iced coffee you need to keep going. Much history given with a good guide. Shops galore for the shoppers but basically a quiet charming place in the midst of a huge city.

title: Lovely old neighborhood in Shanghai
content: Leafy old neighborhood with lots of nice houses and alley ways. Seems to have more western restaurants and cafes. Beautiful to walk through or to eat in.

title: Lots of unique shops
content: Great place to explore. Interesting old style buildings (not sure if they are original or not) and lots of interesting shops (original small designers), eateries and bars. Great atmosphere.

title: Get an Organised Tour
content: This is a great area for a walk and some great colonial architecture. We organised a tour with a guide (restricted to about 15 people) and learned much more than we would have done on a DIY tour

title: full of charm
content: Full of charms. A bit quiet at night. But loved it! Forgot the name of this street full of bars. One of the cafe name is "les stagiaires" . Its very nice and food is cheap and good! My favorite area in Shanghai.

title: Europe in Shanghai
content: The beauty of Shanghai, one minute you feel in China, the next you feel your in Europe. Great streets, walking areas, resturants,and shops. The place to be.

title: French with chinese flavor
content: A nice place to go there to get an impression how it might have been in the past but takes only 15 minutes to see everything. A lot of little expensive restaurants. Better go to Taikang Lu.

title: Walk the French Concession
content: This is an interesting area to walk with a massive contrast between the quarters of the rich and the poor. I went with a guide and would not recommend it. She took us more frequently than necessary to places where she obviously got a commission. Walk it yourself.

title: charming
content: On prior trip to shanghai I hadn't seen this area and was anxious to explore. It was well-worth wandering around with many options for delicious fare (I simply wandered into one that was overflowing with locals - where no one spoke any english - and pointed my way to a delicious meal). This is a fun wandering spot if you have an extra afternoon to spare. If you have a limited time frame - I would not put this in my top 5 list of things to do.
