title: A Must See if You Like Shopping
content: The old french concession is a great place to spend part or most of a day while in Shanghai----especially if you like shopping. There are plenty of shops and restaurants everywhere you look, but make your way inside the maze of shops inside the concession. Lots of selection and bargains if you have the patience. Also, quite a number of small eateries with various cuisines when you need a break. For men, well there's a Starbucks nearby.

title: So much history and character to explore. Very trendy place
content: So much history and character to explore. A Very trendy place. I did the French concession walking tour and it was great.

title: Leafy suburbs
content: Lovely to walk around the leafy suburbs of French Concession, great coffee shops, wine bars & restaurants. Visit the parks early in the morning and witness the locals practising Tai Chi.

title: Not really a must see
content: Some trendy restaurants and shops located here. Cobble streets

title: Felt like I was in Europe
content: Despite the modern style of shanghai. This out of place location in such a modern city, felt very comforting. I think we must have visited 10 different places there. Met lots of new friends, had a blast and really enjoyed it. Still when we walked out it was strange we felt like going from a location in europe to a set of the Jetsons.

title: A Touch of France tucked away in Shanghai
content: Loved walking through this area with its tree-lined, cobble-stoned roads, cute bistros and restaurants, and lovely ambient atmosphere. Another hideaway from the noise and busy-ness of Shanghai. Great place to visit to witness contrasting cultures - East Meets West!

title: Oh so tres french
content: we walked through this one beautiful Sunday afternoon and enjoyed every minute. The cobbled stone roads, beautiful buildings, dainty quaint boutiques and great places to lounge and eat - very very chic and french ! Tres Bien !!

title: Pretty European-Style Neighborhood With a Chinese Twist
content: Go on one of the handful of great self-guided walking tours that you'll find online and you'll discover one of the more atmospheric neighborhoods across Mainland China. The French Concession is the one reason many expats and travelers love Shanghai and it is easy to see why. Its tree-lined streets are home to fashionable boutiques, jazz bars, quaint cafes, and restaurants catering to all tastes. Loft-style lane houses and traditional shikumens house both older Shanghainese and expats alike, turning the neighborhood into a stylish enclave that still manages to maintain its local flavor.

title: interesting place to wander
content: The older buildings here are lovely to see. We had breakfast at Vienna Cafe which was small, intimate and beautifully decorated. On Sundays they have a brunch.

title: Beautiful district
content: Really enjoyed wandering around the French Concession district. Beautiful avenues of Plane Trees, great little bars and cafes all with a sense of community.

title: Caught the subway
content: Great to wonder through these streets and take in the old buildings. We loved the maple tree lines streets and grabbed morning tea at a Costa Coffee

user_loc: 哥伦比亚特区华盛顿特区
title: Walk and Enjoy
content: Area is large, but target a few locations for a feel of going back in time. Area near the Dr. Sun Yat-Sen musueme is worth a self-guided walking tour.

title: Must visit
content: great place to dine-in.. lot of international restaurants nice view.. good place for gathering and networking wit friends.

title: Colonial & Modern
content: Some of the old French colonial era building still remain in the neighborhood. However, all of them have been renovated and most were converted into shop or restaurants. Nothing really special,   Good for an afternoon stroll.

title: a bit of the old in the new
content: When you want to sit and relax and escape the never ending movement of Shanghai. Some European style restaurants serving good food at a reasonable price. try for a seat outside as it adds to the charm of the area. not to be missed

title: Western style in Shanghai
content: Interesting older french architecture buildings, streets with mature trees, good restaurants, bakeries, coffee places and shops. Nice to walk around to discover the area.

title: must visit when in Shanghai
content: We loved this little corner, with fantastic shops, tea houses and coffee shops. The Kommune Café is a fantastic brunch venue with fresh juices, creative dishes and delicious coffee.

title: Nothing special
content: We wanted to see the French concession after reading very favourable opinions and reviews. However, we were not impressed at all. There are nice alleys and shops and the atmosphere is more European; plus the majority of people there were foreigners. We took a walking route suggested in one of travel guides. After having a walk around, we had a rest in a quiet Fuxing Park.

title: A piece of France in the middle of Shanghai
content: I walked from my hotel to the French Concession. I went thought Xujiahui park, and as I exit, I felt I was in a different world. A lot of the traffic and horning is gone. I see boulevards, cafes, and shops.

title: cider to books
content: Loved the art deco theatres that are throughout this district and had a great Irish cider at Don's as well as Mexican food in the district

title: Not worth the visit
content: Not much to see the restraunts are very expensive , and there is nothing really there to see, there is little shops.

title: Cool and funky neighbourhood
content: Leafy and relatively quiet, but with stacks of cool bars and restaurants. Lots of large impressive properties to check out. Must see, just a great place to hang out and explore for a day or so.

title: A touch of Europe in China
content: Tree lined streets and european styled housing, gave an upmarket feel to this area.Lots of boutique style shops and garden areas.

title: Very romantic
content: Just walking around on a rainy spring day make you feel like you went back in time to the romantic colonial era of yesteryear. full of shopping and a ton of delicious restaurants, cute bakeries and coffee shops. we just loved walking around exploring all the small streets and trying small bites in many of the bistros and bakeries.

title: Where everyone hangs out
content: This is by far my favourite part of Shanghai to hang out, go out. The scale and diversity of the architecture is great, lots to do and see. Xintiandi, Tianzifang, Fuxing Park, Jing'an Sculpture Park, walking along Fuxing or Beijing Lu, lots of expat or Shanghainese places to eat. It's a large area with great diversity, something for everyone!

title: a Must Do
content: Please visit here! It is one of the areas in Shanghai which is not totally modernized yet so you actually feel like you left a big city for a few minutes!

title: Old world charm
content: the heritage is very well preserved. the place transports you back to a different era and I liked the way they tried to blend the modern with the old. has good restaurants and cafe

title: Nice for a walk and dinner
content: Depending on where you wanna go it may be expensive compared to Shanghai average prices...but still worths for the nice atmosphere.

title: Little Europe
content: You may call this China's version of Little Europe. That's the kind of feel you get here. There are plenty of restaurants, coffee shops, and shopping venues. The restaurants range from fine dining to casual. Same for the shops, high end and casual. Highly recommended.

title: Worthwhile Visit
content: Great to have a look around here. Some very nice restaurants and shops to be seen. A definite French feel to the area. We visited the house nearby where the talks took place for Communist Party. Great history.

title: Loved the place
content: Amazing I enjoyed every moment. Really beautifull, nice people, a lot of options when comes to Restaurants and bars. Just awesome.

title: Beautifully maintained
content: A lovely area to walk around and enjoy . It has several Paris feel restaurants and shops .Loved the architecture of this area and less crowded than other areas .

title: Good walk around
content: Fun to just walk the streets, see the park, old Russian Church, tree lined streets, easy to get to from subway

title: Nothing much to see
content: We have been there by day time and there is nothing much to see, maybe by night it is better...

user_loc: 澳大利亚新南威尔士州
title: Nice colonial buildings
content: We walked through the area which is full of restaurants. Unfortunately, we didn't have time for a meal/snack. It is an interesting insight into the colonial history of Shanghai.

title: Away from the skyscapers
content: Covers an extensive part of the city and still has a French flavour with tree-lined boulevards and French-style architecture. Full of expensive shops and restaurants. Pleasant and relaxing for a stroll.

title: Cycle Tour
content: We did a cycle tour with China Cycle Tours. It made it possible to see some very interesting places. I cycled like a local, sticking close to the guide at the traffic lights - some very hairy moments (from my perspective)!

title: If you need a bit of western life.. head over to the Old French Concession
content: Excellent.... a wide variety of bars, restaurants eg. Tapas, Greek, French and shops. Lots of tree lined streets... This we think is the best area for Western foods etc. It is well worth a visit

title: Good stroll
content: Immerse yourself in the history of shanghai which gives you the blend of old and new

title: A large outdoor mall.
content: I suppose when you imagine a place to be something and you find the reality to be very different- its disappointing. I was expecting a mix of old and new, but I found a perfectly renovated set of old brick buildings with nice cafes all squeezed within about 3 blocks. It felt uncomfortable as it was jammed with westerners who all seemed to fall off a dozen tour buses.

title: Lovely Modern Piece of restored Arctitecture
content: Great to see this piece of history restored and protected and worth the visit of for nothing else to see the expats enjoying the cafe lattes and a relaxed and comfortable modern environment. Other than the location of the first meeting of the communist party in 1921 this area has little historical or cultural significance but worth an hour to have a coffee or meal.

title: Parisian style cafes
content: Nice get a way from everything Chinese, but if you have been to Paris, then skip it and see many other wonderful Shanghai sights.

title: Better to stay in than to visit
content: For China it may be a bit different but compared to other places in the world this area is not remarkable or special. One should not visit China or Shanghai to see the Old French Concession. There are other good reasons to visit Shanghai - like the Bund. A plus side is that there are lots of bars and restaurants but as a result it lacks the authentic atmosphere of some of the Hutong areas south of Fuxing Road East.

title: Just okay
content: So, there are some nice homes and sycamore tree lined streets. Reminded me of a nice part of San Jose. I'm sorry, but I fail to see the attraction here. Maybe I walked down the wrong streets for an hour looking for points of interest... Hmm?

title: A must to visit
content: We only have about two hours here but it has nice restaurant to eat and arts and crafts shops. It is an older section of Shanghai.

title: Can't go wrong
content: The French Concession is a great place to simply stroll around and view the original interesting architecture, tree lines streets, and some great and unique shops and restaurants. The areas is laid back and much less frenetic than other parts of Shanghai. The area around Zhou Enlai's house is nice, and is also in proximity to the Sinan Mansions restaurant and bar area.

title: Great part of town to visit
content: Beautiful architecture and relevant historical information all around. The interesting stories behind some of these buildings adds to the atmosphere. Make sure you go to the Shanghai Tower and visit the museum before you go to this beautiful area to really get the full experience.

title: A taste of France in downtown Shanghai
content: A definite stop on your visit to downtown Shanghai. Great restaurants, shopping, fountains and a patisserie that reminisces the past history of this famous French quarter. Only a short and inexpensive taxi ride from Peoples Square area.

title: Beautiful area
content: The french concession is so different to the other parts of Shanghai and yet so close to the city center. It is beautifully quiet, lots of small cafes, restaurants, boutique. Don't miss out on the Jiashang Market in No 546 Shaanxi South Road every first and third Saturday of the months!

title: Great Architecture And Excellent Neighborhood.
content: We were here during the holiday so it was very crowded. We were glad to have taken the city bus tour to avoid the big crowd.

title: Really nice area.
content: There was a great buzz here and it's a 'different' aspect of China, well worth seeing. It was busy, with throngs crouding the streets but it still felt safe. Verey good foe shopping

title: Wonderful place to spend the day or evening.
content: Great restaurants, shops, people watching.  Good place to wander for the day and then walk to the Bund.

title: Quite expansive
content: This is one of the must do things in Shanghai, however, the area is quite large, and you have to explore a lot to fully grasp the place.

title: You will see real classic ancient Chinese rich man house
content: Suddenly you feel you gone back old days , every inch of ancient rich man house and every old time will make you some old Chinese movie come in front of you ! Sit there inside silently for 1hr you will love it ...

title: Beautifully restored
content: This is much more of a nice walk and window shop than history. But it is another fine example of Modern Shanghai's cleanliness and international-ness.

title: Vibrant and electric
content: Getting lost in the hustle and bustle of these narrow streets was one of my favorite activities in Shanghai. It has a vibrant and electric feel to the place. Shopping is good although quiet overpriced compared to other markets in China. You have countless restaurants to choose from all with seating outside so you can watch the people walk by. You could have breakfast lunch and dinner here for a week and not eat in the same place twice.

title: spring in Shanghai
content: Nice place for a stroll ,photos,lunch and few beers.New and old buildings.spent a day walking around area and relaxing in Fuxing park.The old French area is quite and peaceful.

title: Aim at the tourist
content: Unfortunately this area has now turned into a network of small shops and bars aimed at the tourist. It was definitely nice to see the architecture and it's excellent that the buildings are being restored so it can be kept for future generations. Definitely worth a visit but if you buy anything, expect to pay a premium.

title: Great place to stroll, eat, shop
content: Best in good weather. We went in the rain so didn't get to sit at any of the outside cafes. Next time!!

title: Beautiful part of town
content: This is a very chic area with lots of history and beautiful stores. Very cosmopolitan. We walked around and got a history lesson as well. More western looking. Very high end.

title: Are you serious about this place, really?
content: The French Concession, so-called, is BIG. Not just a few criss-crossing streets. It has been massacred ruthlessly by cut-in, multi-million, or billion-dollar investments which were planned decades ago and introduced in rolling waves until certain priceless areas became unrecognizable. It now contains very, very little architectural or cultural continuity. You need to research the bits you want to see, (Duolun Road? Past intellectual centre and old movie theatre-cafe? ? It's a long way from Huai Hai Road!) and if you are serious, give it plenty of time. Some old trees still line Xiangyang Rd and Jianguo West Rd. Lovely shady trees also in some parts of Yueyang Rd. Avoid getting sidetracked into every coffee shop or mall you see; if it's very hot, that's difficult. Only a few, very small stretches have still got authentic bits of connected architecture which are genuinely photogenic, though you can have plenty of serious fun with a camera anyway. (Don't aim in people's faces!) If you want to see and eat, killing two birds with one stone, try a few famous spots: the Okura Garden Hotel (Maomin Rd) for buffet lunches or dinners (5 star prices), with the magnificent rooms of the old French Officer's Club and their lovely garden (by Huai Hai Rd, use Shanxi Nan Rd Subway Lines 1 and 10). Be warned that the Okura Garden Hotel's Rose Cafe saves money by using 'Avocet' (palm oil-base) instead of real cream or evaporated milk; this does not embarrass them. Their lobby is magnificent and the prices match. Opposite to them is the wonderful old JinJiang Hotel complex, and interior garden. Or try Citizen Cafe, Jinxian Rd by Shanxi Nan Rd, or Sichuan Citizen in Donghu Rd (many dishes which are not too spicy, as well as the hot ones). Try the delicious Shibata 'celebrity' coffee and cake shop in Jiashan Rd, near Jianguo West Rd (next to the Pines supermarket). Too crowded to get a table there on weekends; that happens a lot here! Take water, take a camera but don't let it dominate your life. There is MUCH more in the French Concession! It really depends how serious you are. And yes, Yongjia Rd has some cute cafes, too, and the newish La Cava delicious Tapas bar. . See if you can find the Song Fang tea house. Seventy (70) varieties of exclusive tea, cups and pots to match. And that's only just the beginning......

title: Loved this part of town
content: My wife and I spent lunch and the afternoon in this part of Shanghai. The easiest place to start is at the shopping complex called K11

title: Lunch at VaBene followed by Starbucks - Life is good!!!
content: Very nice area of Shanghai - lots of little shops & restaurants ( all types) - seems compact - very...

title: Spend a day wandering
content: Start out with an early brunch at Ferguson Lane on Wukang Lu and then just go from there. The area is actually quite large and there are myriad recommended paths. It's very easy to just wander about and check out little shops. Other expat favorites probably include Wulumuqi Rd, Changle Rd., Jianguo Rd. etc. If you're brave enough to ride a bike in Shanghai traffic, it will allow you to cover a lot of ground and is very nice especially if you want to see more in less time.

title: Must do it right the right way...walk
content: The Old French Concession and its surrounding areas is not just about stopping by and looking at some old buildings. If you want to enjoy this area, one must be prepared to take a stroll

title: Explore the many street it has to offer.
content: The area of the old French Concession is quite huge stretching many city blocks and going from highrises to tree lined streets with old villas.

title: Go here for lunch when the weather is good.
content: Lots of patios and delicious restaurants. Some shopping but Tianzifang is better for shopping. Just go eat lunch on a patio and enjoy the atmosphere.

title: China "Lite"
content: I was excited to visit this neighborhood after hearing everyone go crazy over it, but I am not sure what the appeal is. There is nothing Chinese about it and we frankly find it boring. Tree-lined streets are a dime a dozen in most parts of the world; not sure why one would come all the way to China to walk along one!

title: Very crowded but enjoyable
content: This was very deceiving. There is nothing French about it except a few balconies, but it was a French settlement area back in the day. Today there are narrow lanes lined with shops and food stalls and restaurants and bars.

title: Home Away From Home
content: I have lived in this area on four occasions in the last six years. Tree lined streets. Quiet tucked away areas with lovely architecture. Gorgeous gardens glimpsed behind walls. Former glory of the area is still witnessed with houses built by Europeans, some of which now house consulates. Real neighborhoods with small vendors, stores, restaurants. A lovely area for families to live or simply for a walk on a spring day...or any day. Good area for bike riding, having tea, wine or exploring.

title: wander
content: Give yourself time to wander through this tree lined neighborhood. The architecture was great and so was the vibe of this place.

title: must see
content: Well, I am in love with Shanghai in totality. Honestly it was not what I expected. I am blown away. I am very impress with China. Very modern, buildings are just structurally beautiful. it is a must visit country….

title: Do Not Miss
content: This was better than we expected. We kept going down laneways and discovering even more interesting places. You could spend at least a morning - if not more - here. So many interesting shops, cafes (with real coffee). There was even an Irish pub!!!!!.

title: Wish I'd had more time to stroll / shop / dine
content: Beautiful area of town. Wish I'd had more time to stay and relax a bit. A kind-of European section with smaller buildings, pedestrian zones, cafes with outdoor seating, fountains, wonderful small shops, artists studios, etc. Lovely!

title: A wonderful place to stroll around
content: I have been here many times and love to stroll around taking photos of the old French villas and Mansions. The area is actually quite big which surprised me so you can end up wandering aimlessly! I like to go here for shopping and lunch in the small coffee shops and restaurants dotted around. If you are looking for something lively at night Hengshen Lu has lots of bars and noisy spots to hang out. A great choice for a day exploring....and a break from the big city life! This area attracts a large crowd of expats too.

title: Rather overrated.
content: We were expecting a beautiful area, but were rather disappointed to find out it is tiny, not too welcoming, and definitely not welcoming in the late evening.

title: Excellent!
content: Two words: Great area. For food, a family day out or street shopping!!! One of the best areas in Shanghai without a doubt in my mind. I now go there almost every weekend, whether with friends or family.

title: Small area, charming.
content: I thought this was a bigger place to visit. So i was a bit surprised by how small this area was. Nevertheless really enjoyed the architecture of the buildings and the stones. The restaurants are nice, its a good place for a drink.

title: wonderful place
content: I'm biased this is where we lived it's amazing, tree lined and calm, away from the madness that is many other places in Shanghai. Lots of bars restaurants and yet quiet. The best place to stay.

title: Beautiful to walk around
content: It's a great place to walk around and snap photos or just enjoy the beautiful day. Bring a book - you might want to pop into a small coffee shop.

title: A bit hard to find...
content: Once we found it, it was very nice to walk and look at the various shops. The buildings are a bit more European looking, but as time goes on, the more modern buildings in China have similar looks.

title: The best part of Shanghai
content: I love the French Concessions, its full of bars and restaurants and little boutiques. It is the perfect place to spend a sunny sunday wandering around stopping somewhere for coffee or lunch. You can tell you are in the right area by the Plane Trees planted along the roadside, a definite change from the greenness of the rest of the city.

user_loc: 哥伦比亚特区华盛顿特区
title: A nice historical spot
content: You have to go to the French concession with a plan because when I went with my significant other to just walk around at about 10:00 PM, it was silent and reminiscent of a ghost town in some parts of the French concession. Overall, it's a nice getaway from the hustle and bustle of the rest of the city. Depending on the hour of the night, taxis can be difficult to find here.

title: Old French Concession
content: It has become a modern European and American location. Only traces of the French architecture. Not impressed. Do not know why it is of interest.

title: Great area!
content: Very nice area with loads of restaurant of various taste. Looks like an european town there. You can walk, see trees and a bit of nature. At least the pollution and smog is hiddend.

title: Awesome find
content: You get to this and feel you left Shanghai all together.

title: Beautiful and Different
content: This area is unlike anything else in Shanghai or probably any other city in China with wide streets lined with big trees and not many people. It is worth visiting to get a feel for the uniqueness of the area, but I would not consider it to be a must-see. It depends on what you want to see in the city.

title: Get Lost... Literally
content: Get lost in this little section of Shanghai. You will find souvenirs, tea shops, snack shops (potato chips with a cheese dusting), any thing else to your heart's content. Also go to GoodBuy and try their tea's.

title: Nice hang-out
content: It was a great place to walk around and gave a good flavor of the Shanghai city which boasts of both hi-tech architecture as well the traditional places. Preferably visit this place in the morning and avoid weekends.

title: beautiful street and nice villas
content: French Concession is a VERY Charming part of Shanghai with lovely feelings and a lot of nice coffee stores - also great for shopping. We love Xintiandi and Tianzifang.

title: Chic
content: Just wander.This was a really enjoyable chic experience for me. Shops and people and a great cheap lunch.

title: Great Architecture
content: Interesting to see the differences. Tree lined whereas other streets were devoid of flora. Great to walk around.

title: Get lost in translation
content: What an awesome way to experience old and new Asia, simultaneously. Historic architecture bangs up against comtemporary bling consumerism. Clothes and dead chickens hang to dry from every imaginable place. Stop and buy a bag of "white rabbits" at a "family mart." These milk candies are like the Chinese version of After Dinner Mints, once incredibly special. Don't rush your experience of the French Concession. Take at least one whole day to explore and walk holes in your soles of your shoes. I even dared to stop for a hair cut at a hectic but chic looking salon. Absolutely fabulous!

title: Beautiful place for a stroll - best by night.
content: We went to check out this place by day and then back for dinner and drinks one night. Its definitely better and more lively by night so if you are short on time than go at night. Definitely grab a drink or cocktail at one of the restaurants or bars and soak up the atmosphere.

title: French Boutique
content: Old French concession situated in heart of Shanghai city. It has many boutique shops & Restaurants as well residential houses too. Each & every building has similar design. Great area to explore Shanghai city.

title: A great place to be
content: after shopping till we were dropping we stopped by here for a bite to eat. It's a great "mall" of restaurants with lots of choices. Most have outdoor dining at it is fun to relax and people watch here.

title: Quick fix for Westerners experiencing culture shock
content: Clean and well maintained area of the city that appears designed primarily for expats. Restaurants and shops are expensive. Interesting to see and experience, but not really a true slice of Asia.

title: Lovely area, expat prices
content: Look like boulevards de Paris! Lots of western food joints and cafes. Shanghai brewery is fun and portions huge! Come here for comfort food if in china for a while. Negative is with western food comes western prices!

title: A must to when in Shanghai
content: This is a stop definitely worth doing when in Shanghai. Great shopping and even better restaurants. I recommend walking off the beaten path a bit to find less touristy places to dine.

title: fine ambiance and plenty of nice pubs and restaurants
content: although there are plenty houses and buildings that remember the old days, don't expect to be suddenly in the middle of Paris. it's an interesting area though that's worth visiting but get a little prepared or hop into the Tourist office (right in the midle of it) to get some information. I found some nice lovely smelling bakeries... there is also a good choice of bars and restaurants.

title: very cool part of Shanghai
content: Walking the ancient tree-lined streets of the French concession is a must when you visit this city. Like stepping back in time. Many cool bars, eateries, and boutiques to choose from, most are expensive, but walking is free.

title: Lovely
content: I simply love walking around the French Concession, it has the feel of Old Shanghai. Something in the old books and you can sense the charm of day to day life inside some of these most beautiful villas.

title: Very Nice
content: Nicely renovated and presented shopping area of Shanghai. Great place to wander for an hour or two or to sit and people watch.

title: nice, but ..
content: nice place to visit, don't go in the week-ends, to much people, and prizy for drinks. Here you'll see the most western tourists in Shabghai. Very close to Xin tian di.

title: Amazing architecture and quaint shops
content: We walked around the French Concession for several hours one afternoon. We weren't shopping or eating, we just wanted to see what all the hype was about. We especially enjoyed the architecture! We ended up walking into a park with a huge field for children to run and play. Toys like balls and bubble wands were super cheap (15 RMB) which was a nice break for our little one. If I had to pick one place in Shanghai to live, it would be the French Concession!

title: Worth it only if you go on the day time!
content: If you go at night time it is basically like walking in any street. The houses and buildings are not lighted up for night time so you better plan on going in the daytime.

title: relaxed and pretty
content: quiet and pretty tree lined streets, lots of little clothes and music shops to keep you occupied. Cafes and Bars are expensive but they have a lot of choice of beers

title: So much to see!
content: I had so much fun walking around the Old French Concession. Even though I only walked around for about an hour, there were so many cute shops and restaurants to look at. Our tour guide also showed us around the alleys and the amazing architecture. If you have an hour or two to kill, definitely go here.

title: a fusion of europe and china
content: this place has all the great small restaurants. the atmosphere is great since it doesnt really feel like the other parts of shanghai with tall buildings.

title: Sometimes you come across these old buildings - am I really in China?
content: I strolled the streets north of Fanzipan and came across a few gems of old buildings (an art deco cinema and the old French court house). I also came across a shop which had one off Alexander McQueen, Yves St Laurent and other big names.

user_loc: 加利福尼亚洛思阿图斯
title: Enjoyable by foot
content: We did a Frommer's walking tour of the French Concession area which was really enjoyable. It's a very interesting, pretty, and lively area that does seem best seen by foot. Since we were doing it on an early Sunday morning after arriving in Shanghai, a number of the sites were closed but we still had a really nice time walking through the various streets and neighborhoods.

title: Old French Concetion
content: Staying on Yueyang road in airbnb (Echo), love it here plenty of lovely shops, bars and lovely selection of the restaurants serving the favorites from around world. Low level tree lined streets, beautiful old buildings. Worth a visit.

title: Historical
content: This is an important historical part of the Shanghai culture, and it makes Shanghai such a unique city of old (such as the French concession) meeting new (such as the financial district). Well worth visiting with a tour guide or good tour book.

title: Worth a visit, but beware!
content: The area has many interesting buildings (including an early meeting place for the Chinese Communist party). Many are now restaurants and bars. Do watch the prices though - a large German beer cost over £8! Check before you commit yourself to a purchase.

title: Fastinating
content: It is very interesting to see how they lived back in the early days. Tall buildings and narrow streets. Some fun little stores.

title: World Fare
content: The French Concession offers lots of international offerings for your taste buds, but it doesn't come cheap. You can find French, Brazilian, Turkish, Mexican, Indian and Arabic restaurants. There are also lots of Night Clubs around as well. Definitely a place to check out if you like the night life.

title: Amazing, you can spend hours in the alleys
content: This is my favorite part of Shanghai. The little alleyways have a myriad of shops. Some sell very tourist type souvenirs, other offer amazing little bars and cafes. Make sure you have a couple of hours and comfortable walking shoes.

title: VERY NICE PLACE TO WALK ON A NICE DAY
content: Wondered around tree lined roads on a very nice sunny day. Lots of old style buildings and small shops and restaurants. Great if you like wondering around.

title: Commercialised
content: I was in the part in the new world area... And although some of the buildings were nice to look at... It's very much a tourist area with the usual trappings... As a tourist it wasn't what I came to see.

title: Nice area for a stroll
content: And plenty of restaurants and bars to stop in for some refreshments along the way. In my opinion there is nothing French in the French concession. I think it is a uniquely Chinese take on European architecture. Plenty of expats in this part of Shanghai. The area is safe. You can come across beggars and whatever you do don't give them anything as once you give one some money another 10 beggars will appear out of nowhere.

title: Nice place to walk around
content: FC is very big area and not easy to review, but you can find alot of different restaurants, bars, hotels and shops here, but not concentrate, you more you walk around you more you find.

title: Better in the evening
content: We strolled here just before dinner, at a time when it was just crowded with people passing by on the way home from work or on their way to dinner. There was an exhibition of sorts that was also closing up, so the whole place was just unnecessarily crowded with nothing much to do. We had dinner and then strolled again, this time with much better results.

title: Great relaxing place but not in Shanghai traditional style
content: Traditional building but restaurants in western style mainly. If you want some drinks with friends there should one of the best place in Shanghai. But if you need enjoy the local food here is not suitable for you.

title: Turning the old into the new
content: Looks like any typical city where old houses and neighborhoods have been renovated and new shops and restaurants have been added. Nothing special, and I would only go and walk around if you were in the area but would not recommend making a special trip there.

title: TAKE YOU TIME
content: Since the so called French Concession doesn't really has a center, you must be patient and take your time... at least a whole day for a nice walk. Taxi drivers will take you whether to Xin tian di (actually an open air mall) or to Fuxing Park... this is where your walk must start. After visiting the park (specially on weekends) head to the Northwest exit and allow yourself to get lost always heading west until Huashan Lu which is, let's say the end of the neighborhood (its pretty side, at least)

title: Old world charm
content: Leafy streets,little shops,the last remaining bits of a world gone by.Thankfully the Chinese have stopped demolishing this are

title: Nothing special
content: Take the time to do this only if you have nothing else to do. We did this on our very first day in town, and I was not very impressed.

title: Nice french bar
content: We were sent by mistake to old french concession, Xinle Road (we want to Xingle Rd). So we walked a little bit around and it was a tremendous contrast to busi Shanghai. Smal old houses, with shops and workshops. And after some time we entered an old french Cafe and were totaly surprised. It was cute, with a trayer and had Stela beer - and a very nice bartender.

title: Beautiful architecture
content: Lovely tree-lined streets with big French villas that are just getting more beautiful as Shanghai seems to be cleaning the facades. Great for a stroll, jogging, taking the dog for a walk and lots of restaurants and cafes within if you know where to look. Highly recommended.

title: Low rise heaven
content: One of the few streetscapes in China that is human sized. Worth walking around - also good restaurants

title: A walk in Little French
content: The whole french concession is very big and i picked Xin Tian Di as a starting point and walked all the way to Sinan Mansion, Sun Yat-Sen's former residence and Tian Zi Fang. Beautiful french cottages and maple trees lined the roads. When the leaves turn red, i can imagine how beautiful the whole area will look.

title: Beautiful ancient streets ...
content: It looks absolutely real even if it's been totally restored or reconstructed. We felt like we were in the most elegant Shanghai neighborhood from centuries ago. My husband's family lived there pre revolution and he was born in an elegant town house that has since been torn down. However the streets were still there bearing the same names so it was very nostalgic for us to see. Very historic - you can see the elegance from the restored architecture.

title: What a surprising place.
content: Couldn't believe what they have done with this area, really interesting and fun to see. We ate dinner here which was a little expensive but very enjoyable, lots to choose from as well. Great place to visit.

title: Go Explore
content: Lived here during my stay in Shanghai. Coming from Europe all the way to China I didn't expect to find myself in Europe again... The beautifully tree lined streets and European architecture leave a lot to explore. Bring a camera!

title: Wonderful way to spend a day!
content: Great place to wander, shop, see, sit, drink, eat, enjoy and take in the beauty of Shanghai. Remember you are in China and there will be people - but take tme to enjoy!

title: Shanghai at its best!
content: Loved this area, beautiful tree lined streets, great boutiques to shop at and great places to eat.

title: Step back in time
content: Had 2 weeks walking around Shanghai and the leafy tree lined streets and avenues along with the multitude of restaurants and shopping opportunities which are endless. The old mansions that remain with quite a number being refurbished were interesting and with tourism around China booming it is good to see these historical areas preserved in an atmosphere of massive urban renewal of high rise apartments.One interesting feature is retaining colonial buildings facades where all the original street facing features are preserved with new premises built behind. The photos in museums around Shanghai show what a vibrant area this place was at the turn of the last century.

user_loc: 阿根廷布宜诺斯艾利斯
title: shanghai french connection
content: Nice place, I don't know how muc of the original French Concession remains but if you like design stores, fancy restaurants, some old french buildings you may ñspend a couple of hours.

title: Take a walk on the French side
content: The French concession is a great place to stroll. The wide avenues, the trees, the wonderful architecture - particularly the art deco gems dotted through the concession. There are plenty of places to rest and revive with a drink or coffee.

title: Charming.
content: This little 'European Town' area is a charming oasis of French, German, etc. cafes and restaurants, as well as the requisite Starbucks. It is very busy and generally expensive, but well worth a visit for a nice evening out away from the awe-inspiring mega-city atmosphere of Pudong.

title: Expensive, but fun part of the City
content: I almost always stay in this district, as it is near where I have business. It has amazing places to eat, the amazing Shanghai Library, some great art, and some interesting clothing stores.

title: Very nice area
content: This is a great little enclave with lots of shops and restaurants. Many of these restaurants have outside dining as well where you watch all the passersby.

title: Nice but why
content: I'm in China to see China, not Europe revamping China... This area was crazy expensive with a lot of restaurants, coffee shops and touristy areas. Maybe we are spoiled since we have been to Europe.

title: Great neighborhood
content: The French Concession was abuzz with pedestrians, restaurants and shops. The architecture was nice to look at and the large trees planted during the time of the actual French Concession period were stately and beautiful. Plenty of ex-pats running around and we westerners caused less commotion here.

title: Great area to lunch, wander
content: Great variety if restaurants here and a nice place to wander, relax, window sop or serious shopping!

title: So different from the high rise city centre!!
content: Beautiful place, grorgipud architecture we tried Abbey Road bar was lovely meet some real nice expats there and enjoyed taking in the area. Take a bottle of water and spend the day getting lost ... Nothing better and it's free!!

title: Worth a couple hours of your time
content: Kinda has the feel of a small french village. Best part is hanging out in the outdoor restaurants and drinking some overpriced beer.

title: Beautiful
content: I usually stay in the FC area of Shanghai, renting an apartment for a week so I don't have to stay in a hotel for the majority of my stay. Love being able to walk the tree-lined streets, shop (and bargain!), eat at cute restaurants, and be able to take a taxi or the metro anywhere in Shanghai.

title: A fun and expensive area
content: Had dinner one night in this area and it reminded me of home (EU) and that was great and all. But all in all one does not travel to the other end of world to experience home.

title: Great ambiance
content: When you go to Shanghai, this is a place not to be missed, make sure you visit all the allies and have dinner at one of the French, Italian or may be just some beer at the German Oktoberfest style restaurants.

title: Interesting to wonder around
content: We used one of the suggested walks within our DK guide book to navigate through the French Concession and added our own extension on the end. I'd highly recommend that you either plan a walk before heading to the French Concession or take a map with you, so you can navigate the streets to your advantage.

title: Good area for dinner
content: This area have a lot of bar and restaurant, good palace for meet friends here and after that you can also do some shopping!!

title: Wonderful place to walk around
content: The French Concession covers a big area so we followed a walking tour which I had downloaded from Frommer's Shanghai website. This made us go down lots of different streets. A highlight was visiting Zhou En Lai's home and learning a bit more about the early days of the Communist Party. There are lots of lovely restaurants and little shops - altogether it is a wonderful place to walk around. Shady footpaths. Lovely buildings.

title: beautiful and interesting
content: We took the Newman Tours walking tour of the French Concession. I would recommend this for sure. You can look at buildings, but hearing about the history and and the interesting characters makes it so much more worth while.

title: Boring
content: Maybe I missed something? Yes there are trees on the streets, but also lots of traffic and those pesky horns blasting all the time. Yes there is the odd piece of worthy architecture but on the whole (in my opinion) there are far more interesting places to visit in Shanghai, with equally nice shopping experiences if that is what you are after. I'm afraid the French concession - which I had been anticipating for weeks - left me totally unimpressed.

title: Lovable
content: You can think that you will like it because being a western on the east, you like what is resemblable to you, but don't mess up, it is simply beautiful and you will find a lot of upscale stores and nice restaurants. Don't skip it.

title: Everybody will love it
content: So nice architecture, lovely mix of west and est, nice small shops, lot of bars and restaurants, foot massage, massage etc.

title: Beautiful architecture
content: The former French Concession of shanghai cover a large area in the center of town. more notably are: Julu Rd to the north and Huaihai Rd.

title: Really Unique Side of Shanghai
content: Definitely glad I stopped by this time. Shanghai has so many different neighborhoods, and none of them ever seem to be quite the same.

title: you will feel you have moved to france.
content: This is an area in Shanghai that was hard to find so get good directions first. The atmosphere is so completely different you will think you have moved. Go along enjoy a meal and a glass of wine and half a break from China for an hour or two!

title: Lively and colourful Shanghai
content: As the former French Concession area is quite extensive, I tend to break it down to small areas to explore. By all means walk down Huaihai Lu (the main drag) but it's the side streets that are most interesting.

title: Great shopping and dining
content: Plan to spend an afternoon in the boutiques!! We had a great Chinese lunch. Look fir the Shanghai Rang and Annabel Lee stores. Luxurious and interesting.

title: Free tour guide services - nonprofit
content: In Shanghai, you can check out French concession with friendly Shanghai Greeters. It's under Global Greeter Network organisation and those volunteers will show you around Shanghai by walking around it. Let you know where locals eat and shop. www.shanghaigreeters.com

title: I lived here
content: Really nice place. Many casual cafes, wine bars... great hang out spot!

title: A wonderful French influenced area
content: Easily accessed via subway, we started our day at Qiboa "water town" and took line 9 back to the Dapuqiao station to spend the afternoon walking the streets of the French Concession, reminiscent of the tree-lined neighborhoods of Paris. We even heard Parisian music playing from several establishments along our stroll.

title: I live there..
content: Just a wonderful place, like an island in the middle of the city.

title: Picturesque
content: This area is being extensively refurbished. In places still looking a bit jaded (sorry about that) but lots of new shopping malls and upgrades of building taking place. Structure being designed which are in keeping with french colonial style so it is possible to foresee that, when completed, the whole area will be very, very impressive. Worth a visit. try the Johnnie Walker shop!

title: Love it
content: I have lived in the Former French Concession for 2 years. It's a great place to explore shops and restaurants. There is always something popping up on Changle Lu (lots of unique fashion stores), Yongjia Lu (restaurants), and Yongkang Lu (great for nightlife). You can even stroll down Huaihai to get your conventional shopping on (H&M, Mango, Zara)... And the French planted all the trees along the streets back when they owned this section of Shanghai during imperialism. It's a great mix of culture!

title: An excellent place to walk
content: The old French concession is many square miles in size. Many of its buildings were built in the early 20th century. The plane tree lined boulevards are beautiful areas to walk. The residents once were the French but now are local Chinese. Do not miss Fuxing Park and people practicing tai chi and sword dances

title: A little bit of home
content: Having lived in China for years we always visiting the French Concession Area for a bit of Western culture. Good place for western food, shopping and art. Five years ago the area was little known and so quieter but now it has grown and become very busy. Still worth a visit but definitely not the cheapest place to shop in Shanghai.

title: The Alleyways off Taikang Road
content: We 'discovered' the alleyways by accident, really, as we walked along Taikang Road and they were Wonderful! A multitude of little shops, from souvenir, to clothing, to art, to cafes to...you name it! are just off Taikang Road. We visited the area twice while we were in Shanghai. The 1st was on a Sunday morning...as the area was recommended by the HELPFUL Concierge at the Peace Hotel...and the area was not crowded at all. When we 'returned' with a friend the following Friday, late morning...it was EXTREMELY crowded...so we left and walked over to a quieter, and more Upmarket, area near Fuxing Park ( a LOVELY place to visit). Be sure to Bargain "hard" in the alleyway shops....as the price CAN come down considerably! Smile! Definitely a FUN area to visit!

title: stick to the side-streets if you want a better experience
content: We've been here a few times and have never been that impressed. It's mostly been taken over by upscale brand stores. You could easily be in any city when you're walking around in this part of town, and I always find that it lacks much uniqueness or character. Taking some of the alleyways off the main road will get you to much better restaurants and shopping, and far less tourism.

title: Feels like Europe
content: This is a nice French qtr, that features a large pedestrian street, with a large selection of nice restaurants, café. A very continental hang out, very pleasant a good place to stop and grab a bite or coffee.

title: Why not go?
content: CROWDED........popular with tourists and locals alike....interesting architecture and history......now many restaurants and shops there....Keep your "gang" together as it is easy to lose each other in the hustle and bustle.......we had a very good lunch there.......

title: Wear comfy shoes...
content: Lovely roads lined with gorgeous leafy trees. It's a haven even in the hot weather because of the trees. Many roads to explore, cafes to stop by and boutiques. Wear comfy shoes. Start from the parks near Xintiandi and make your way down Nanchang road. There are plenty of boutiques also along Jili road, Anfu road. Plan on spending at least a few days just taking a leisurely walk around different areas in the French Concession.

title: An endless resource of interest
content: I truly believe that you could spend a lifetime exploring the French Concession in Shanghai. In fact, if you're smart, you will try to find accommodation to your liking in it - there is everything from B&Bs to smart hotels to be found there. It is quite large and its streets are constantly changing. In the hot weather, the trees make for a cooler place to walk. Food and drink? Everything from swanky European bars, places to have a beer at the side of the road, street-vensors selling pork buns or Shanghai pancakes, fine-dining restaurants, hole-in-the-wall dumpling shops with just a dozen seats or so. European coffee shops - traditional Chinese tea-houses and everything in between. Lots of fine art-nouveau architecture. Bookshops, art shops. Grannies sitting at the end of their alleyways gossiping. It's got everything! Wonderful!

title: Fancy neighborhood
content: If you want to see expensive stuff and fancy people, this is the place to go. Lots of restaurants and nightlife. During the day, the buildings are interesting to visit.

title: Lovely area to wander
content: We went to the French concession area with friends it was lovely. Great little curios and touristy shops, plenty of restaurants and bars. From there we walked the general streets and through the housing areas. It was really pretty big maple trees lining the roads, old houses and ones you can go into to look at that belonged to generals etc.

title: Interesting area
content: Apparently this is the oldest part of Shanghai, where the buildings have been turned into loads of restaurants etc, plus the pretty traditional styled building in the middle of a Koi filled lake, which is also the home to turtles. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Not what I expected
content: I think I had some romantic image of this area.  I had high expectations and planned to spend much time...

title: Great shopping and restaurants
content: This area is great for tourists wanting to shop and eat from different cultures. It is also central and easy...

title: Great walking and eating area
content: Again, identifying places mentioned in many novels was great.  Fantastic area for eating all different cusines. A must visit area...

title: Unique and chic
content: The street stores are quaint and chic.  The place, warm and welcoming.  The canopy trees and the architecture are a...

title: There are some cute streets and good vibes
content: Okay, if you are coming from a cute place, don't expect much. But after staying in Shanghai for 2 weeks,...

title: nice area
content: high end fashion street with plenty of nice cafe  and design shops nothing too impressive but the vegetarian restaurant "Lucky...

title: nice area
content: it was nice but expensive. plenty of eating joints offering different cuisines. good for the international traveler.

title: Great selection of restaurants and bas
content: Interesting architecture on some of these beautiful buildings and good selection of restaurants. Easy to get to from most places

title: visit if you have time
content: visit if you have time.good for leisure.nice to dine,free walk way. costly market.easy transport,popular among the tourists.

title: Walk, Dine and Enjoy
content: Its a good historical place with great Architecture, which are now converted to Restaurants, Bars and Cafe, Its a good place to do a pub crawl. We been to this place atleast couple of time as it was very close to our office and enjoyed each time. Must Try Eel and Frog dishes here.

title: old Shanghai
content: Shanghai is my preffered city in China because it does have a lot of history - The old French Concession are part of it and it is always a relief to have a café in one of the small cafées and just stroll around - feels like a European City and a nice 1 - 2 hour escape from modern bustling China City Life

title: Historical place!
content: It worth to visit! A busy shopping street which consist of Xintiandi and Tian Zi Fang, extremely popular shopping and dining spots for tourists. excellent architecture, cool and trendy shops and restaurants, and a lot of nice cafes. You will experience it properly is to walk and soak it all in.

title: Good history lesson
content: We took a half-day minivan tour through our hotel that took us to the French concession and some other tourist spots in downtown Shanghai. It was interesting to learn the history, but one trip was fine.

title: Nostalgic enough an experience to visit
content: Nice to stroll around and end up in one of the interesting joints for an exciting meal. You can visit over and over again and walk the streets you are bound to find new stuff

title: A flavor of old colonies
content: Although the full flavor has probably greatly disappeared, you still clearly feel you enter another Shanghai when crossing the road which determines the northern boundary. Still a real french flavor, old platanes, cafes all along the streets, old homes with typical colonial spirit ... Great place to see to hide a few hours from the hastle of the city ...

title: take a tour with one of the guides of the community center in Shanghai
content: this is the best way to get a glimpse of all what the former french concession has to offer.

title: nice at night
content: Quite a few bars and clubs there.Make sure you go to M2 nightclub. Great place for a party! Quite a few foreigners there .

title: Nice to visit
content: Expensive to eat and shop but great atmosphere. Coffee and cheesecake costs more than the average dinner elsewhere in the city.

title: A piece of France in China
content: Endless passages filled with little shops with interesting items to purchase(not so cheap though),a lot of restaurants with variety so a great place to chill out and have dinner and some wine also lots of tourists!A definite must see!

title: French Concession
content: A definate must for any 1st time (and repeat) visitor to Shanghai. However, keep in mind that this is now the French Concession of yesteryear. Many of the resturants and coffee shops will seem like home to most visitors. However, it's still a stop for a walk-about, a meal, coffee or a drink. What else do uou want.

title: Well worth a mosey
content: Just a great area to walk around. Some streets like have really nice restauraunts & shops. I recommend AnFu Road and the area around Ferguson Lane

title: Excellent area to wine and dine.
content: We liked this lively area, especially in the evening. It was a great eat outside a watch tourists and locals go by. It is not cheap, however,mso chose carefully.

title: A romantic place
content: Shanghai is a city full of surprises. This Old French quartier latin, is a small área full of narrow alleys,with cozy restaurant , stores for souvenirs and many handcrafts, like paintings , pictures and so on , with that french charm .

title: So much architecture - many beautiful streets
content: Really worth the time to explore. Helpfully, historic places have plaques that describe them, including names of architects, purpose for which built etc. It's easy to see why Shanghai was a popular city with westerners all those decades ago.

title: Vive L'Europe - Vive la France (in China)!
content: Seeing Shanghai is Le Must of each China visitor! Yet, you have not seen Shanghai without having smelled the flavor of La France in the French Concession.

title: Great boutiques and dining options
content: It is a lovely area and has charming boutiques and tree lined streets. There were some nice places around Fumin Rd

title: I keep coming back
content: These are easily my favorite streets and neighborhoods to wander whenever I'm in Shanghai. Every step holds a new treasure. Following the walking tour book is especially enjoyable.

title: Very Hip Place to be Seen
content: Great row of excellent dining restaurants. Very eclectic with young affluent Shanghai yuppies with many business persons.

title: nice area
content: ...you can just walk, there are small parks, small side streets with a lot of trees. Very nice independent cafes, shops and Restaurants. Jiashan Market ist the eco, organic area , with an eco organic café/Restaurant at the side street of Shaanxi nan lu (5 Minutes walk from the metro). In the night you can go clubbing at the "Shelter" an independent Night club, more for people who like alternative clubs with Drum and Bass, or House Music , also Electronic Music ! So, much to see and do in this area.....

title: These boots were made for walking
content: Take a day to explore the old French Concession on foot. Beautiful cypress tree lined shady streets from a long lost era in time. Many old French buildings still standing and of course now plenty of other quite modern retail buzz of all kinds at all prices.

title: Colonial era houses surrounded by the new Shanghai
content: This is a charming part of town away from noisy streets when you can imagine how Shanghai looked in colonial times.

title: historical part of Shanghai
content: Of course you can see lots of western architectures in Europe, so how can you imagine western style buildings sitting in a Chinese city? -- Contrast is a sort of beauty I believe.

title: Best atmosphere in town!
content: Definitely THE place to go if you are French and for all us non-french people out there still an awesome place to visit. Bakerys and cafés all around you and the only place which looks a little bit ecofriendly. If you got a day of from visiting museums be sure to walk though the french concession and let it amaze you!

title: A nice place for a drink on a terrasse
content: Being french and ending our 2 weeks chinese trip in Shanghai visiting among other the french concession: it was a nice surprise. The planetrees are giving this wonderful smell and the cafés and their terrasse are giving a really nice atmosphere!

title: great place for drink with friend!
content: this is quite broad area so you need to find good spots to enjoy your time there! definitely you can find nice bars here where you can find lot of foreigners.

title: Enjoy the ambience of Shanghai's history
content: The former French Concession is one of the most fascinating areas in Shanghai, with lovely tree lined streets full of shops, restaurants and bakeries. It is a large area, and every street has its own character, so plan to spend a day wandering and exploring. Although there are some large stores full of luxury goods, there are streets lined with interesting and unusual clothing, books and gifts. The restaurants range from Western (Italian, Mexican, Mr. Pancake) to Asian (Japanese, Thai) to a wide variety of Chinese, from high end dining rooms to food fairs where you can find noodles and dumplings. There are lots of alleys to wander through and watch the day to day Shanghai lifestyle. I recommend that you pick out a few key streets, shops, historical sights or restaurants from a guidebook, and use these to give direction to a day experiencing this neighborhood.

title: nice place to walk around
content: you can see how the french lived here end 1800 th's (I believe)

title: Not even a crossiant
content: Ok, I knew it wasn't French anymore but we went there for breakfast hoping for a coffee and crossiant. Nothing was open until 10 and even the it was restaurant food not cafe. The Site of the First CCP congress was cheap and interesting.

title: Lovely walk through history
content: It was a walk through history walking through the old French concession. Small shops

title: Worth a walk Round.
content: I was glad to see this, but it was not as interesting as i had hoped. It is hard to find the interesting parts.

title: So amazingly crowded
content: So crowded when we visited, you could hardly move. Some of the shops looked great, but impossible to get near, let alone actually get in :) people all seemed to be having a fun time, clearly a regular meeting place.

title: The Best of Shanghai
content: What gives Shanghai its charm and allure is the former French Concession. Most of the neighborhoods are still in tact though the residents do not live as grand as in the past. Several families may now occupy one house. Nevertheless, it is possible to imagine what life must have been like here in the fascinating 1920s and 30s when Shanghai was at its height in debauchery and intrigue. The best way to explore the former French Concession is to follow some prescribed walks in a series of Wallks Books which are available at gift shops or English book shops.

title: Expected More
content: This is a beautiful area in Shanghai, with lots of shops and restaurants - but I expected more history. The buildings were lovely and it's a nice tree lined area... but it was just another commercial area. Good for dinner and shopping.

title: The nicest part of the city, bar none.
content: The French Concession is a tree lined, human scale, walkable oasis in this massive concrete jungle. Full of small shops, trendy restaurants, cool bars, clubs and just interesting little nooks and alleys, you could spend a week wandering around here and only scratch the surface.

title: Good old Shanghai
content: If you want to have an idea of Old Shanghai, this is the place. Stop at Fuxing Park for at least 30-45 minutes for a stroll to see how the retired spend their afternoons or mornings during weekdays and families during the weekend. After doing your walking exercise to visit this area, stop at Xintiandi with hundreds of restaurants.

title: Real charm
content: For a moment you can almost forget you are in the bustling metropolis of Shanghai. Allow yourself that moment.

title: Calm and cosy district
content: Just a few step away from the skyscapers and you are in a cosy district with nice buildings and friendly atmosphere.

title: Too much traffic
content: This did not really live up to my expectations. Perhaps my view is jaded by the fact I visited this area on a very hot humid day when there was lots of traffic and people. The pollution was very noticeable.

title: Brief Visit
content: I wish I had more time to visit this area. Great place to check out the architecture and history of Shanghai. A group of my young friends went to the clubs later that night and had lots of fun. They were able to catch a cab back to our less than centrally located hotel so that was a plus.

title: Not really a day out in China, more a glimpse at a colonial past and a boozy western style night out
content: A large leafy residential area in "downtown" Shanghai. If you are a fan of turn of the century colonial architecture and modern Chinese history you will just love wandering the streets imagining what it was like for the ex-pat community pre 1930. Alternatively you can join the current ex-pat community drinking till 4am and pretend you are not in China at all. The choice is yours!

title: Not a site, but an area
content: Take the architectural tour. It is very expensive, but the tour is informative, and fascinating! Just google it, I think there is just one (and in English!)

title: nothing to write home about
content: this area was part of my City Tour . There are many designer shops and restaurant in the area. this area has a European feel about it. Nice place for a Romantic Coffee. i did not enjoy cause i was single !!!!!!

title: Hard to find
content: Most maps do not list the French Concesssion. However, we found an American restaurant there which was very good although expensive for China, and a number of International visitors hanging out there.

title: Great day or night..
content: I visited this site twice; on both a day and night tour. I enjoyed them both. The night time was more upbeat, lively and more comfortable as the weather was breezy and had cooled from the 95degree high of the day. Great restaurants and music.

title: Lovely if you steer clear of the expat strip
content: It seems that most caucasian tourists come to the former French Concession to drink, smoke, litter the street and congregate in homogenous groups.

title: French Glamour Chinois!
content: Just one long afternoon is not enough! Will go there in a heart beat! Loved to find the empty alleys with so much French old time history....not much left of course....but a "quartier alla francaise"in the shopping area of Shanghai

title: C'est bon or hao no matter the language
content: Just head to Tourist Information office in Wuking Road and they will provide you with an easy 40 minute walking map (free).

content: The Former French Concession is a refreshingly green and leafy area in Shanghai, full of charming side-streets, Parisian cafés and boutiques. It's a great place to spend a day - make sure not to miss out on Fuxing Park and Taixang Rd/Tianzifang

title: Lovely!
content: The architecture and streets lined with plane trees reminded us of France! We loved it! We would have liked to explore more but didn't have time. Half a day would be about right.

If you take a Shanghai city tour package, it is generally a last location they would take you to.

title: Felt I was in Paris
content: This is just a neighbourhood in Shanghai but I give it a high rating because it reminds me of a residential area in Paris. We did a walk through the area starting from Fuxing park and you can really feel the difference compared to other areas in Shanghai. Fuxing park is a nice green oasis with a formal French gardens, fountains, and old men playing checkers. The street are lined with Sycamore trees and the buildings are modeled after the french style of an inner courtyard with walls that face the street. An open gate will give you a glimpse of a nice compound with green grass and childrens bicycles. There are also nice cafes and boutiques

title: Beautiful location
content: I stayed with a friend at the Hotel Regal International in  Hengshan Road for 7 days .Surrounded by beautiful tree lined streets and parks  you feel a world away from the hustle and bustle of the rest of Shanghai. Walking distance to food,bars,parks and everything...

title: worth spending time here
content: The French quarter is a very quaint part of Shanghai which is very european in flavour. The trees lining the streets, the architecture, is all very european. There are many nice cafes in this neighbourhood and it is a pleasant place to walk about to take in the ambiance.

title: Ok
content: It's an ok area to walk around but there's really nothing special about it. It is as ugly as the rest of this city and overpriced beyond reason. If you know how to navigate sidewalks overtaken by motorbikes and don't mind breathing extremely polluted air and on top of that paying 8-9 bucks for a coffee or a bad beer, then sure it is for you. Enjoy! Welcome to China!

title: To meet other expats
content: My friend lives nearby and asked me to meet her. I travelled on the metro. I was delightfully surprised by the tree lined streets and the amount of western type restaurants and cafes to choose from. I also liked the shops, many different from other areas in Shanghai. If you want to meet other expats this is where you will find them. Many great places for breakfasts.

title: Where are the French?
content: We covered about 30% of this district during a 2-hour walk. It was very pleasant with cute boutiques and restaurants interspersed among clean well-maintained low-rise buildings, many in brick, and with a sort of Chelsea (London) or Tribeca (Manhattan) feel to them. Here and there a tower block or a large department store, or even a small chic commercial mall, can be found. The avenues are quite wide and well endowed with trees, and there is more space given over to parks than in the other districts we visited in this city. As for being French, the only sign of their presence was in the Louis Vuitton and Hermes outlets we came across from time to time. If, indeed, a concession was given here to the French at one time, it has long since been taken back.

title: Très Chi-Chi
content: This is all about heritage architecture repurposed as façades for expensive boutiques.

title: charming!
content: I have lived in the French Concession since i moved to Shanghai, it fells like living in a small village, the narrow streets, the little shops. great place to shop, eat, walk, drink. there are some wonderul streets like Wukang Road, Nanchang Road, Anfu Road. a must for any visitor to Shanghai!

title: Xintiandi one of my favorite places in Shanghai
content: I had read about Xintiandi area in the French Concession, but it exceeded my expectations. Maybe because it was Christmas time, and the decorations were so nice...This places is a must for dinner time with a nice walk and shopping if you will. To fully enjoy the whole area you may need 3 hours or more, as the little village area is connected to 2 consecutive huge shopping mall, so nice and worth it to walk.

title: Interesting little slice of Shanghai
content: Loved this little old world section of Shanghai. Lots of cute little shops and fun restaurants. A definite visit while in Shanghai.

title: Meh
content: I can't see what all the shouting was about. It was mostly a restaurant district with a few overpriced trinkets for sale. We did enjoy the buildings, but they were not breathtaking. The most interesting place we saw looked like it had been an old home. It is now a private club and not open to the sans culottes.

title: An absolute must!
content: great dynamic in this area - full of history mixed with lots of creative up-and-coming designers. A great place to search for gifts for family and friends too, many small shops to check out.

title: nicest place in Shanghai
content: nice streets,full of  little shops really nice to have a walk around in Charming streets, cafés and boutiques. Higly recommended

title: Food and music
content: Great place for westerners to find our kind of food and enjoy some blues while your dining at the bar or outside. Be aware of the Hookers that hang here too. Very DANGEROUS if your silly enough.

title: Great gatherings
content: Beautiful buzzing area during the day and night! Lovely eating places - try The Fountain for the best Tapas! Area is very clean and easy to get taxis.

title: Brilliant place
content: This is an awesome awesome place to hang out. Just Rent a bike and wander around. Some great food, great drinking places in a lovely set up.

title: Paris in Shanghai
content: This is a great place to wander around. We visited twice, one day was cold and windy, the other cool with the sun breaking through the clouds. On each occasion the area was packed with shoppers, and families strolling around, Prices in the shops tend to be expensive but the atmosphere of the place is terrific.

title: nice change of pace
content: really liked going here. very different from day to night. lots of different style bars/restaurants. a german beer garden. also a great spanish/italian style cafe with great tiramisu and rice pudding. like soho in nyc. cute shops and nice to walk around on a warm day. nice architecture. here is where i saw the most non-asian people in china. different styles of food, if you're tired of chinese

title: Definitely one of the best places in Shanghai
content: The French Concession has a very different feel to it and is a great place to just walk around in. It has many interesting shops and cafes that you can meet up with people in, or just hang around. Lot's of shopping opportunities and great restaurants to explore and try. You can easily spend an entire day there. Highly recommended.

title: small alleys
content: This place is very cool but It is also very touristic. Many small shops and restaurants. Very arty too.

title: My favourite part of Shanghai
content: When it's an option, I choose to stay in or around the French Concession. The abundance of shopping options and fantastic restaurants on those shady, narrow streets just can't be beaten.

title: Favourite Place in Shanghai
content: The Former French Concession is a refreshingly green and leafy area in Shanghai, full of charming side-streets, Parisian cafés and boutiques. It's a great place to spend a day - make sure not to miss out on Fuxing Park and Taixang Rd/Tianzifang

title: Spend a Day Here
content: Fabulous area of Shopping in little boutiques and outdoor vendors. In good weather it would be great. We went during rain and snow but still enjoyed the shops and dining.

title: Great spot
content: After a couple of weeks in China just waht we needed. Great setting, nice shopping and great dining options with plenty of al fresco seating. Too crowded though.

title: Nice part of town.
content: Lovely part of Shanghai. Went to the propaganda poster museum here. It was a bit of a walk from the nearest metro, but walking through the french concession made it a nice walk.

title: A wonderful part of Shanghai to wander around
content: A mixture of the expensive and the cheap but set in a lovely area with overhanging trees along many roads, parks, restaurants and many retail clothing shops. Take your time to take in the sights with tai chi, dancing and singing the parks and a coffee at one of the many cafes.

title: Artistic, Great food & ambience
content: Probably Shanghai’s most picturesque neighborhood.. I happened to visit this area for dinner on a freezing cold December evening, but once you get their, the ambience the cool quotient of the place can warm the cockles of even a die hard deep freezer. The place boasts of colonial-style mansions, tree-lined streets, and lovely parks with a plethora of eating out cafes, bistros, pubs, walking streets and with its multicultural mix of beautiful people the setting can be quite romantic for an evening out with the better half or just some chilling out with friends. We dined at the Latina Brazilian restaurant - where they serve you awesome BBQ meats on swords and skewers with prime cuts and they serve you till you don't ask them to stop by turning over your little table mat sign that says.."stop" the area is a must visit for its sheer charm and laid back excitment. you can simply walk about or sit out at the cafes for an amazing experience within this city.

title: Cool European vibe
content: Western food and lots of westerners. Beautiful trees, streets and buildings. Feels like a oasis when far away from home.

title: Lovely but boring
content: Really nice to look at the old English, French area of Shanghai but that's all you can do, no real activities or tours here.

title: Nice!
content: What a nice area. Have a wander around, but make sure you go early in the morning. There are a lot of expats in this area, and a lot of cafes you can sit in - so the earlier the better!

title: Love it
content: Great place, it is relaxing and calls for a casual stroll when you want to avoid the hustle and bustle of Shanghai's city life. It feels like you might even be in Europe!

title: A must
content: You haven't seen Shanghai if you miss this. It's pretty much all that is left of the old style city and gives an idea of colonial times - perhaps not to be celebrated for many reasons, but the architecture and 'homliness' is great. Some superb little bistro restaurants...

title: Nice place for a stroll
content: Good place for a quiet stroll, artsy cafes and boutiques. A gd space to escape the hustle bustle of the city, almost like a city not quite in China, until you hear them speaking of course..hah the cafes looked really beautiful so safe some space...

title: unique
content: one of the most unique eperiences in shanghai is to take a walk inthe old part of the townwith buildings from 1900's as well as new renoatios an buildings from today,

title: Gorgeous area
content: This area of Shanghai is a must for any visitor. There are lovely European style houses and shopping areas that recall a modern European city. Most chains can be found around here as well for the homesick. I also visited the M50 art area which I believe is in the French Concession and it was amazing. I could have spent all day there.

title: Village within a mega metropolis
content: Wonderful section of town that combines traditional Europeon and Chinese architecture with tree lined streets. Mix in chaotic traffic and the result is modern Shanghai's most desirable residential area ( with prices to prove it).

title: "New" Shanghai
content: Quaint streets and beautiful architecture. Too bad any essence of its prior history has been revitalized. In it's place are coffee shops and boutiques catering to tourists, expats and the nouveau rich.

title: Awesome Walking Neighborhood
content: This was the highlight of my trip to Shanghai. This is a great neighborhood to walk and explore. The tree lined streets are beautiful, and there are a ton of shops, cafes and parks to wander around.

title: Beautiful area worth exploring
